qas.question: Are there parking fees at this hotel?

answers.text: Jun 15 2009 everyone talking about charge for parking When you check into the 4 Queens, if you tell the front desk you will be using their parking garage, there will be no charge for parking.

paragraphs.context: Jun 15 2009 everyone talking about charge for parking When you check into the 4 Queens, if you tell the front desk you will be using their parking garage, there will be no charge for parking. They give you a "sign" to put on your dash & when you go to leave the garage the parking attendant will see the "sign" and have you fill out a small piece of paper. The use this for records & there is no charge to your room for parking. We stayed for almost 1 week. Without exaggerating we probably left the parking garage 20-30 times over our stay & never had a charge for it. If you are not staying at the hotel or do not tell them when you check in that you will be parking a car, there is a $3 charge for the garage.

qas.question: Are there parking fees at this hotel?

answers.text: Most of the hotels have free parking, so we did not incur any additional parking costs.

paragraphs.context: Jun 19 2008 Thoroughly enjoyed our stay As a family of 5 with teenagers, we were thrilled to find a place where we could stay and spread out a little. We were just a block or two off the strip - in a prime location - right in the middle. We rented a car at the airport so we could do some side trips, so we did not actually walk to the strip. Most of the hotels have free parking, so we did not incur any additional parking costs. Our condo was fabulous behind gates with a guard, and underground parking with a remote for the gates. The condo was totally redone with travertine floors, granite in the kitchen as well as stainless appliances, modern furnishings and very comfortable beds. With three TV's, there was plenty of opportunties for different TV shows and quiet naps at the same time. We never got a chance to spend time at the pool, but it was lovely. We will definately stay here again - it was fabulous, and away from the madness of the strip.

answers.text: When we checked out the bags were carried to the parking garage next door.

paragraphs.context: May 2 2008 Stressless Stay at Hampton I stayed with my wife 2 nights. Staff was excellent. We checked our bags before the room was ready. When we checked out the bags were carried to the parking garage next door. The parking rate was discounted for guests. Get your parking stub validated by the hotel before picking up the car. The room was spacious. We were on the 8th Avenue side 10th floor. I would ask for the other side opposite 8th Ave to get a quieter room. The breakfast was very good and the staff worked hard to keep the food items full and the area clean. The location was perfect. We saw the Jersey Boys and the theater was around the corner on 52 st. 2 minute walk. Learn as much as you can about the transportation system. The bus and subways will save you a lot of walking and time.

answers.text: If you really do not know where to park (which would be surprising to me) then the hotel can still offer you a day-pass at a nearby parking lot for Can-$ 10.

paragraphs.context: May 5 2009 Good inexpensive choice We truly enjoyed staying at the Viger Hotel. It's in a very central location (ca 10 Min to the Basilica and the Old Montreal Downtown) and has very polite and good English-speaking service. The outside looks of the hotel and the rooms themselves are not ultra-luxurious, so if you look for luxury you may need to go somewhere else (and pay considerably more). For us, however, it was the perfect choice and the "petite dejeuner" (continental breakfast) sufficient for a good start in the morning. Parking was also easily found around the hotel (we parked on a Friday evening and there is free parking then available all around the hotel till Monday morning). If you really do not know where to park (which would be surprising to me) then the hotel can still offer you a day-pass at a nearby parking lot for Can-$ 10. The Wifi-internet was fast and reliable.

answers.text: We had to go park in a parking structure about 3 or 4 blocks away for $20 a day!

paragraphs.context: Oct 13 2007 Good Price for San Francisco but no where to park! Visited the Marinna Inn during our August 2007 trip. Good value for San Francisco. Smallish rooms on busy Lombard Street does provide some noise. If that is a problem for you, then look somewhere else. It was not for us, we are hard sleepers. The only real problem with this place is huge! There is No place to park. There are a few street parking spots available, but they are never available! We had to go park in a parking structure about 3 or 4 blocks away for $20 a day! So any money we saved by finding this place, we paid even more after paying for parking. I would recommend this place if you have no car to park, because it is a good value for this pricey city. But, if you have a car, please do not waste your time. There are many, many places on Lombard Street that have parking garages at there location for free.

The Travelodge looked OK on TripAdvisor so booked the 3 nights I needed. Arrived before 12:00 and was told early check-in could only be investigated after 12:00, was not guaranteed, and would cost GBP10 extra if available. The place was not full, so there could well have been rooms available, but the horrible woman on the front desk was totally unhelpful. Once in, found the room clean but incredibly basic, with basically nothing in it that couldn't be nailed down. The parking was fine, but in all other respects, it was just barely acceptable.

paragraphs.context: Jul 15 2009 Average Hotel I stayed at the Marriott O'Hare in July 2009. Here are the pluses and minuses:Pluses - courteous staff at the front desk, concierge and meeting room support; good convenient location and easy to get to and from airport; decent restaurant and bar, relatively good ventilation and bed in room. Minuses - Room a bit worn with bathroom needing updating (no fan, chipping paint), overnight parking (self parking in a big aging parking lot) a complete ripoff at $24/night. This is how much I pay to park per day inside the parking structure right next to Portland Airport. Would I stay here again? Maybe.

qas.question: Are there parking fees at this hotel?

answers.text: The bad first: We stayed two nights and were shocked by the cost of parking at the hotel - $38 a day.

paragraphs.context: Aug 30 2006 Good location The bad first: We stayed two nights and were shocked by the cost of parking at the hotel - $38 a day. We did so anyway, since we were told by the valet that nearby outdoor parking lots required us to move the car out at 6:30 every morning and there was no street parking available. We did not want the hassle. Now for the good: The hotel is located in a busy area of downtown but not in the center which is a 10 minute walk. The decor of the lobby was nice and clean and check -in was easy. Our room did not have a view but it was comfortable and cozy. The concierge was friendly and helpful in recommending nearby places to eat and we enjoyed getting our coffee at the downstairs Starbucks every morning. Overall, we had an enjoyable stay, except for the parking fee sticker shock. The best thing to do is not to drive into downtown San Francisco if possible. We would stay here again if we did not drive.

paragraphs.context: Sep 14 2004 Parking is more expensive than the daily rental charge for an SUV ... Stayed at the Nikko Sept. 8th-12th and was impressed by the decor of the hotel. Very nice and very safe. Checked for room keys after 11:00 pm. The room itself was very small BUT the bathroom was HUGE!!! Separate bathtub and shower stall. Hardly any amenities though i.e. free high speed wireless internet, only one restaurant choice(pricey), parking was OUTRAGEOUS!! It was more expensive to park than to rent the SUV. I know parking is very expensive in the city but...$45 per day is a rip-off!!! Other than that, I thought the hotel was very nice and clean.

qas.question: Are there parking fees at this hotel?

answers.text: The parking at the actual hotel was 48 dollars a night... OUCH!

paragraphs.context: May 21 2009 Great location! Stayed at the Avenue Hotel in May. I wouldn't have been able to afford this place if I booked right on the actual hotel website. I went through booking.com and got the room (2 queen sized beds on the 22nd floor) for only $99 bucks a night!Great location though. We walked everywhere! Room was clean and the view was pretty awesome. It was great to have The Elephant and Castle (the Pub) right in the lobby of the hotel, they had an excellent beer selection, and super friendly staff. OH and the beds were really comfortable too! Parking, however, was a nightmare. The parking at the actual hotel was 48 dollars a night... OUCH! We elected to park at the public lot next door (the hospital lot) that was 34 dollars a night.. and for the 50 hours I was in Chicago it cost me $104 for parking. They charge PER DAY opposed to PER HOUR. Watch for this..

paragraphs.context: Apr 16 2009 Beware of this place! Upfront - we canceled our reservation after having to contact the Sheriton Headquarters. The hotel did not disclose the $43.00 (Almost $50 with tax) nightly rate for parking. I spoke with numerous people about it including the General Manager who hung up on me when I asked for the name and number of his supervisor in Sheraton. In my opinion, they tease you with a good rate, then hit you with the parking fees to make up for it. Other nearby hotels charge from $20-30 per night so be sure to facter in parking with the 15% tax rate on it when you are determining your cost. When I called the Sheraton in New York, they offered to reduce the parking rate slightly, but by then I was so upset about what seemed like a bait and switch practice, I canceled the reservation and stayed at another nearby hotel - who only charged $20 per night!Just a word of warning - you'll get little or no sympathy or accomodation if you complain about anything at this place.

answers.text: We frequently saw security checking the parking lots and walking the property.

paragraphs.context: May 16 2007 Great Stay We recently stayed there in a 2 bedroom suite for the mother's day weekend. When we checked in, it was quick and pleasant. Parking is in the back of the hotel/timeshare. They are currently buidling a parking garage. Since we are members of HGVC, we were placed on a high floor in tower two. Service was great. Everybody was very friendly, including the security officers driving around in the golf carts. We frequently saw security checking the parking lots and walking the property. This was a new buidling, so everything was in good condition. The only minus was that in our second bedroom, it appeared that someone had smoked in the room and you could smell the odor. It was mild, however still annoying, since the room was designated as a non-smoking room. Overall everything everybody said about the hotel is pretty much right on.

paragraphs.context: Sep 4 2009 Valet Parking Only! Give me a break! This is one of those traditional and centrally located landmark hotels, where I stayed due to favorable rates to my Company. Average room and comfortable bed, but the lack of alternative to valet parking was enough for me to not ever stay there again! They take your car and give you a tiny blue paper, which you cannot lose, otherwise they cannot find your car when you need it back. This is particularly annoying if you like to get in and out of the hotel multiple times a day, and need to go through this every single time they need to park or retrieve their car. As if this were not enough, the hotel will charge you an additional $26 CAN per day for parking! If staying in downtown Montreal, try something less fancy near Crescent Street, or in Old Town Montreal.

paragraphs.context: Aug 20 2007 Poor Service Me and my wife and 7 year old boy, stayed here for 4 nights in August 2007. We were in Montreal to watch the NASCAR race. It was a really hot week 35 Celcious. The air conditioning was terrible. 30 in our room. The service in the restaurant was horrible. We sat at our table for 45 minutes before we finally retreated back to our room hungry. Ordered KFC and it arrived in 15 minutes. Next night the room service was also terrible 1hour 45 minutes for wings and nachos. Could not fit my truck in the hotel parking, it is for vehicles less than 6 feet. Had to pay $20 A day for valet parking and one night my truck literally blocked the sidewalk. With some scratches. On the morning we were leaving I had to wait 2 hours to get my truck from the "valet" parking. Seems someone lost the keys to the vehicle in front of me which were all parked in an alley. Will never stay there again. At $230 a night I expected much more.

paragraphs.context: Sep 23 2007 Holiday Inn Select Montreal Went to Montreal to see Rush play at the Bell Center on Sept. 15. Stayed from the 14th to 16th. My two nights were average, no complaint, no compliments really, just what an average stay should be. It is located close enough to all the downtown places and I must say that Montreal seemed busy at all hours. My room was on a non smoking section and also had a note about no loud noise overnight, which was cool. Parking was the only issue. I found a spot but the underground garage is quite tight and does not seem to have too many spots so I left the car there and walked when needed. It did say that the hotel validated parking but still charged you so that was confusing. Validating to me meant that if you stayed at the place, it was free. Parking was $17 a day I believe, wow. So, all in all the place was fine, clean and acceptable and close enough to walk to stores and restaurants, even the Bell Center which is about a mile away.

paragraphs.context: Jul 14 2007 Reliable HI Express We stayed at the HI Express in Montreal during the period 09-13 Jul 07. This hotel is your standard Hi Express, but offers a laundry service, a small business centre with 2 computers and your standard breakfast of toast, cereal, tea, coffee & juice. All the staff are very friendly and helpful, as are the valet service members. Parking the car can be a problem as the hotel is located on the main road Rene Levesque and parking for the car to arrange the valet to park the car can at times be difficult, particularly during the period 1600 - 1700 hrs due to parking inspectors on the prowl. The room was of a very good standard, which contained a small kitchenette consisting of a medium sized fridge, microwave, sink etc. The bed was firm and comfortable and the bathroom of a decent size, with the water pressure being very good. The hotel is located near Chinatown, a 5 min walk and downtown a 10-15 min walk, depending on where you are heading.

Being that it was next to the China town gate (the fire escape litterally has you looking straight down to it) and walking distance to Union Square and all public transportation, this was a great price! Dont forget to ask about the $20 parking because if you dont you will pay up to $35 a day for parking....the hotel and parking garage have a contract together. There is not very good Wi-Fi in the hotel but there are tons of places nearby that offer it for free like the starbucks across the way and a nearby borders. I wanted to stay in a suite at one of the more smaller hotels (boutique) or even the Omni. The room was small and the bay view was very limited. Also, although we had reservations, when we arrived we only had a choice of the second floor or the 8th floor, which was the smoking floor. The hotel's lobby is huge and beautiful, but they truly did not splurge on the rooms. The reception stated that the hotel caters to conventions and that is exactly what it felt like. The BIGGEST DISAPPOINTMENT, however was the hefty valet parking (there is no self parking). Parking per night was $41.00 plus a tax, which ended up being almost $50.00. For a three night stay it cost us $147.00 total for parking alone. My next stay will NOT be at the Hyatt Regency with all of the other hotels available.

When we arrived at the hotel the valet told us (to our horror) that the charge for parking at the hotel was $57 per day! Given that Hotwire does not release the name of the hotel or charges for hotel "INCIDENTALS" (which apparently parking is considered) prior to paying for the room, we were taken completely by surprise. And given the non-refundable nature of Hotwire bookings, we were stuck paying the $114 to park for two nights. We fully expected to pay around $25/day for parking, but to charge more than half of the cost of the room itself is highway robbery.. The hotel was nice enough, but we won't be going back - EVER..

paragraphs.context: Sep 9 2008 Nice Hotel Great Location I would recommend the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf for anyone wanting to stay close to the Wharf area of San Francisco. It's centrally located to most activities. We needed parking for our rental car so we had the "Wharf experience" package that included parking and breakfast for two each day. You have your choice of odering off of the menu or the buffet. I would recommend the buffet. The breakfast was good, but I wouldn't have paid the menu price for it if it were not in our package. Our rate was $225/night incl. parking and breakfast (parking is normally $39/day and breakfast buffet $18/person). Room was very clean and quiet. As mentioned by others, there was not a tub, but we are shower people anyway so it did not matter.

qas.question: Are there parking fees at this hotel?

answers.text: Valet parking is offered for $35 a day or self parking for $22 a day.

paragraphs.context: Jul 9 2006 Great Location Average Hotel We stayed at the Chicago Downtown Marriott in late June. If your business takes you to the downtown area of Chicago, this place is a must. This hotel sits on Michigan Ave and within walking distance to all of the great shopping located on the Magnificient 5/8 mile. The hotel is average on appearance. The lobby offers a nice sit down area, bar, and coffee shop. The rooms are SMALL in comparison to other Marriott's we have stayed. The rooms did not have coffee makers or hair dryers. The pool was a lap pool only 12'x38'. There is a nice work out room that offers cycles and free weights. Valet parking is offered for $35 a day or self parking for $22 a day. We opted for self parking and found it to be a bargain as we walked or bussed to all of tourist locations. Overall, I would rate this hotel as average due to the small rooms, lack of a swimming pool, no coffee pots or hair dryers.

qas.question: Are there parking fees at this hotel?

answers.text: Just be aware... parking at the Sheraton is $42 per day.

paragraphs.context: Sep 23 2009 Good hotel if you travel with dogs The Sheraton offered the best rates on the wharf if you travel with dogs. HOWEVER, parking is very expensive. Just be aware... parking at the Sheraton is $42 per day. So for our 3 day stay, we paid an extra $126 for parking.

answers.text: $20+ parking per night included "in and out privileges" but, trust me, the parking is so tight (and virtually every spot is occupied daily!)

We reserved a "deluxe - panoramic bay view room" and it turned out just like the room reviewed here with pictures! $20+ parking per night included "in and out privileges" but, trust me, the parking is so tight (and virtually every spot is occupied daily!) you won't want to go in and out! (Also, spend the extra time and back in to your parking spot - you'll be thankfull you did when it is time to leave!)The free continental breakfast was really busy but kept fairly well stocked - nothing special. This location is great - very easy to walk to the wharf area - and all public transportation is close by. We really enjoyed our stay!Booking was via Expedia: 2 queen beds / 4 adults / $150 + = 204.78 total/night.

When we arrived, they only had a room with 1 king bed, so they gave us another room with a king for 1/2 price. They also gave us free parking for the mix-up, which was a nice bonus considering the usual price. Parking is $50 a night, but I had rented an SUV - $80 a night for oversized vehicles!! WOW!! There is a much cheaper parking garage just a block down the street - they can direct you to it. Anyhow, we were very pleased with our 2 rooms. Typical Marriott rooms. Good size and very comfortable. We decided to splurge on the breakfast buffet. It's expensive, but good. The bar/restaurant at the top has great views. The hotel is in a great location for shopping and restaurants. Highly recommended.

The minute we got there and was informed that the daily parking was $43 plus tax. Turned out to be $49 a night just for parking. That was pathetic. I've never parked anywhere in san francisco where parking was over $30. This ruined everything. I do not know , it did not seem like the parking fee caused any complaints. paragraphs.context: Apr 21 2009 Simple clean great location and FREE PARKING!!! The number one reason we chose to stay here was because the room rate included free parking. Other hotels can charge up to $50/day for parking, which completely destroys the cheap room rate. Very easy to get to (just exit off of I-90 and drive right to the door), room was clean, plenty of room for two, everything worked fine, bedding/towels were clean, decor was basic, view was OK, halls were sparse, elevators and stairs are very confusing, location is superb (right across the street from Rock and Roll McDonald's), continental breakfast was poor, parking may take a while to get your car out (the attendants will double-park cars), and the outside noise can be loud (sirens) at times if your window is open. Overall, not a place I would call elegant, but a great room based on location, price, and perfect for someone who just wants to use the room for sleeping and not hanging out.

paragraphs.context: Jul 22 2008 Would go back in a heartbeat! Situated between Old Montreal and downtown, this hotel was a perfect location for sightseeing and shopping. The staff person at the desk was very helpful, as we got to Montreal at 1:30 in the morning, and they even upgraded our room to a King size bed! The room itself was absolutely perfect, the bathroom spotless and in excellent repair. It had a marble shower as well as a bathtub,and it was all as clean as clean is possible. Even though it was a 'smoking' room, you could not smell any hint of cigarettes, and it was not stale from any artificial fragrance either. fyi, the internet usage in the business center is $5 per half hour, and the parking is $26 for the day(!), but do not drive in the city because the parking meters are even more expensive, and good luck finding parking. Take the 'metro' and buy yourself a day pass ($9) - it is well worth the money. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, and would go back in a heartbeat.

The internet connection was very slow and disconnected every couple of seconds, making it impossible to get any work done. We called for assistance and they said they would have the problem remidied within a few hours, but that never happened. Also, parking for this hotel was $39 per day. paragraphs.context: Mar 19 2009 Beware! Beware! Prices of rooms are left to the disgration of the very unfriendly staff. BEWARE... of hidden charges that will later show up on your credit card bill. Parking is not included in the price and you will NOT be warned of this. They will never mention you must pay an additional fee of $51.00 per night for parking. After you pay cash for your room and parking charges you will see on your next credit card statement charges for the parking garage in the amount of $51.00 which they will say was a tip. When you phone in for a reservation you are required to give a credit card number to hold the room and they will charge what ever they want to it without your permissionand you never have to present the card or signing anything.

paragraphs.context: Aug 13 2006 Worst Hotel Experience Worst Hotel I have ever stayed in. In an area of Montreal that did not look safe to walk in. Unfriendly staff, not a pleasant experience. Room looked out onto an abandoned gravel lot with garbage in it. Parking was not mentioned to be a fee when booked. Couldn't park on the street (all restricted areas). Was initially told that parking was around the corner and in thru the wire fence. Couldn't locate parking so asked again to different person. Was then told parking was $15 and not provided by the hotel. Small unsecured lot. I was hoping that my car would still be there in the morning!!! Did not get accomodations I had made a reservation for. Reserved a king, got a queen. Shower curtain was tied back with a piece of toilet paper. Old mini-bar hidden in tv cabinet. Breakfast consisted of Croissants, juice and coffee. Better than nothing. Will never stay at an Econolodge again if this is what to expect.

If you think about using the pool, DON'T. They should think about burrying it and putting more parking space over it. It was very dirty. The room was clean but had a strong smell of carpet deodorant floating around, but we vented it out quickly by opening the window. This is a good hotel for the budget-oriented traveller because of the cheap rates and because it is located in a good neighborhood (Cow's Hollow). You could access everything by using public transit, but much easier with a car.. Bring lots of quarters for metered parking when you visit the city!!!

Next getting from the parking to the hotel requires an evelator change and a bit of a walk to the front desk. If all that was not probelm enough, the hotel has no arrangement with the garage to allow for in and out priviledges. This means that trips to dinner etc. rack up significant parking charges. All in all its a very nice hotel but with a poor parking setup.

There were far too few handicapped spaces and virtually NO spaces of any kind if we got back after 10 PM. I would have to let her out and make her stand there by the door until I parked wqay in the back and came back to help her to our room. What is worse is that they are expanding. This means an even bigger parking problem This needs to be fixed!

paragraphs.context: Jul 20 2005 Good room fantastic location This is our third year staying at the Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf during the month of July. We travel from out of state each year for a family reunion and we have found this hotel to be a good value in a very expensive neighborhood. That said, here are some pointers if you pick this hotel for your Fisherman's Wharf location. The parking is pricey, currently running at about $32.00 a day. There are cheaper public parking lots nearby so you will need to self park to save on parking. The hotel's restaurant is OK but there are so many very good restaurants in the area that we always eat elsewhere (even breakfast). Ask for a room that has been refurbished. Maybe all the rooms are done now but last year some of our relatives had "old style" rooms. Our room this year was fantastic and faced the pool. We loved it as the bed was very, very comfortable and the room was quiet and restful.

answers.text: The parking garage was great too.

paragraphs.context: Jul 4 2009 Great hotel awesome service! Just stayed at the Palomar and had a wonderful experience. Our stay was from June 28, 2009 until July 1, 2009. The location of the hotel is great. It was easy to take buses and cable cars from this hotel. The cable car stop was a short walk to Union Square. Plenty of places to eat near this hotel also. Mel's Diner is on the next corner. Room service was perfect. The food was delicious and hot. Everything we ordered from room service was delivered within 15 minutes. The parking garage was great too. Our kids had bikes for the parks and bridge which were stored in our auto. Everything in out truck was perfectly safe because the parking garage is manned by Palomar employees. I have never been in a nicer parking garage. All employees were very nice and extrememly helpful. Our room was spotless and a great size. I would stay at this hotel anytime I am in San Fran and would recommend it to anyone.

paragraphs.context: May 2 2008 Stressless Stay at Hampton I stayed with my wife 2 nights. Staff was excellent. We checked our bags before the room was ready. When we checked out the bags were carried to the parking garage next door. The parking rate was discounted for guests. Get your parking stub validated by the hotel before picking up the car. The room was spacious. We were on the 8th Avenue side 10th floor. I would ask for the other side opposite 8th Ave to get a quieter room. The breakfast was very good and the staff worked hard to keep the food items full and the area clean. The location was perfect. We saw the Jersey Boys and the theater was around the corner on 52 st. 2 minute walk. Learn as much as you can about the transportation system. The bus and subways will save you a lot of walking and time.

Was looking for a hotel with good Christmas decor, swimming pool and overnight parking nearby. San Francisco hotels normally charge over $40 minimum a night for parking. paragraphs.context: Sep 7 2006 The Star Motel a Great Find! This little motel is modest and very clean. We stayed here for 5 days. The motel is located on Lombard Street, just 6 blocks away from the crooked part. You can walk to Fisherman's Wharf in about :15. Of the many positives, I would have to say that their BEST attraction is that they offer free parking to overnight guests. The majority of the hotels and motels we researched charged anywhere from $15-$30 a night just to park your car in their parking lot! With parking in San Francisco being difficult to find, we felt this was an amazing plus. There are two great shopping districts within walking distance. One to the west of the motel and the other to the east. The area is not ritzy and has a ton of motels, but if you're looking for low price with cleanliness this is your place. Also, the customer service was outstanding and the housekeepers did an EXCELLENT job at keeping our room extremely clean.

I loved the location, close enough to walk downtown but away from all the traffic etc. There are plenty of restaurants, bars, a Starbucks, a Walgreens and a Jewel Osco within a block or so though the hotel itself is in a residential area. We were visiting a son the next street over and it was quite convenient (though the bars do let out at 4:00 am a half a block away). Our room was comfortable and quiet though rather small. Nice, spacious and quiet. The bathroom was very good. Above average size, deep jacuzzi tub, shower and bathrobes. The downstairs restaurant was average. Room service was excellent. The subway is 2 blocks to the south or 3 blocks to the north. The theater district is an easy 5 minute walk as is 5th avenue. Assuming you can get a decent rate, this small hotel with a lot of history seems to be a consistently clean and well valued locale. The staff is graciously efficient, and wants to please. You can go on Edson Parking website and get a discount card for the parking if you want. I would unhesitatingly recommend the Algonquin especially if you get it under 200/night.

The location was great, as it was a 5 minute walk to the bus that took us to the SBC Stadium area, from which point we were able to grab the MUNI up Embarcadero to catch our ferry out to Alcatraz. This was also a great deal! We happened to be there during the Oracle conference, in which EVERY room in San Fran was booked...except 1 at Nob Hill Motor Inn..and while other hotels were charging $500/night, we only paid $135/night with free parking! paragraphs.context: May 5 2009 Good inexpensive choice We truly enjoyed staying at the Viger Hotel. It's in a very central location (ca 10 Min to the Basilica and the Old Montreal Downtown) and has very polite and good English-speaking service. The outside looks of the hotel and the rooms themselves are not ultra-luxurious, so if you look for luxury you may need to go somewhere else (and pay considerably more). For us, however, it was the perfect choice and the "petite dejeuner" (continental breakfast) sufficient for a good start in the morning. Parking was also easily found around the hotel (we parked on a Friday evening and there is free parking then available all around the hotel till Monday morning). If you really do not know where to park (which would be surprising to me) then the hotel can still offer you a day-pass at a nearby parking lot for Can-$ 10. The Wifi-internet was fast and reliable.

Fortunately, the room was commensurately priced so I feel I got what I paid for, nothing more, nothing less. The one outrageous price was hotel parking. C$30/day! paragraphs.context: Jul 6 2005 Disappointed in the Hyatt... My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency. He wanted to stay at the Hyatt because of the revolving restaurant, Equinox. I wanted to stay in a suite at one of the more smaller hotels (boutique) or even the Omni. The room was small and the bay view was very limited. Also, although we had reservations, when we arrived we only had a choice of the second floor or the 8th floor, which was the smoking floor. The hotel's lobby is huge and beautiful, but they truly did not splurge on the rooms. The reception stated that the hotel caters to conventions and that is exactly what it felt like. The BIGGEST DISAPPOINTMENT, however was the hefty valet parking (there is no self parking). Parking per night was $41.00 plus a tax, which ended up being almost $50.00. For a three night stay it cost us $147.00 total for parking alone. My next stay will NOT be at the Hyatt Regency with all of the other hotels available.

Hotel pool was clean but there were a lot of noisy guests using it during our stay. paragraphs.context: Aug 14 2007 Westin on 3rd St. was adequate We stayed at Westin on 3rd St. and Market for one night on Aug. 11. The room was rather small, but adequate and clean. The lighting in the room was not bright enough if you intend to read a book, as I did. The layout of the room was different than what I am used to, with the TV at 45 degree angle from the bed. After sitting on the bed to watch TV for 15 minutes, my neck was very sore. I used Priceline and paid $175 plus tax for one night. So maybe I got what I paid for, a standard room with no view and nothing extra. There is a parking garage directly across street from the hotel so it is convenient for those who want to save a few bucks on parking. We used the hotel valet parking ($42 + tax + tips) and was happy with it. We did have a good time shopping and dining nearby as the hotel is in easy walking distance to Union Square. All and all it was a nice stay but nothing spectacular.

qas.question: Are there parking fees at this hotel?

paragraphs.context: Feb 24 2009 Unique hotel close to everything! I really enjoyed Hotel Indigo in Chicago. I loved the location, close enough to walk downtown but away from all the traffic etc. There are plenty of restaurants, bars, a Starbucks, a Walgreens and a Jewel Osco within a block or so though the hotel itself is in a residential area. We were visiting a son the next street over and it was quite convenient (though the bars do let out at 4:00 am a half a block away). Our room was comfortable and quiet though rather small. The only problem we had was with the parking. Due to some unforseen circumstances, we had 2 cars in hotel parking some of the 2 nights we were there. Our parking bill was $108, as much almost as the hotel. I was charged $32 more beyond the daily charge even though my car was only in parking less than 24 hours. Parking in Chicago is expensive, yes, but shouldn't be that expensive.

We had a 2-double-bed bedroom facing the backyard with standard bathroom. The size of the bathroom is the only downside I've found. Very small! However, plenty of hot water (showerhead was not working very effectively...) and very clean bathroom and towels. The morning receptionist (I forgot to ask him his name, but I thank him again) was very nice and accepted to keep our car in the hotel parking until 3:00 p.m. at no charge. qas.question: Is there secure parking at the hotel?

answers.text: Everything in out truck was perfectly safe because the parking garage is manned by Palomar employees.

paragraphs.context: Jul 4 2009 Great hotel awesome service! Just stayed at the Palomar and had a wonderful experience. Our stay was from June 28, 2009 until July 1, 2009. The location of the hotel is great. It was easy to take buses and cable cars from this hotel. The cable car stop was a short walk to Union Square. Plenty of places to eat near this hotel also. Mel's Diner is on the next corner. Room service was perfect. The food was delicious and hot. Everything we ordered from room service was delivered within 15 minutes. The parking garage was great too. Our kids had bikes for the parks and bridge which were stored in our auto. Everything in out truck was perfectly safe because the parking garage is manned by Palomar employees. I have never been in a nicer parking garage. All employees were very nice and extrememly helpful. Our room was spotless and a great size. I would stay at this hotel anytime I am in San Fran and would recommend it to anyone.

answers.text: Dont forget to ask about the $20 parking because if you dont you will pay up to $35 a day for parking....the hotel and parking garage have a contract together.

paragraphs.context: Mar 11 2009 Cant beat the price for the location! I went with my best friend to San Fran on spring break and we stayed at Hotel Astoria. We got the regular room with two twin beds and it was perfect! This room cost about $70 a night along with $20 a day parking garage fees. Being that it was next to the China town gate (the fire escape litterally has you looking straight down to it) and walking distance to Union Square and all public transportation, this was a great price! Dont forget to ask about the $20 parking because if you dont you will pay up to $35 a day for parking....the hotel and parking garage have a contract together. There is not very good Wi-Fi in the hotel but there are tons of places nearby that offer it for free like the starbucks across the way and a nearby borders. It wasnt a fancy hotel but offered bare essentials. San Fran is a big city so expect nose whereever you stay.

extractions: view of the city and the Golden Gate bridge

qas.question: Are there parking fees at this hotel?

paragraphs.context: Aug 11 2004 Nice stay in San Francisco We stayed at Comfort Inn by the Bay for a couple nights in late July 2004. The room was very nice, on the top floor with a great view of the city and the Golden Gate bridge. The location is a strong point, within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf and the cable car lines. The only problem is the parking situation. The garage is small for the hotel size, individual parking spaces are small as well, and there's a $20 per day parking fee. If you're picking up or returning a rental car in SF, think about whether you really need to have it during your stay here - it may not be worth the expense and hassle.

paragraphs.context: Aug 13 2006 Worst Hotel Experience Worst Hotel I have ever stayed in. In an area of Montreal that did not look safe to walk in. Unfriendly staff, not a pleasant experience. Room looked out onto an abandoned gravel lot with garbage in it. Parking was not mentioned to be a fee when booked. Couldn't park on the street (all restricted areas). Was initially told that parking was around the corner and in thru the wire fence. Couldn't locate parking so asked again to different person. Was then told parking was $15 and not provided by the hotel. Small unsecured lot. I was hoping that my car would still be there in the morning!!! Did not get accomodations I had made a reservation for. Reserved a king, got a queen. Shower curtain was tied back with a piece of toilet paper. Old mini-bar hidden in tv cabinet. paragraphs.context: Apr 12 2004 Good for price but short on parking space We stayed there on april of 2004. This is what we got for 48$us per night: King bed,mini fridge,coffee maker, fog horn noise from the Golden gate bridge, tight space or non-existent parking, and ghetto-like room neighbors. If you think about using the pool, DON'T. They should think about burrying it and putting more parking space over it. It was very dirty. The room was clean but had a strong smell of carpet deodorant floating around, but we vented it out quickly by opening the window. This is a good hotel for the budget-oriented traveller because of the cheap rates and because it is located in a good neighborhood (Cow's Hollow). You could access everything by using public transit, but much easier with a car.. Bring lots of quarters for metered parking when you visit the city!!!

paragraphs.context: Oct 19 2009 Excellent Hotel Overpriced Parking We had two rooms at this hotel the weekend of the Chicago Marathon -- one room for my wife, myself, and our young children, and one room for my parents. The hotel is nice, the suites are roomy enough for families, and the huge bathrooms are fantastic. The location is good if you are planning on taking the train into town for everything you do (it is right next to Cumberland Station), as long as you do not mind a 30-minute train ride. I knew the parking was $20 a night, but I read some reviews online that said you could avoid it by parking in free lots around the hotel. But there aren't free lots around the hotel -- every lot has a sign saying that if you do not have a permit, you'll get towed. I did not want to take the risk, so I parked in the hotel garage. Lovely hotel, but $20 per night parking is overpriced for the location. Also, no free wifi in the rooms. That was kind of surprising.

paragraphs.context: May 12 2008 Loved the Tomo Right in the heart of Japan Town a wonderful but little known part of San Francisco is the Best Western Tomo! Our stay was fantastic. Every person we dealt with at the hotel couldn't have been nicer, our room was immaculate and simple. A perfect combination of Japanese and Western design, very comfortable and pleasant. The greatest was the parking. The hotel charges a modest $20.00 per night parking fee, a bargain in San Francisco. If their small parking lot is full as it was one night they send you to the public parking lot aroung the corner and reminburse the parking fee. They have a small restaurant in the hotel, we only had breakfast there but it was very good. The Tomo is now our go to place when visiting San Francisco.

I did not eat at the hotel, but I did see some of the food being served as I checked in, and I have to say it did look very nice. Parking could be an issue if you arrive after 20.30. The hotel's website says there are a small number of parking spaces at the hotel and a 24 hour park car nearby. I arrived at 21.30 to find the hotel car park full, (fair enough), but the nearby Kings Mall car park is locked for entry at 20.30, which leaves you the choice of paying to park at an unsupervised car park in the centre of Hammersmith, or parking on the road outside the hotel for free, (as long as you remember to move the car before 07.00 when the parking restrictions start). Overall the stay was fine, but I won't turn up at the hotel late with a car again.

There is no reasonably priced parking nearby, so we parked in a lot almost a mile away. There is also no loading zone in front of the hotel. So we were socked with a 50 pound parking ticket followed by a 65 pound clamping (over $200 american) while I was getting our daughter ready to leave and my husband was loading the car. The reception desk staff was completely unsympathetic, and a follow-up call to the proprietor yielded the same indifference. That leads me to think that they were just happy to get our money for the room and had no real feeling of responsibility for the happiness of their guests!

Going back, I do see a small line item in the taxes on the reservation, but this is sneaky and gives Starwood a bad name. But even more pathetic is that this hotel, which is surrounded by power lines and parking lots dares to call itself a "resort". They say it is to cover bottled water, valet parking, pool use, gym, etc. But water is given to SPG members in the past , parking had always been complementary and so is use of the small, concrete lined pool. If there was real value to the "resort fee" and better disclosure I would not be so upset, but this is a bad move all around for Starwood and the management of the Westin Casurina. Shame on them!

qas.question: Are there parking fees at this hotel?

answers.text: I used the indoor self serve parking which charges per day without multiple in/out.

paragraphs.context: Jan 20 2008 Good Hotel Stayed at the Omni Hotel during the Christmas holidays. It was a nice hotel. I used the indoor self serve parking which charges per day without multiple in/out. The valet parking guy and the doorman were not helpful when I asked them where to park for self-parking. The self-parking is about 1 block away and is underground/indoor. The gym facilities was one of the best gym facilities that I've seen in a hotel (but I generally stay at lower class hotels). I got overcharged in my minibar tab but hotel staff fixed it when I mentioned the items that I had used (I was charged for a bottle of water which I did not use when I only used/had 2 bottles of alcohol). Wireless Internet was very stable/good and no problems connecting from my room. For the price I paid, it was a nice hotel. However, I would not pay their standard rate of over $150/night since it is expensive for the items that I use.

answers.text: We did find cheaper parking at an icon parking garage, so we skipped the valet parking the hotel offered.

paragraphs.context: I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC solo business or with a family! I visited NYC during Thanksgiving week with my husband and 4 children, ages 10 - 15. We were happy from the time they gave us the key cards to our 29th floor room until we checked out! The room was clean, beds were comfy, towels were plush. There was always someone helpful at the desk. We worked with the desk personnel, the doormen and the concierge; all were helpful and very quick to respond to any need. The size of the room for a midtown location was amazing; the suite is the way to go for a family. We did find cheaper parking at an icon parking garage, so we skipped the valet parking the hotel offered. The neighborhood, and the proximity to the subway station all added to the value of this hotel. All I can say is, stay here, stay here, stay here!!

qas.question: Are there parking fees at this hotel?

answers.text: Parking validation from the front desk got us a reduced parking rate.

paragraphs.context: Oct 8 2009 Very nice hotel room with close by overnight parking at a good price Our room was stylish, very clean, and very quiet. The beds were super comfortable, and the staff was very helpful recommending a restaurant within walking distance. We parked our rented mini-van in an enclosed garage 2 blocks away. Parking validation from the front desk got us a reduced parking rate. During the day the neighborhood was colorful - flower vendors everywhere. But at night we were a little nervous. The flower vendors are gone and there are no open restaurants or businesses or anything on the hotel's block. It appears things are being rehabbed all around so I imagine the barren block will change over time, which will probably drive up the room price. At just under $200 we were very pleased. Taxicabs were easy to get right in front of the hotel.

answers.text: There is a parking garage directly across street from the hotel

paragraphs.context: Aug 14 2007 Westin on 3rd St. was adequate We stayed at Westin on 3rd St. and Market for one night on Aug. 11. The room was rather small, but adequate and clean. The lighting in the room was not bright enough if you intend to read a book, as I did. The layout of the room was different than what I am used to, with the TV at 45 degree angle from the bed. After sitting on the bed to watch TV for 15 minutes, my neck was very sore. I used Priceline and paid $175 plus tax for one night. So maybe I got what I paid for, a standard room with no view and nothing extra. There is a parking garage directly across street from the hotel so it is convenient for those who want to save a few bucks on parking. We used the hotel valet parking ($42 + tax + tips) and was happy with it. We did have a good time shopping and dining nearby as the hotel is in easy walking distance to Union Square. All and all it was a nice stay but nothing spectacular.

I left to check the parking. When I came back the price had gone up. The hotel was OK otherwise. The location is good. Park on the street if you have a car. The parking instructions are in french. Have somebody translate what the parking rules are. Everybody speaks english.

It is a bit of a walk from the wharf, farther than I thought. But they do have the bus that will take you within a block of the motel. Breakfast was a typical continental breakfast, but not great. Staff very friendly and helpful. No computers for guest to use, although the rooms have internet connection available. I did not have a room with a view, but was only staying one night and wanted to watch my costs. The parking is located under the motel and is a tight fit, but better than parking on the street or paying an exorbatant rate.

qas.question: Are there parking fees at this hotel?

Nice, spacious and quiet. The bathroom was very good. Above average size, deep jacuzzi tub, shower and bathrobes. The downstairs restaurant was average. Room service was excellent. Free internet downstairs in the lobby. If traveling by car, do yourself a favor and take the package deal for breakfast(continental) and parking. Worth every penny since parking is getting expensive in Montreal, including no more free parking on Sundays.

qas.question: Are there parking fees at this hotel?

We walked to the Mag. mile, the loop, all over...and the parking is free, your car is right there, if you need something from your car, you do not need to find it in a parking garage. Only negative we had, it is noisy at night, you hear everything going on outside, but the bed was comfortable, and we did get enough sleep. Will stay there again. The hotel across the street was double the price. Try it, it is worth it, if you plan on seeing Chicago, and justwant to sleep and shower!!!!!!!

qas.question: Are there parking fees at this hotel?

answers.text: Jul 5 2009 Average Rooms but Great Location with Parking Included The two highlights of this inn are location and parking.

paragraphs.context: Jul 5 2009 Average Rooms but Great Location with Parking Included The two highlights of this inn are location and parking. It is close to Fisherman's Wharf and within walking distance of public transportation, dining, China Town, shopping, grocery and downtown. Most other hotels charge extra for parking, anywhere from $20 to 50 a day. Rooms are average but clean and housekeeping does a good job. Front office staff in general is helpful. Opening the window does bring in the street noise. Pat's cafe is good but the Indian restaurant across the street is noisy and has average food with poor service. You can request a refrigerator for $5/day but there is no microwave. Considering Trader Joe's and Safeway are only a couple of blocks away, microwave would be really useful.

answers.text: We had a large van, and parking was important, the hotel website says that there is plenty of street parking available and a nearby pay to park.

paragraphs.context: Jun 27 2006 no parking Stayed here for 1 night whilst moving our son back from uni for the summer. We had a large van, and parking was important, the hotel website says that there is plenty of street parking available and a nearby pay to park. Wrong! The street parking is permit holders only (we were not told this), and the pay to park that the receptionist directed us to had a building on it. Other than that it was ok, room small but clean and comfortable. Supper was good.

answers.text: There are many, many places on Lombard Street that have parking garages at there location for free.

paragraphs.context: Oct 13 2007 Good Price for San Francisco but no where to park! Visited the Marinna Inn during our August 2007 trip. Good value for San Francisco. Smallish rooms on busy Lombard Street does provide some noise. If that is a problem for you, then look somewhere else. It was not for us, we are hard sleepers. The only real problem with this place is huge! There is No place to park. There are a few street parking spots available, but they are never available! We had to go park in a parking structure about 3 or 4 blocks away for $20 a day! So any money we saved by finding this place, we paid even more after paying for parking. I would recommend this place if you have no car to park, because it is a good value for this pricey city. But, if you have a car, please do not waste your time. There are many, many places on Lombard Street that have parking garages at there location for free.

answers.text: There's no problem finding parking.

The service was superb and the breakfasts were fabulous. We had been worried, when we booked, about finding parking on the street. Don't worry! There's no problem finding parking. We never had to park more than a block away. You will be very happy if you stay at the Drisco. I promise you. It looks as if this sentiment is unanimous.

The hotel also started offering FREE HIGH SPEED INTERNET! they have not advertised that amenity anywhere on their website or even in their room which i thought was weird. answers.text: The parking was easy with a parking garage as well as off street parking.

paragraphs.context: Jan 9 2008 Not as bad as reviews said Just returned from spending New Years Eve week in Vegas. We stayed from Sunday to Sunday. Upon arrival at the resort the staff was very friendly and our check in was quick. We had a 2 bedroom, 1 bath on the 2nd floor of the main building #1. The bedrooms were large as well as the kitchen, dining area & living room. Would had prefered 2 bathrooms but it was not a problem. This is an older resort, but clean. The resort is very convient to the "strip". This resort is directly behind the Imperal Palace where you can walk through the parking lot to Las Vegas Blvd. The room was cleaned mid week with fresh towels, clean sheets & they even washed the few dishes we had from breakfast. Throughout our stay all the staff was friendly & helpful. The parking was easy with a parking garage as well as off street parking. We would stay there again except the resort is going to be torn down for a city complex. Summer Bay Resorts is moving...

answers.text: Nothing to complain about at all really, the parking could be a problem if you arrive at the wrong time (we saw quite a bit of double parking over the weekend), but then not many hotels in San Francisco offer free parking.

Nothing to complain about at all really, the parking could be a problem if you arrive at the wrong time (we saw quite a bit of double parking over the weekend), but then not many hotels in San Francisco offer free parking. All in all very good for the money and wouldn't hesitate to go again.

answers.text: The "valet" parking is really the parking garage on the corner.

The "valet" parking is really the parking garage on the corner. The hotel stamps your parking ticket and you will get a discounted rate so it only costs $30 a day (per 24-hour period) to park. (This is as cheap as you can get here!!)Nice hotel.

qas.question: Are there parking fees at this hotel?

It's a only a 5 minute walk to Union Square, but it is in a borderline neighborhood (massage parlors, etc.), and I would not recommend it for nervous or inexperienced travelers. paragraphs.context: Jul 14 2007 Reliable HI Express We stayed at the HI Express in Montreal during the period 09-13 Jul 07. This hotel is your standard Hi Express, but offers a laundry service, a small business centre with 2 computers and your standard breakfast of toast, cereal, tea, coffee & juice. All the staff are very friendly and helpful, as are the valet service members. Parking the car can be a problem as the hotel is located on the main road Rene Levesque and parking for the car to arrange the valet to park the car can at times be difficult, particularly during the period 1600 - 1700 hrs due to parking inspectors on the prowl. The room was of a very good standard, which contained a small kitchenette consisting of a medium sized fridge, microwave, sink etc. The bed was firm and comfortable and the bathroom of a decent size, with the water pressure being very good. The hotel is located near Chinatown, a 5 min walk and downtown a 10-15 min walk, depending on where you are heading.

Actually, it is at the upper floors of a hotel/school complex. It locates at the west end of the busy district. Subway to go downtown is close by but you need to good through a tunnel (which is slightly smelly and somebody sleeps there at night). Taxi to go downtown is around $10.If you choose the signature room, it is pretty spacious with a queen and sofa beds almost at the same price. Some rooms have a pretty good view of downtown. If you book through AAA/CAA, it costs you a premium but includes parking and breakfast. Depending on the number of occupants, it may worth it. You need to register in the hotel before you can go to the building parking. However, there is no parking space in front of the hotel.

answers.text: Perfect location for union square shopping and good access to public parking and the trolley cars.

They have excellent valet parking but SF is well known for it is expensive parking. The on site restaurant is lovely, we enjoyed both dinner and appetizers in the bar during our stay. This hotel is very close to many great restaurants. One of the day desk persons keeps his little dog there with him, very cute. Great little hotel with the ameneties of a larger place. A famous rock band was there during our stay, everything was very quiet and very elegant.

It's in a busy part of the city and there's nowhere you can park in the immediate neighborhood. Even though they appear to own the garage, (The Palace Parking Garage), they pass the cost on to you in addition to the room rate. This sort of set the tone. The rooms were fine and the lobby is beautiful, but really, at a 4 star hotel you're paying for service - like parking and a pool. I'd pass on the palace next time around.

answers.text: The Opal Hotel was a pleasant place to spend a romantic getaway, given the fact you have to get through a few challenges: parking (if you choose to, you can park inside their secure parking lot for almost $30.00 per day).Then, once you get to the lobby, it is pretty and classic on the inside.

paragraphs.context: Jan 6 2009 Opal is pretty Opulent The Opal Hotel was a pleasant place to spend a romantic getaway, given the fact you have to get through a few challenges: parking (if you choose to, you can park inside their secure parking lot for almost $30.00 per day).Then, once you get to the lobby, it is pretty and classic on the inside. The room we were given was very comfy and and accomodating. By that I mean the comforter was soft, the pillows were top grade, and every aspect of the hotel room was positive. The only drawbacks were the 'stuffy"smell of the lobby, and long wait for the elevators, and the parking. The sidestreets next to the Opal were, as I was told, " full of shady characters" so be prepared to take a taxi to get to union square !

answers.text: First, the parking fee is $26, and the parking is very tight.

paragraphs.context: Apr 28 2008 Great Location and View Overall, our hotel stay was good. It is in a great location, about a 15 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf. The breakfast area was nice with lots of tables, and the food selection ok. The bathroom was pretty small. Be careful of the parking garage. First, the parking fee is $26, and the parking is very tight. We had a minivan, and manauvering was very difficult. Also, there are two flights of stairs from the parking garage to the elevator in the lobby, so you will have to carry up all your luggage. You may want to consider unloading from the street out in front, before parking in the garage. Other than that, we were very happy with our stay, and with the view from out window.

answers.text: Good for price but short on parking space

paragraphs.context: Apr 12 2004 Good for price but short on parking space We stayed there on april of 2004. This is what we got for 48$us per night: King bed,mini fridge,coffee maker, fog horn noise from the Golden gate bridge, tight space or non-existent parking, and ghetto-like room neighbors. If you think about using the pool, DON'T. They should think about burrying it and putting more parking space over it. It was very dirty. The room was clean but had a strong smell of carpet deodorant floating around, but we vented it out quickly by opening the window. This is a good hotel for the budget-oriented traveller because of the cheap rates and because it is located in a good neighborhood (Cow's Hollow). You could access everything by using public transit, but much easier with a car.. Bring lots of quarters for metered parking when you visit the city!!!

answers.text: Having stayed at the Four Points Sheraton before I receive emails about sale offers, I received one that offered $99 p/n and $1 parking!The staff is incrediabily friendly!

paragraphs.context: Jan 28 2008 Another Great Trip Having stayed at the Four Points Sheraton before I receive emails about sale offers, I received one that offered $99 p/n and $1 parking!The staff is incrediabily friendly! You can't walk through the lobby from without at least two or three people saying 'hello,' 'welcome back' or 'have a nice day.' This place has by far the friendliest staff anywhere that I've stayed!The rooms are large and nice -- they are not amazing, but they are very clean and comfortable. The fridge and microwave are a nice treat, especially with the Trade Joes attached to the building, you can get, keep and heat up snacks very easily. The elevators are fast and quiet, the parking is enclosed and convenient (you can use the parking pass until 6pm the day that you check out!). The only thing that I would change is that they do not have complimentary breakfast, it is $11 p/p on weekends, so we've just gone elsewhere. Very nice hotel, extremely friendly staff and an amazing location.

paragraphs.context: Jan 4 2005 Valet Parking is more expensive than you know. My last stay at this property resulted in my friends car being damaged by the valet. The valet completed a report and told "us" to contact the company that opertates the parking service. I contacted the manager of the property and was told they had no control over the company that ran the parking service. The hotel was of no help in trying to resolve this problem even after my friend received a letter from the parking servive company informing her that an investigation indicated they were not at fault. I checked out of the hotel and spent the rest of my business trip(21 more days) at the Sofetel Hotel. I paid my friend $500 to have her car repaired and have not been back to the Marriott Downtown since. I have been back to the Sofetel for an additional 19 days.

paragraphs.context: Aug 10 2006 Super location Spent two nights in the Handlery. This is an older hotel but you wouldn't know it from the interior. Very nicely remodeled. The hotel was excellent---great service, very clean and quiet, and right in the middle of all the shops in San Francisco. Plenty of great places to eat nearby. answers.text: We were able to find street parking for the night which cost us nothing.

paragraphs.context: Mar 25 2009 Good hotel great view and central location I stayed at the westin with my husband during a quick visit to SF. We booked this hotel through hotels.com and were happy with our stay. We had initially booked a standard King room but when we got there and asked for a room with a view they gave us a deluxe double queen room with a view. It was close to the elevator so we could hear it going up and down but that did not bother us too much since we are deep sleepers! Our room did not have a safe so we did end up leaving out laptop etc with the Bellman. The location was great since it was central to everything including the BART which we took to and from the SFO airport. The hotel offers parking which is $48/night with in and out privileges. We were able to find street parking for the night which cost us nothing. You just need to pay attention to the street cleaning signs and parking meter rules. Overall an excellent hotel with a great view.

paragraphs.context: May 12 2008 Very good stay My daughter (20) and I spent one night at the Chateau de l'Argoat on May 8th and both enjoyed our stay. Warm welcome, large and comfortable room. We had a 2-double-bed bedroom facing the backyard with standard bathroom. The size of the bathroom is the only downside I've found. Very small! However, plenty of hot water (showerhead was not working very effectively...) and very clean bathroom and towels. The morning receptionist (I forgot to ask him his name, but I thank him again) was very nice and accepted to keep our car in the hotel parking until 3:00 p.m. at no charge. This allowed us to go shopping on St. Denis Street without being forced to find a pay parking or to run to a parking meter every 2 hours. Greatly appreciated!

Those expectations were that it was clean, quiet, it supplied a crib for my 3 month old son, and it seemed relatively safe. As a bonus it is close to almost everything I wanted to see. (Fisherman's wharf, market, ferry to Alcatrez, etc...) Parking very expensive but we found that you can pay for a day in their parkade starting in the morning and do not have to leave until the night of the next day. Overall a good basic hotel that gets the job done.

answers.text: After a wonderful day & evening in Chicago, my husband & I were very unpleasantly surprised to find out upon checking out the following morning that the parking fee for one overnight at InterContinental Chicago was $49!

paragraphs.context: Apr 22 2008 Price of parking was ridiculously high! After a wonderful day & evening in Chicago, my husband & I were very unpleasantly surprised to find out upon checking out the following morning that the parking fee for one overnight at InterContinental Chicago was $49! Yes, this hotel is right on Michigan Avenue, and yes it was a nice room, but $49 for one overnight of parking seemed inordinately high. The usual $35 parking per night in Chicago is high enough, but $49 was over the top; we will not be staying at the InterContinental again! (We booked our room through HotWire, which does not give you the parking fee costs before you book, so we'll also be very leery of using HotWire again.

paragraphs.context: Feb 18 2008 Avoid the Buckingham We booked this hotel for it is location (57th and 6th) and reasonable price. We even called ahead about parking, and were told the bellman would direct us. Well, when we arrive there was no bellman in sight. We brought our bags in, and my husband asked the front desk for directions to their discounted parking garage. In that short 2 minutes of time he received a $115 parking ticket, since there is no place to stop to unload your bags! No warning from the hotel staff either. The room as just okay -- parquet floors in need of refinishing, very small bathroom, nice kitchenette. When we tried to take a shower, hwever, the cold water did not work (the faucet was broken -- how could they not know?).The piece de resistence? The parking garage they directed us to was NOT the one with the discount -- they gave us the wrong directions.....so overnight parking cost $59.Do yourself a favor and pay more money for your room up front.

paragraphs.context: Oct 25 2007 Just okay We stayed at the Edwardian for a couple of nights in October 2007.To begin with , I'm not a picky man when it comes to hotels. My number one requirement is that they are clean, and the Edwardian was clean. The other positive was its location, with an F line train stop less than one block away, which will take you to Fisherman's Wharf and the rest of the city's sites. Plus, for San Francisco, $120 / night does not get you much. The list of negatives include the hotel loosing our reservation (fixed it with a bit or waiting around), no parking ("parking close by" means five blocks to a secured underground parkade), tiny rooms, and a bed and furniture that are very tired relics from the 70s. All in all, I probably wouldn't stay at the Edwardian again. I'd either spend more on a better hotel with parking, or I'd stay in a suburb like Dublin that is on the BART subway line and ride into downtown for the day.

answers.text: You can pre-negotiate room costs & parking with them; I got free parking in downtown plus a nice room for $105.Parking at most hotels

paragraphs.context: Mar 7 2006 Great little hotel good price potentially rough location I stayed here based on the reviews I read on Tripadvisor, plus my knowledge of San Francisco. Everything I read was true, so be aware. For a ridiculously low rate, you will stay in a wonderful little boutique hotel. You can pre-negotiate room costs & parking with them; I got free parking in downtown plus a nice room for $105.Parking at most hotels is $35-$40 in and of itself. The hotel is cute, small, nice. The location will make or break it for you. It is 3blocks from UnionSquare, one of the nicest and most visited parts of SanFrancisco. In 2blocks the other direction, it is some of the roughest parts of Market. So, go one way , you're in super tourist white light land, the other, and it people smoking dope and sleeping in the street. If you're used to living in a big city, won't bother you. If you're not, it will freak you out. For the money, I do not think there's a better hotel in SanFrancisco.

qas.question: Are there parking fees at this hotel?

answers.text: Parking is CAD 23/night over here.

paragraphs.context: May 22 2008 Be aware Be aware that if you book through priceline you are 'only' going to get 'smoking' room. During checkin they are going to offer an upgrade to 'Deluxe non smoking' room. I asked, and was told they only have very few non smoking room available at Priceline.com rate. I suspect they do not have any. Parking is CAD 23/night over here. You can find cheaper parking if you drive around, or street parking if you are over the weekend. Hotel is nicely located, and St. Catherine street is walking distance. So if you plan to stay out, and just sleep in the hotel, this is good choice.

answers.text: SUV PARKING - problematic in hotel.

paragraphs.context: Jul 19 2009 Great value location Location excellent, right downtown. Room spacious - 2 queen beds- small kitchen. Local phone calls $1 - internet charges extra - PASSED- used cell phone. SUV PARKING - problematic in hotel. Limited spaces - very annoying to keep checking with front desk. Could be better organized in that area. [Valet parking is common other than street and lot parking in downtown area]Overnight VALET Parking nearby - $17.00- 2nd parking lot on STANLEY below DeMaisoneuve - best bet. Otherwise valet parking across Peel st. for 25.00 day. Limited in and out priveledges. Verify Off site parking hours of operation in case you are returning late evening.

qas.question: Are there parking fees at this hotel?

answers.text: Looking around, the Marriott parking charge was $22 bucks.

paragraphs.context: Apr 3 2008 Nice Stay but Watch the Parking Charge Nice stay. The room was plenty large for the 4 of us. Breakfast was really good. However, they do not have wireless connections in the room, so I had to go down to the Lobby. Then, I never could connect to their system and ended up connecting to the Hyatt's. Weird. Also, watch out for the parking charge. It is a big $37 bucks. Looking around, the Marriott parking charge was $22 bucks.

answers.text: Parking was very tight in the garage and they say parking is $25

paragraphs.context: Jan 26 2006 OK rooms Rooms were average, small bathrooms. Lights were energy efficient, but not in a good way. When lights were turned on they were very dim, they would warm up after 5 minutes (making sizzling noises the entire time) and then be a normal brightness. Parking was very tight in the garage and they say parking is $25 but they also charge a $3.50 parking tax upon check out. Room was nice, beds were lumpy and pillows were rock hard. We paid for a bay view, and that was very nice; had a view of the Golden Gate Bridge!! Free breakfast does not start until 6:30 am so if you have an early flight, forget about breakfast. Overall, hotel average, nothing to write home about.

qas.question: Are there parking fees at this hotel?

answers.text: The best was the pre-paid parking.

paragraphs.context: Nov 29 2004 Great place! I stayed here for three nights over the Thanksgiving holiday. It was a very pleasant experience. Very friendly and helpful staff. Large room on the backside away from traffic. The best was the pre-paid parking. I booked on Expedia and included parking. A great deal! Parking was just behind the hotel and connected. Very easy and safe. Didn't use the breakfast buffet. Just went to Mel's Diner right in the hotel. This is my new place to stay in San Francisco! Only improvement would be high-speed internet. Otherwise, perfect!

qas.question: Are there parking fees at this hotel?

answers.text: The parking is $32 a day.

paragraphs.context: Mar 16 2007 Great value for the area. Chose this hotel because our son knew where it was and it had parking. We stayed there for 3 nights. The rates were great for the area. The parking is $32 a day. Good price for a hotel, but you can find daily parking for less. We never used the car. Room gave us a wonderful view. We were a bit worried because it was next to the elevator but we had no trouble with noise. The security was very good. The desk clerks could have been more friendly. But I had to remind myself we were not in Oklahoma. The gift shop folks were very accomidating. This is where one goes to get services, taxi, tours etc. All in all a nice stay. Will I stay again, No only because we will not need some place with a parking lot and we will stay in a different part of town for variety. Would have been nice to have a comp breakfast.

qas.question: Are there parking fees at this hotel?

answers.text: Next time we are going to pay the extra for the parking and stay closer to wharf.

paragraphs.context: Jul 18 2005 Not the best area of town to stay in!!! We stayed here for 3 nights June 18-21st and we were a little worried about the location. Not be best area of town alot of homeless people around... This was our first time to San Francisco and we had a hard time locating the hotel. We booked this hotel mainly for the free parking but with a truck it is a tight squeeze in the underground parking. There is a good pizza place across the street but it was a little greasy!!! The rooms were very clean and there was not to much noise. There is a nice courtyard with a fountain and chairs to sit out in during your down time. If you are looking for a budget hotel with free parking this hotel would be fine. Next time we are going to pay the extra for the parking and stay closer to wharf.

qas.question: Are there parking fees at this hotel?

answers.text: To find out his parking lot was full (which by the way was $21 a night) but said with a smile that there is parking around the corner which is $16...to which he said he would have parked my car again still at $21.

paragraphs.context: Nov 9 2004 Sleepless Well we arrived at the Monarch Hotel late...say around 11 pm and when we arrived I parked out in the front to unload my luggage and to check in so that way I can find out where I should park my car. To find out his parking lot was full (which by the way was $21 a night) but said with a smile that there is parking around the corner which is $16...to which he said he would have parked my car again still at $21. I found parking 2 blocks down which was $10 for 24 hours. Not very safe out there at night but then again no where in San Francisco is safe at night. But there is an array of bright lights stating there is a sex shop right in front. Not very pleasing. The room is so small and dusty. BUT i did have a working clock but the alarm did not work but at least it showed the time. Hey if your in for a budget... can't complain. But to be honest I would rather stay in a motel 6 outside of San Francisco than there. The hotel is kind of freaky.

qas.question: Are there parking fees at this hotel?

answers.text: Parking was not mentioned to be a fee when booked.

paragraphs.context: Aug 13 2006 Worst Hotel Experience Worst Hotel I have ever stayed in. In an area of Montreal that did not look safe to walk in. Unfriendly staff, not a pleasant experience. Room looked out onto an abandoned gravel lot with garbage in it. Parking was not mentioned to be a fee when booked. Couldn't park on the street (all restricted areas). Was initially told that parking was around the corner and in thru the wire fence. Couldn't locate parking so asked again to different person. Was then told parking was $15 and not provided by the hotel. Small unsecured lot. I was hoping that my car would still be there in the morning!!! Did not get accomodations I had made a reservation for. Reserved a king, got a queen. Shower curtain was tied back with a piece of toilet paper. Old mini-bar hidden in tv cabinet. Breakfast consisted of Croissants, juice and coffee. Better than nothing. Will never stay at an Econolodge again if this is what to expect.

qas.question: Are there parking fees at this hotel?

answers.text: The holtels extra-services like internet and parking are ridiculously pricey.

paragraphs.context: Apr 27 2009 Very good hotel / very expensive parking The hotel is very comfortable, clean, and trendy. The location is awesome, near all the commercial center (Union Square), 5-minute walk. The holtels extra-services like internet and parking are ridiculously pricey. Parking costs $52, and 2 blocks from there, there is a parking lot which costs $32 (Fifth and Mision Garage). The room is very good, the bed is very comfortable. Very good choice!!

qas.question: Are there parking fees at this hotel?

answers.text: They have excellent valet parking but SF is well known for it is expensive parking.

paragraphs.context: Oct 8 2009 Get Away weekend With My Daughter We loved the Monaco, small but great rooms.. free internet with Klimpton membership, safari style robes and linen. The doormen are great. Perfect location for union square shopping and good access to public parking and the trolley cars. They have excellent valet parking but SF is well known for it is expensive parking. The on site restaurant is lovely, we enjoyed both dinner and appetizers in the bar during our stay. This hotel is very close to many great restaurants. One of the day desk persons keeps his little dog there with him, very cute. Great little hotel with the ameneties of a larger place. A famous rock band was there during our stay, everything was very quiet and very elegant.

qas.question: Are there parking fees at this hotel?
