answers.text: the only setback would be parking, $45 for parking at a safe place in their valet garage.

paragraphs.context: Sep 8 2009 The complete Package! This hotel was conveniently located, walking distance to most places including the Bart and trolley station which is very helpful as a tourist in SF! the view from our room was amazing. the service was prompt, professional and friendly. The bed was the absolute most comfortable bed I've ever slept on, just WOW. i wanted to take that bed, pillows, sheets and everything. haha. They provided us with water and fresh fruit. We had a wonderful time here! My husband loved the modern feel of the interior deco of not only our room but the whole hotel ambiance. the only setback would be parking, $45 for parking at a safe place in their valet garage. But thats a price to pay than to leave your car in one of the parking garages nearby outside where anyone can have access to it. But other than that parking dilleo, everything was perfect. Id definatley come here again, as a matter of fact, We'll be booking this hotel the next time im in the bay area.

qas.question: Are there parking fees at this hotel?

answers.text: II's economical for anyone who needs a car while in SF.

paragraphs.context: Nov 5 2008 Clean Motel with Free Parking Columbus Motor Inn is a plain, clean motel with a very easy, in and out, free parking lot on the street level. No valet parking because it is not needed. II's economical for anyone who needs a car while in SF. We stayed for 5 nights. A couple of the nights were a bit noisy very late because of a nearby night club. It's a good place to stay for experienced travelers who do not need a lot of coddling from the staff although the front desk people were quite pleasant. It's a motel, not a hotel.

qas.question: Are there parking fees at this hotel?

answers.text: The best deal of all is that parking, which can be very expensive in San Francisco, was only $10 a day with a promotional package.

paragraphs.context: Nov 15 2006 A 3-star hotel just adequate rooms probably a fair price for SF Our rooms were clean and adequate, and smallish. We booked the "premier queen" rooms. These are supposed to be their best rooms they have next to a suite. Well, I think some are better than others, but if our rooms were just adequate I'm not sure what the standard rooms would be like. It's located a few blocks further from the main shopping and dining attractions than other downtown hotels and as such is price a little lower than similar hotels. The best deal of all is that parking, which can be very expensive in San Francisco, was only $10 a day with a promotional package. The regular parking is $20/day which is still cheaper than many. When you compare hotel room costs in San Franciso, if you need parking for a car, be sure to find out how much it is at each hotel. One hotel we liked alot charged $42.50 per day. That adds a lot to the daily cost.

answers.text: I used the indoor self serve parking which charges per day without multiple in/out.

paragraphs.context: Jan 20 2008 Good Hotel Stayed at the Omni Hotel during the Christmas holidays. It was a nice hotel. I used the indoor self serve parking which charges per day without multiple in/out. The valet parking guy and the doorman were not helpful when I asked them where to park for self-parking. The self-parking is about 1 block away and is underground/indoor. The gym facilities was one of the best gym facilities that I've seen in a hotel (but I generally stay at lower class hotels). I got overcharged in my minibar tab but hotel staff fixed it when I mentioned the items that I had used (I was charged for a bottle of water which I did not use when I only used/had 2 bottles of alcohol). Wireless Internet was very stable/good and no problems connecting from my room. For the price I paid, it was a nice hotel. However, I would not pay their standard rate of over $150/night since it is expensive for the items that I use.

answers.text: Feb 26 2008 OK Hotel parking is outragous This hotel is OK, not up to Nikko's regular standards.

paragraphs.context: Feb 26 2008 OK Hotel parking is outragous This hotel is OK, not up to Nikko's regular standards. They could not find my reservation on arrival that I had made on the website of the hotel. DO NOT PARK HERE. My room was $199, the parking was $51 a night! I was in a recently renovated room, and it was OK nothing outstanding. Not a bad $200 hotel in downtown SF but I'll never get over the parking.

answers.text: This is long gone, there is now a charge of $11 (I think) for a continental breakfast or $14 for the full American.

paragraphs.context: Mar 14 2007 Clean Updated Convenient Cheap... Overall, this hotel was clean and in a very convenient location. Hotel is nothing luxurious, just clean and basic. (Then again for $115 a night, I cannot argue) Every restaurant we ate at, we were able to walk to, no problem. Workout facilities were great, treadmills are brand new, with personal TVs. Pool area looked clean and up to date. Wireless internet in the rooms was speedy and easy to setup. The only con, is that a lot of reviewers had talked about free breakfast. This is long gone, there is now a charge of $11 (I think) for a continental breakfast or $14 for the full American. With so many good brunch/breakfast places around, it is worth your time to venture outside. Traders joes is right around the corner, great for a quick bottle of wine, or snacks. Overall for the cost, it was great.

answers.text: We had complimentary breakfast based on our Hilton Honors level.

paragraphs.context: Jun 12 2009 Great Stayed here for three nights in June using Hilton Honor points. The staff was very efficient and helpful. The handicap accessible room on the 43rd floor was clean and comfortable. It also had a fine view of the city. The location is great being right on 42nd street - the entrance for valet parking is on 41st street. We had one dinner in the hotel restaurant. Great service and a fine dinner - pricey by upstate New York standards but probably in line with New York City prices. We had complimentary breakfast based on our Hilton Honors level. It was a nice buffet or you could order from the menu at no charge. If I was actually paying for breakfast i would have gone somewhere else. $50 for breakfast for two seems like a lot even in New York City.

answers.text: The breakfast was good, but I wouldn't have paid the menu price for it if it were not in our package.

paragraphs.context: Sep 9 2008 Nice Hotel Great Location I would recommend the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf for anyone wanting to stay close to the Wharf area of San Francisco. It's centrally located to most activities. We needed parking for our rental car so we had the "Wharf experience" package that included parking and breakfast for two each day. You have your choice of odering off of the menu or the buffet. I would recommend the buffet. The breakfast was good, but I wouldn't have paid the menu price for it if it were not in our package. Our rate was $225/night incl. parking and breakfast (parking is normally $39/day and breakfast buffet $18/person). Room was very clean and quiet. As mentioned by others, there was not a tub, but we are shower people anyway so it did not matter.

answers.text: However the buffet breakfast surpassed all hotel breakfasts and offered a wide range of different food stuffs, including a wonderful full-english breakfast.

paragraphs.context: Mar 20 2007 Great location and marvellous breakfast This hotel is ideally situated for tube travel around london. It is much quieter than a hotel in central london, but offers the same perks. Check-in was welcoming, if a little slow and the room service menu was limited. However the buffet breakfast surpassed all hotel breakfasts and offered a wide range of different food stuffs, including a wonderful full-english breakfast. The only problem with breakfast was that I did not receive my coffee when requested, but this was a minor problem. If you manage to book a room at this hotel through a discount website you will not regret it.

answers.text: ; bathtub could have been bigger/shower water pressure could be improvedInternet: LAN connection - nice and stable throughout the stayHousekeeping: very friendly and flexible to our needsBreakfast: very full American breakfast buffet; food very nice but service not so good (could hear staff yelling at each other)Concierge:

paragraphs.context: Jul 20 2007 Very nice stay Stayed here for 5 nights in July on business. Booked via Priorityclub.com and as usual, no problem. Very nice deal including parking ($45/nite) and breakfast at the Top of the Mark every morning ($26/person/day). Upgraded to the corner room upon check-in. Room: very nice and clean; great bed ; bathtub could have been bigger/shower water pressure could be improvedInternet: LAN connection - nice and stable throughout the stayHousekeeping: very friendly and flexible to our needsBreakfast: very full American breakfast buffet; food very nice but service not so good (could hear staff yelling at each other)Concierge: very helpfulValet parking: slow (takes over 10 minutes on average; be sure to call from room in advance)Overall: great place to stay if you do not mind the hills

answers.text: The continental breakfast which was included in the room rate was poor.

paragraphs.context: May 16 2006 A nice respite from the hustle and bustle of Vegas. Stayed here for 2 nights (Fri & Sat) in May 2006. Main reason was to escape the high room rates of the strip hotels. It was a pleasant stay, the bedroom was clean and tidy as was the bathroom. The public areas needed attention, for instance the carpet in the lift hadn't seen a vacuum cleaner for days and the carpet around the lobby area needed a vacuum. The continental breakfast which was included in the room rate was poor. The milk tasted sour and you could have broken a tooth on the raisin bran cereal it was so hard, obviously not Kelloggs!! The fresh fruit was not very nice either. Coffee tasted like dishwater and the toaster took 15 minutes to toast a slice of bread!! Putting the breakfast experience aside, we enjoyed our stay and would probably stay again some time in the future, but would skip the breakfast in favour of the IHOP down the road!!

answers.text: I was not impressed with the continental breakfast they provided.

paragraphs.context: Nov 5 2008 Loved it! (Except for the breakfast) It is in a very good location, close to Sears tower (about a mile), the Navy Pier (1/12 mile) close by the free trolley which you can take to go to the Navy Pier or to museums :) TClose to the business district and a quick ride to Old Town. The hotel is beautiful, super modern and sleek. We had a room on the 10th floor with an awesome view of the River. The bed was super comfy! I'm thinking to buy the mattress from the site. Big plasma TV, a nice longe chair to read by the window. The bathroom double shower, immaculate. The personnel was really nice and help us get orientated in Chicago. Since I was there for a conference I was not impressed with the continental breakfast they provided. Blah! But I went to their sushi bar, excellent! :) Probably the restaurant is better for breakfast. I will definitely stay there again.

answers.text: However if breakfast were included in the price, one might coem awya feeling to have gotten a relatively fair deal.

paragraphs.context: Nov 13 2008 Good but also pricey No doubt this is a hotel with nice, rather recently modernised rooms. Modern design and good furniture, however the renovation budget, reportedly 20 million British pounds was not enough to replace the aged windows. Location is close to the Russell Square tube station and close to the British museum. Price is high but most hotels in London are overpriced and the Russell Hotel is probably just in line with what the market gives. However if breakfast were included in the price, one might coem awya feeling to have gotten a relatively fair deal. At check-in time I was asked if I wanted to add-on breakfasts for 10 ponds a day in advnace, or if not in advnce (at check-in time) it would cost 19 pounds. I decided to go for a short morning stroll to near-by cafes and had breakfasts for under 10 quid, as they say. Otherwise, an acceptable place, worth a try.

answers.text: Breakfast is good.

paragraphs.context: Jan 3 2006 Good choice Won't be the best 5 star that you ever stay in, but it is a good choice for a few days in Delhi. The staff were helpful and the service generally was pretty good. The rooms were a bit dark and could do with some freshening, but they were functional and comfortable. We stayed in a Club Room and found complimentary water, chocolates and cookies waiting for us on our arrival. Breakfast is good. One tip if the main breakfast area is busy, is to go to Woks restaurant on the first floor. Same breakfast, lots of eager waiters, absolutely no other guests ...

answers.text: The rooms were about $110 including breakfast for all of us.

paragraphs.context: Sep 28 2009 Wonderful hotel This hotel is a great bargain, a four star hotel with two star prices. We stayed at the Park Plaza for four nights with our two grandchildren. The rooms were about $110 including breakfast for all of us. At first, the reception had a problem with our reservations --they had lost it and we did not get the connecting rooms that we had requested. However, once we settled in, we were more than happy with our rooms. The breakfast buffet was fantastic, with western, chinese, and japanese breakfast foods. The concierge was also more than helpful. The hotel is within walking distance of shopping and the famous food street. Somehow, taxis seem to have a hard time finding the hotel..

answers.text: I was able to get a good rate including breakfast for a 4 day weekend by calling the hotel directly.

paragraphs.context: Jul 9 2008 Outstanding Service I consider myself a world traveler. This hotel was outstanding for my stay from July 3 through July 7, 2008. Service could not be better. e.g.---I called from the lobby for ice to be sent to my room. By the time I got up to my room on the 33rd floor, the ice was there. The amenities were quite perfect. The Istana for breakfast, the bar in the late evening, the front desk, the houskeepers,the concierge desk---were all eager to please and I hope to return to the Palace again. It was my first stay. No matter where I was in the hotel, all employees seemed to stop and say "Hello and can I help you? " The training of staff must be a huge task......and successful. I was able to get a good rate including breakfast for a 4 day weekend by calling the hotel directly. Our daily breakfast would have been quite costly (in my standards) if we had not had a package....

answers.text: Also, the special included only breakfast for 2 people - and it was well over 20$ per person for the breakfast -

paragraphs.context: Aug 19 2009 Decent hotel but small rooms We stayed 4 nights in the Hilton and it was OK overall - clean, quiet, good location. However, we booked a room for 4 with a bed and breakfast deal. The room was small for the 4 of us - basically the two double beds took up most of the space. The hotel certainly was not full, and I was surprised they crammed us into the room, although technically speaking, that is what we reseved. Also, the special included only breakfast for 2 people - and it was well over 20$ per person for the breakfast - it was good, very good, but that's a bit pricey!In all fairness, we did get what we paid for, and I can't really compare to other hotels in the area, but I feel it was a bit overpriced for what it is.

answers.text: This is a really great hotel with the best breakfast, wonderful fruit and fruit juices and decaf coffee - we spent 51 days in the region and this set the standard and was never beaten.

paragraphs.context: Oct 30 2007 Best Breakfast Buffet in China We were lucky enough to be upgraded to the Regent for one night as the sister hotel (next door), The Park Plaza Beijing Wangfujian was overbooked. This is a really great hotel with the best breakfast, wonderful fruit and fruit juices and decaf coffee - we spent 51 days in the region and this set the standard and was never beaten. Also, very comfy beds (again unusual for this part of the world), great room, flat screen TV and glass walled bathroom with electric blinds. Good location - you can walk to the Hutongs, shopping on Wangfujian and visit the night food market for a wonderful meal and experience and Starbucks is behind the hotel if you need a caffeine fix. We left our baggage at the hotel for 1 week when we went to Mongolia and it was safe and fetched for us with a smile on our return. We had to move back into the Park Plaza on our return, which was also good but the breakfast did not even come close!

answers.text: At breakfast, three of us got breakfast whilst the other two had to wait another twenty minutes, and then they got the wrong order.

paragraphs.context: Aug 13 2007 The Most Uncomfortable Hotel With Terrible Service We stayed for four nights here on July20th in a one bed suite and a two bed suite.. Whilst we loved New York ,the same could not be said of this Hotel. The suites were spacious, but the furniture was soooo uncomfortable. There were no tea or coffee facilities in the suites, and the service was the worst we have ever experianced. Room service was slow, and when it arrived the order was wrong. At breakfast, three of us got breakfast whilst the other two had to wait another twenty minutes, and then they got the wrong order. Better by far to go out for food. But on our third morning it was raining and we decided to try again. Bad decision. Service was even worse,two got breakfast after 25 minutes,the others getting wrong orders after 40 minutes. When we checked out they even gave us the wrong bill. For these prices this level of comfort and service is totally unacceptable. Would we stay here again? No. Absoloutly not. NEVER.

answers.text: The complimentary breakfast was a nice surprise as you could order great hot breakfast from the kitchen and not just a continental breakfast.

paragraphs.context: Mar 3 2007 Great stay at the Gault I stayed at the Gault with my boyfriend for two nights at the end of december 2006. It is by far the best hotel I have visited - point of comparison are the Place d'Armes in Montreal, the Germain in Toronto and the Dominion 1912 in Quebec city. The design is absolutely outstanding. The room was very big. The FLOU bed was extremely comfortable and so were the duvet and pillows. The heated floor in the bathroom was well apreciated. The DVD player in the room was useful to watch our dvds - check out the dvd selection in the lobby - and so was the internet connection in the room. The complimentary breakfast was a nice surprise as you could order great hot breakfast from the kitchen and not just a continental breakfast. The staff was courteous and discreet. Overall a charming and romantic experience. I highly recomend it.

answers.text: Free breakfast, and yes the room was kindof small (around 6 tables) but nothing to stop people taking the breakfast up to their lovely rooms.

paragraphs.context: Nov 14 2009 Great location fabulous rooms free breakfast - loved our stay! I loved this hotel!! It was great to be able to relax in a large lovely well decorated suite that had a seperate living and bedroom, and a good sized kitchen and bathroom. They must have different sized rooms however, as a couple we talked to were saying how small theirs was. The washing machine and dryer in the bedroom were a huge bonus. Free breakfast, and yes the room was kindof small (around 6 tables) but nothing to stop people taking the breakfast up to their lovely rooms. Yes there are 2 elevators, but we did not mind waiting a minute or so.2 computers near the lobby with free internet, which was great. Staff were very helpful, and recommended an Irish Pub for dinner and had a coupon for a free appetizer. Fabulous location! Right near the start of the magnificant mile, with fantastic views of the river and gorgeous architecture. Would definately stay here again. Thank you Comfort Suites!

answers.text: Hotel breakfast was included in our package.

paragraphs.context: Oct 8 2007 Great hotel A good quality three star hotel. Clean facilities and clean rooms. friendly front counter staff. The hotel is close to Forbidden City. Getting around is a little difficult as it is quite a walk to the subway. Hotel breakfast was included in our package. We really enjoyed the wide variety of Chinese style dishes for breakfast. Very little western style breakfast which did not worry us as we were enjoying the variety. The hotel is located on an interesting hutong (backstreet) which by itself (the hutong) is worth the trip to Beijing. At the end of the street is a nice cafe selling real espresso coffee. There is a bank with ATM around the corner although the exchange rate at the hotel was just the same. I would stay at Shatan Hotel again.

answers.text: A complimentary breakfast of toast, cereal and juice/tea is provided each day.

paragraphs.context: Jun 16 2008 Great stay at the Blakely We stayed at the Blakely for 4 nights in early June 08. The room was very comfortable and a decent size. Bathroom was a touch small but this did not really matter. The rooms come with a small kitchenette which is useful. A complimentary breakfast of toast, cereal and juice/tea is provided each day. They do provide a cooked breakfast which costs extra. There are plenty of places to eat breakfast in NYC so we had breakfast elsewhere a couple of times. There is free internet access in the lobby which is a nice touch and the concierge are very helpful. The hotel is about 250m walk from a subway/metro station with a train straight to Times Square etc. Lots of shops are a few blocks away and Central Park is only 10 minutes walk. Overall a great stay and bring ear plugs as NYC is always noisy, especially at night!

answers.text: The breakfast is acceptable as a "free" breakfast, but we chose to eat in the Hollywood Cafe next door for an inexpensive big American breakfast !

paragraphs.context: Apr 25 2007 Great value! Good tourist location, modern clean rooms and bathrooms. Very helpful reception staff. The valet parking is expensive..around $40 with tax, but very convenient - the car is parked in a garage under the hotel. If you want to save money on that, it is possible to park for less just a block or two away. The breakfast is acceptable as a "free" breakfast, but we chose to eat in the Hollywood Cafe next door for an inexpensive big American breakfast ! Overall I'd highly recommend this hotel.

answers.text: However the breakfast is $120.00 for 2 people if it is not included in the rate which is very expensive.

paragraphs.context: May 27 2008 Nice stay at the Palace Managed to get a good rate with breakfast with Expedia for Memorial Day weekend. The NYP is a great hotel with a good location. The room was large with an even larger TV. I had breakfast in my room every morning and it was very nice. However the breakfast is $120.00 for 2 people if it is not included in the rate which is very expensive. The only negative with this hotel are the extras as others have pointed out. Car parking was $60.00 a day and a drink being $8.00. I also called for a taxi to Newark airport and the hotel said they could arrange one for $170.00. I took a yellow cab for $70.00 in the end. I stayed at the Sofitel last July and would probably go back to the Sofitel next time as I found it better overall, however the NYP would come a close 2nd.

answers.text: There was no breakfast provided, however there was plenty of choice locally and we found a healthy smoothie for breakfast just around the corner.

paragraphs.context: Apr 8 2009 Bed without breakfast The Chelsea Lodge was easy to find. There was no breakfast provided, however there was plenty of choice locally and we found a healthy smoothie for breakfast just around the corner. There is an entrance to the tube at 23rd Street a 5 minute walk away and the Chelsea Lodge is well placed for exploring Manhattan. The shared toilet was cleaned every day and it was never a problem sharing as we had a basin and shower in the room. The room was very small and the Lodge was run by a young girl who was friendly but typically of New York there was little by way of introduction or explanation.

answers.text: We paid $80 for 2 very basic breakfast so please stear away from the breakfast room - there are plenty of diners around where you can have a very nice breakfast.

paragraphs.context: Feb 4 2009 Attitude - just forget it! Staff were unfriendly and arrogant. Decor was fine for the common areas (e.g.reception and bars) - Stark! - but really ugly rooms. We paid $80 for 2 very basic breakfast so please stear away from the breakfast room - there are plenty of diners around where you can have a very nice breakfast. Overall not worth. However, location is excellent and rooms are quite big.

answers.text: Breakfast is served in the underground.

paragraphs.context: Jan 2 2008 Prepare your legs Great location, very close to Victoria Station, in a calm area. Good and clean room, bathroom ok, friendly staff. But there's no elevator. I stayed at the 4th floor, and is not confortable arrive after an international flght from South America and carry two bags upstairs, in a total of 95 steps! The stairs are steep and narrow. Breakfast is served in the underground. So, after breakfast, only for wash my teeth I should climb 5 floors!!! I did not see (if there's one) a notice about it when I made my reservation. So people with heart disease, older citizens or with problems in the legs (not only disable people) should avoid this hotel. Breakfast is pretty basic. Overall, price is very high if we compare with hotels in US. Well, it is London.

answers.text: Free continental buffet breakfast was adequate, but not lavish (the fruit bowl often ran out and they were a bit slow replenishing it).

paragraphs.context: Oct 3 2009 Good value and great central location What strikes you is the tiny street frontage of this hotel, but do not let this put you off. It is moderately priced, in a great location and offers a lot for your money. Only one block to Penn Station and interstate bus stops. Friendly & helpful staff, free newspaper in foyer and free internet in room. Rooms were quite small (what you would expect in NY) but modern and clean. Free continental buffet breakfast was adequate, but not lavish (the fruit bowl often ran out and they were a bit slow replenishing it). The breakfast room was a bit cramped, simply because it was very popular with the guests - not many other places offered free breakfast. Overall great value for money and top location.

answers.text: We were looking for a comfortable, clean hotel in the Fisherman's Wharf area that also included a free breakfast, and we found it in Comfort Inn by the Bay.

paragraphs.context: Aug 24 2007 Great place to stay on a moderate budget We were looking for a comfortable, clean hotel in the Fisherman's Wharf area that also included a free breakfast, and we found it in Comfort Inn by the Bay. The room was on the 7th floor, was very quiet, and was large enough for the two of us. The free breakfast was a tremendous asset and we looked forward to beginning our day at the breakfast buffet. The waffles, cereal, bagels, English muffins, hard boiled eggs, and banana nut muffins were very satisfying. Fruit, coffee and juice were also included. We would recommend this hotel to anyone.

qas.question: Does your breakfast include vegan options?

answers.text: Full buffet breakfast excellent, one hot entree and all the varieties of fruit, cereal, and pastries you can imagine.

paragraphs.context: Jan 2 2009 A+ Hampton Inn Times Square made our trip wonderful. Front desk: quick, helpful, friendly. Bellmen: Great source of information, all smilesRooms: New and spotlessHousekeeping : Went out of their way to helpBreakfast: Full buffet breakfast excellent, one hot entree and all the varieties of fruit, cereal, and pastries you can imagine. Staff working breakfast were always helpful. Location: Can walk to Times Square, most plays, theater district, Fifith Avenue, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, Museums and more. Subway across the street. Rates: Totally reasonable for New York City!I would recommend this hotel to anyone! Families, Couples, or Seniors. We stayed here through New Years Eve 2008I would stay here again anytime.

answers.text: We had breakfast coupons

paragraphs.context: Nov 7 2009 Very impressed The hotel was in a great location. The rooms were clean and spacious. We stayed 5 nights and our maid brought us fresh towels and tidied the room everyday. We had breakfast coupons so we ate breakfast at the hotel. The breakfast was good, no problem w/ service. The bar was expensive, $7 for a beer and $12 for a cocktail. Did not hang out at the bar due to this. Found a great bar 1 block from hotel w/ better prices. (DJ Reynolds Irish pub) Lots of great restaurants around the corner. a diner across the street, my husband walked into the diner the morning we left and got us a cappuccino, very good. some street noise during the day, but it seems to quiet down around 10 pm. Would stay here again.

answers.text: Breakfast was very basic, there are lots of restaurants really close that offer much more value for the money, not talking about the atmosphere of a window-less basement breakfast room.

paragraphs.context: Oct 5 2008 VERY noisy room Actually I should have stood at a different hotel of the Crystal series but they had to relocate me "because of maintenance problems". They arranged a taxi transfer to Brunel hotel where I was given a tiny room in the basement. I could hear the underground trains going by every 2-5 minutes so clearly as if a station was next to my room. The kettle turned on randomly (without water!) for some split-seconds, making loud clicking sounds. To make things worse the room was right opposite the breakfast room (~ 6-7 m from bed to breakfast table!) so starting from 7 am constant coming and going. This was definitely the worst stay I ever had. I recommend not accepting any rooms in the basement at all if you have to stay here. Breakfast was very basic, there are lots of restaurants really close that offer much more value for the money, not talking about the atmosphere of a window-less basement breakfast room.

answers.text: Breakfast was included in our booking however the waiters seemed to really resent our "free" breakfasts despite leaving a tip.

paragraphs.context: Aug 4 2009 bad service Our mornings at this hotel would start off very badly with extremely rude service and attitude that we received from the servers in the restaurant. We would wait for long periods to be approached and offered coffee or juice. Breakfast was included in our booking however the waiters seemed to really resent our "free" breakfasts despite leaving a tip. The coffee was consistently horrible- not fresh. It got to the point where we dreaded going downstairs in the morning for breakfast. The concierge(s) was not very helpful and did not really matter which one was working. No-one informed us that most Manhattan Stores would be closed on Easter Sunday despite making a big point about how excited we were to shop. There was a general laziness about all of the staff working there.

answers.text: The next morning I went down for breakfast but was told my rate was a bargin rate and did not include breakfast.

paragraphs.context: Aug 27 2006 dont book third party I booked this hotel through Hotels[-]. The promo rate was 133 a night and that was to include breakfast. The next morning I went down for breakfast but was told my rate was a bargin rate and did not include breakfast. I had to deal with Hotels[-] for a while before getting it resolved and we never did get the breakfast (hotels[-] issued me a credit for the breakfast amt, which by the way was 22 dollars a person for a continental breakfast!!!! ie. juice and muffin .... so I guess I am glad they lost the info) However I had to ask several times to get a cup of coffee. Evidently the hotel only puts out complimentary coffee until 7:30 am! Who gets up that early on vacation? After 7:30 one has to go to the restaraunt and pay through the nose for a cup, I thought this was a four star hotel? One the other side of things the location is great, the service is excellent. The hotel as well is very clean.

answers.text: The breakfast was your typical hotel breakfast.

paragraphs.context: Jul 23 2009 A Great Surprise! We changed our plans to Vegas at the last minute and booked one night at the Hampton Inn Tropicana. We were pleasantly surprised when we called the hotel from the airport and found out that they have a free airport shuttle. We landed in Vegas around 8am and the shuttle picked us up. We were allowed to check in early, which was fantastic. We were also invited to eat breakfast, which was still being served. The breakfast was your typical hotel breakfast. The hotel lobby and common areas were very nice. We loved the room. Both the room and bathroom were nicely appointed and both very clean. The bed was comfortable. The hotel staff was very friendly as well. The shuttle dropped us off a few times at Mandalay Bay, which was an added bonus, as we were attending events there. If you need a place to stay near the strip that is a great price, this is a great choice.

answers.text: Great Buffet Breakfast included in price.

paragraphs.context: Nov 13 2009 GREAT FIND GREAT LOCATION Brill hotel just behind Hooters and opposite Luxor. So perfect location to get to all the big hotels. Great Buffet Breakfast included in price. Great size rooms we had one bed apartment fo myself husband and teenage son. Just left the double bed setee up all day No prob. Dinning table and kitchen. Take a tray then you can carry your breakfast up to your room in the morning as seating can be hard to get. Pool area nice although wish mades would not choose to bang and clang cleaning round it just as you nodding off about 11. am. Reception staff adorable and so helpful. Would deff stay there again. Especially as food in vegas expensive. so breakfast a real help

answers.text: Although as usual the breakfast is included the room rate was expensive compared to other Holiday Inn Express hotels we have stayed in.

paragraphs.context: Aug 28 2008 good location Stayed here for 3 nights in July. Hotel is clean and welcoming and extremly well situated but I have to agree with reviewer who complained about the expensive parking charge and the fiasco over breakfast. Although as usual the breakfast is included the room rate was expensive compared to other Holiday Inn Express hotels we have stayed in. The breakfast area was packed out and often nowhere to sit. Many peopel looked around and then had to take breakfast back to their room. Staff seemed to find it difficult to keep the shelves stocked and we were left disappointed with the remaining choice. Because this is a very large, busy hotel perhaps a bit more thought needs to be given to the layout of the breakfast area- moving toastersetc.. Overall I would still recommend thsi hotel as the situation was excellent and the majority of staff extremely helpful.

answers.text: The location is truly central and the hotel staff are friendly .Any free breakfast offer you can forget as this is just a roll off a plate and coffee from a dispenser in the hall available from 05:00 until 07:00.There is a chargable cooked breakfast, though.

paragraphs.context: Dec 2 2006 location location location I booked two rooms ( myself/wife and two sons in twenties) for three nights and was very pleased overall. The location is truly central and the hotel staff are friendly .Any free breakfast offer you can forget as this is just a roll off a plate and coffee from a dispenser in the hall available from 05:00 until 07:00.There is a chargable cooked breakfast, though. One thing that was annoying was that when we did go out for breakfast I spoke to two of the desk staff explaning that a relative would be arriving within the hour and to give them an envelope when they arrived. They arrived after our return and the desk staff neither phoned our room nor gave the letter so both parties waited for an hour, us in our rooms and the relatives in reception.

answers.text: We choose the 'City Escape Package' which included breakfast buffet for two in Nob Hill restaurant in the first floor, valet parking, consultation with Concierge, and check-out at 2:00 pm for $149.

paragraphs.context: Mar 3 2009 Fantastic City Scape Package We choose the 'City Escape Package' which included breakfast buffet for two in Nob Hill restaurant in the first floor, valet parking, consultation with Concierge, and check-out at 2:00 pm for $149. We were placed in the 12th floor facing the city. The room was comfortable and quiet. It had a nice view of the city. Considering that the valet parking was $45 and the breakfast buffet for two was $76 it was a great deal. The breakfast buffet was very delicious combined with a attentive, efficient, and cordial staff. If you have a chance to have this package with the same value you will not leave disappointed. It was a fantastic experience.

answers.text: On arrival we were told that breakfast is included, but on checkout we charged 600 rhp for breakfast.

paragraphs.context: May 20 2009 AVOID !!! DON'T STAY AT THIS HOTEL The room was very small and unpleasent. Very DIRTY. Unable to sleep due to a loud noise from the street till 4 am. No hot water at bathroom. On arrival we were told that breakfast is included, but on checkout we charged 600 rhp for breakfast. The breakfast was very poor, and the service poor as well. The train station is about 10 minutes walk, in an unpleasant area. The hotel location is faraway from the tourists' attraction, and the area do not look safe at evening time. The A/C was very noisy, and hardly worked, so the room was hot. It was the worst hotel we had in India. I would not stay there again. I do NOT recommend this hotel. It was a very bad experience. I can not understand the other review.

answers.text: The only downside of the hotel is the breakfast, too expensive and too little.

paragraphs.context: May 5 2009 Wonderful hotel great location and service We spent 6 nights at the Carlton Hotel at 88 Madison Avenue. From the moment we stepped in until last minute we had a wonderful stay. The room was spacious, it had a large flat TV screen the bathroom was really good and everything that you need for a confortable stay. The location of the hotel was really good, 1 block away from the 5th Avenue and 1 from the subway. It's a quiet area but close to everytthing, easy to go downtown (Soho, Greenwich village) or Uptown (to Central Park and all highend shopping). Moreover is one step away from the Empire State building and 20 minutes walk from Time Square. The only downside of the hotel is the breakfast, too expensive and too little. But we only tried once, all the other days we had breakfast at the deli on the corner of the 28th street with 5th Avenue. It was much cheaper and fun to watch the new yorkers rushings to work and having their 3 m breakfast. Enjoy

answers.text: The breakfasts were fine for the included price and they always took great care of our 3 year old.

paragraphs.context: Aug 25 2007 Great Hotel Great Location We decided to stay at this hotel after previously staying in Fishermans Wharf and this is a much better location - so much mroe central and if you do their park and play package which comes with breakfast and free parking all the better. Having a car in San Fran makes the world of difference - our previous trips we were reliant on taxis and walking - which was not so bad but to get off the beaten track and see some amazing parts of SF def get a car!The hotel concierge team were great at ensuring we had maps and info. The breakfasts were fine for the included price and they always took great care of our 3 year old. The only complaint we had was the room next door was full of College students who decided to party from 1am until 6am - not great for us at all. Told the hotel who offered us free breakfast but that did not mean much to us as we were already having breakfasts included. All in all I would recommend this hotel to all sorts of groups!

answers.text: Continental breakfast is included and for a small additional cost you can have eggs, breakfast meats, etc.

paragraphs.context: Mar 30 2008 Great Find in New York What a nice little gem on 55th street in the heart of New York. The staff bends over backwards to see that every wish is taken care of. The rooms are on the small side unless you stay in the jr./mini suite which has a living room. Bathroom is quite small but serviceable however. They have a wonderful restaurant call Abbacato (Italian) which becomes the breakfast place in the morning. Continental breakfast is included and for a small additional cost you can have eggs, breakfast meats, etc. They have an excellent car service to and from the airport at not much more than the price of a cab but certainly more reliable and cleaner. Hotel is within 2 or 3 blocks of the subway. Also, there are plenty of good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. Enjoy!!

answers.text: When getting to the hotel I found out there were no breakfasts and there hadn't been for 2 months (with the supplying kitchen closed)

paragraphs.context: Feb 8 2007 Not what was advertised While this is rated as a 3 star, it is more like a Quebec 2 1/2 star. I booked through the Montreal tourist office (absolutely fabulous service - always has been) and they spotted a good price (comparable to other 3 stars) that included 2 full breakfasts. When getting to the hotel I found out there were no breakfasts and there hadn't been for 2 months (with the supplying kitchen closed) - total 5$ / night was removed from the bill (a token for two people and the inconvenience). They had not change their listings with the trourist office in this time and I would not have booked there if there was not some breakfast, a basic expectation for small Montreal hotels and B&Bs. The restaurent beside the hotel opens late and closes early. Otherwise desk help was friendly. Parking is 12$ per night in a garage near the hotel - OKThere is great value in Montreal in 2 and 3 stars not to have surprises

answers.text: The promo rate was 133 a night and that was to include breakfast.

paragraphs.context: Aug 27 2006 dont book third party I booked this hotel through Hotels[-]. The promo rate was 133 a night and that was to include breakfast. The next morning I went down for breakfast but was told my rate was a bargin rate and did not include breakfast. I had to deal with Hotels[-] for a while before getting it resolved and we never did get the breakfast (hotels[-] issued me a credit for the breakfast amt, which by the way was 22 dollars a person for a continental breakfast!!!! ie. juice and muffin .... so I guess I am glad they lost the info) However I had to ask several times to get a cup of coffee. Evidently the hotel only puts out complimentary coffee until 7:30 am! Who gets up that early on vacation? After 7:30 one has to go to the restaraunt and pay through the nose for a cup, I thought this was a four star hotel? One the other side of things the location is great, the service is excellent. The hotel as well is very clean.

answers.text: Concierge LoungeDecent selection at breakfast and happy hour.

paragraphs.context: Sep 14 2009 No major issues. Average hotel. Stayed here on business recently. Overall, was a nice stay, but nothing all that special. Perhaps I've gotten a little spoiled at other properties lately!CheckinSmooth and efficient. Very quick. Probably the most friendly of staff members I encountered. RoomWas upgraded to a junior suite. Really surprised how tired the room looked. I thought all of the Marriott's recently remodeled. These guys got the new beds and technology stuff, but the carpets were still really worn. No issues with housekeeping. Concierge LoungeDecent selection at breakfast and happy hour. VERY small seating area -- not really setup for breakfast -- there are maybe 5 tables total -- the rest are more lounge areas which aren't that functional for breakfast. In 3 days, never once did anyone in the lounge speak to me. Even when I was the only person in the lounge! I do not think I've ever had this happen in any other property!Overall, was just ok. Probably would stay again.

answers.text: The morning breakfast was fabulous - we'd come back for the breakfast alone!

paragraphs.context: Oct 4 2004 Pleasant Stay We recently spent a couple nights at the White Swan Inn and could not be more happy with our choice. The rooms were spacious, unique and quaint, with all the needs covered. The morning breakfast was fabulous - we'd come back for the breakfast alone! The wine and cheese spread could use a little upscaling - the wine was lacking given our proximity to the Napa and Sonoma Valleys and more time and thought could have been spent on the food. We loved that it felt more like a bed and breakfast than a typical hotel. All in all this hotel will not disappoint!

answers.text: The continental style breakfast is fine, and is included in the room rate, but they regularly ran out of a) cutlery b) plates and bowels and c) coffee.

paragraphs.context: Oct 11 2007 Hotel not bad but skip the breakfast.... We encountered several problems during our stay at the newly renovated Empire. For example, the roof of our room started leaking, then the plaster gave way to a torrent of water. We were moved to another room, but were not given any compensation for our (significant) trouble. The staff was very friendly and efficient, however. Breakfast was another problem. The continental style breakfast is fine, and is included in the room rate, but they regularly ran out of a) cutlery b) plates and bowels and c) coffee. It was amusing to watch guests drink milk from bowels or butter croissants with pens. Every now and then a few spoons would appear, which would be quickly pounced on. We finally gave up and just went to the Starbucks next door. Unfortunately, the efficiency of the hotel staff did not extend to the breakfast room.

qas.question: Does your breakfast include vegan options?

answers.text: The contentental breakfast had a good assortment - fruit, juice, bagels, donuts, yoghurt, cereal and 1 hot egg breakfast - not bad!

paragraphs.context: Oct 16 2009 Good place to stay I thought the Hampton Inn was a great value place, you get more than your money's worth. Friendly staff, rooms were clean and you get complimentary wifi and continental breakfast. Quiet sleep and did not have to wait long for the elevators - longest I waited was possibly 2 minutes one time. The contentental breakfast had a good assortment - fruit, juice, bagels, donuts, yoghurt, cereal and 1 hot egg breakfast - not bad! Right around the corner from Macy's and Herald Square and next to that is Empire State Building - very nice to see at night! I would come here again. For a restaurant, try Nicks & Stef's Steak house $$$ but worth it - near Madison Square Garden. Also, go see Memphis Broadway show - very good show!

answers.text: The breakfast staff all spoke broken english and on the first morning we went down for breakfast and not knowing what was happening we went to the boiler in the corner to pour a coffee and out from behind the hatch this girl bellowed SIT DOWN NOW.

paragraphs.context: May 26 2007 What A Dissapointment We booked this hotel to be close to the Stamford Bridge for a match. it was very disappointing, the room was smelly and the covers on the bed were fusty. we had our teenage son with us and his bed was positioned across the bathroom door which had no handle on the outside . every time we need the bathroom we had to move the bed. The breakfast staff all spoke broken english and on the first morning we went down for breakfast and not knowing what was happening we went to the boiler in the corner to pour a coffee and out from behind the hatch this girl bellowed SIT DOWN NOW. we felt about 2ft high. the breakfast was cherry yougart, apples, coffee and toast and if you asked nicely some cereal was provided. this hotel was not cheap . We had to go through the fire escape to get to the lifts and this area was dirty and stinking of smoke were obviously people were using as a smoking area. we will never be back beware

answers.text: My only complain is that they ran out of breakfast vouchers and we had to go to the front desk each morning to get copies vouchers for breakfast.

paragraphs.context: Apr 6 2009 Good Bargain I got a deal from travelzoo - a $179/night rate for a King Superior Room including full breakfast for two each day of our visit. The room was clean and the location was superb. It is located one block from Grand Central Terminal, which is convenient for those taking subways. My only complain is that they ran out of breakfast vouchers and we had to go to the front desk each morning to get copies vouchers for breakfast. But the waitstaff in the Roosevelt Grill made up for this as they were very friendly and accommodating. I would certainly recommend.

answers.text: We feasted on the waffles, bagels, cereal, boiled eggs, pastries, Jimmy Dean breakfast sandwiches, great coffee, and fruit!The free internet station was invaluable to us in our efforts to get home.

paragraphs.context: Jun 30 2006 A refuge! We spent a night here after our connecting flight home to Denver was cancelled and it was truly a refuge for weary travelers! A $10 cab ride from the airport. The room was plenty big enough for 2 adults and 2 teenagers, comfortable beds, nice and quiet location. The breakfast really impressed us as we are used to continental breakfasts that consist of little more than donuts and coffee. We feasted on the waffles, bagels, cereal, boiled eggs, pastries, Jimmy Dean breakfast sandwiches, great coffee, and fruit!The free internet station was invaluable to us in our efforts to get home. Just wish we'd had time to visit the Strip. Maybe next time. I would definitely stay here again.

answers.text: The free breakfast is a typical Hampton Inn breakfast.

paragraphs.context: May 5 2009 If you know NYC the location is great. If you're a newbie tourist stay somewhere else. This is a great location for a night out - located near a lot of hot spots - but certainly not for a tourist unfamiliar with the city since it is not a central location. The rooms are comfortable. The free breakfast is a typical Hampton Inn breakfast. Fast check-in. But the service is thin and not knowledgeable of the area. On two separate stays I asked for recommendations for alternate restos for breakfast and both people I asked couldn't make one suggestion. Free wifi is always a plus to have!

answers.text: Breakfast was included in our room rate and instead of the usual, lame continental breakfast, it was a $15pp credit at the restaurant.

paragraphs.context: Oct 4 2009 My new favorite hotel in Chicago My boyfriend and I stayed at the Dana for 3 nights in late September. From the moment we got there, the service was fantastic. Doormen were welcoming and friendly, and Tim the concierge manager was amazing. We had a Corner King room and even though it was not huge, it was extremely comfortable and stylish. Breakfast was included in our room rate and instead of the usual, lame continental breakfast, it was a $15pp credit at the restaurant. Needless to say, each day started off with a fantastic breakfast. The rooftop lounge was pretty cool, not too busy when we were there and ideal for late afternoon drinks. We just loved this hotel because of location, service and everything else. This was my fourth time in Chicago, each time at a different hotel, and this was definitely my favorite. Will be staying there from now on.

answers.text: The hotel includes breakfast, which we thought we would not avail of, as we planned to have breakfast in the many diners/delis of NY, but the breakfast was so good and in a very relaxing room we ended having breakfast there every morning.

paragraphs.context: Oct 24 2008 A gem of a Hotel My wife and I stayed at the Hotel elysee and very much enjoyed the whole hotel experience. It is a superb little hotel in a fabulous location. Most of the NY familiar attractions are within walking distance. It is a tastefully decorated old style hotel and spotlessly clean. The rooms are large (for a hotel) and has all the mod cons of any high class hotel. The hotel includes breakfast, which we thought we would not avail of, as we planned to have breakfast in the many diners/delis of NY, but the breakfast was so good and in a very relaxing room we ended having breakfast there every morning. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There is only one lift to service the building and it is a bit slow, however its not as bad as some people have previously mentioned, your on holidays anyway, so whats the rush!!! Conclusion: I would highly recommend this hotel and will be staying here on my next trip to New York. Mark, Kildare, Ireland

answers.text: Breakfast was included but it was slight strange as due to the refurbishment breakfast room was relocated

paragraphs.context: Aug 27 2007 Great location First time in New York and we couldn't have stayed in a better location. The Empire State building is just around the corner, Time Square 10 minutes walk. Our room had just been refurbished so nice and clean, The staff could have been friendlier. Breakfast was included but it was slight strange as due to the refurbishment breakfast room was relocated but it was too small and often it was difficult to find a seat. I would happily stay there again. Cotffe, orange juice and Red Bull was available for breakfast but the orange juice and Red Bull was in short supply. The staff seemed to keep the drinks hidden behind the bar and they reluctanly gave you some if asked. Can't work out why Red Bull was given out but I got a taste for it after 5 days.

answers.text: Aug 25 2007 Great Hotel Great Location We decided to stay at this hotel after previously staying in Fishermans Wharf and this is a much better location - so much mroe central and if you do their park and play package which comes with breakfast and free parking all the better.

paragraphs.context: Aug 25 2007 Great Hotel Great Location We decided to stay at this hotel after previously staying in Fishermans Wharf and this is a much better location - so much mroe central and if you do their park and play package which comes with breakfast and free parking all the better. Having a car in San Fran makes the world of difference - our previous trips we were reliant on taxis and walking - which was not so bad but to get off the beaten track and see some amazing parts of SF def get a car!The hotel concierge team were great at ensuring we had maps and info. The breakfasts were fine for the included price and they always took great care of our 3 year old. The only complaint we had was the room next door was full of College students who decided to party from 1am until 6am - not great for us at all. Told the hotel who offered us free breakfast but that did not mean much to us as we were already having breakfasts included. All in all I would recommend this hotel to all sorts of groups!

answers.text: No it is not elegant dining but considering what hotels charge for breakfast, it is a significant savings to have a free breakfast when travelling with children.

paragraphs.context: Sep 13 2007 Great Location Good Choice Our family stayed here in late August for five nights. The room was good sized for big city hotel rooms, and having two rooms means that everyone is not on top of each other all time. Yes the walls are thin, and you will hear city noise, but what do you expect ? You're not in Kansas. The breakfast was fine, eggs, cereals, yogurt, fruit and breads. No it is not elegant dining but considering what hotels charge for breakfast, it is a significant savings to have a free breakfast when travelling with children. The staff, parking, cleanliness were all good. The location is central for visiting Chicago. And the neighborhood is safe with people out and about at all hours. I would return.

answers.text: the breakfast is poor and please go outside to take your breakfast, you will not miss the breakfast in Hotel...and too expensive for the food and serviceAVOID THIS HOTEL!

paragraphs.context: Aug 11 2009 HORRIBLE STAFF with TERRIBLE BREAKFAST and ROOM We were here for 3 Nights and we have book a business room with double bed, at the first sight everything looks ok from outside.... and then we were in the Lobby... the Staff were very impolite and couldn't speak English... the bell boy face look like if we smelled bad and very rude to us... Positive: Location is near to Nanjing Lu , can be reach by TaxiNegative:1. very rude, impolite Staff 2. the room smell strange and damp3. the breakfast is poor and please go outside to take your breakfast, you will not miss the breakfast in Hotel...and too expensive for the food and serviceAVOID THIS HOTEL!

answers.text: Superb room, breakfast (included), lobby lounge.

paragraphs.context: Jul 12 2008 Hotel Gault is superb Superb room, breakfast (included), lobby lounge. Room was very quiet, well provisioned. Great dinner in restaurant at reasonable price. Wonderful service was icing on the cake!!! Not for budget travellers but good value for everyone else at $220 given breakfast and two drinks were included in the price. Breakfast usually $20 p.p. and includes a buffet as well as hot food from a menu. Highly recommended.

answers.text: Breakfast also included and very good value, much better than most continental breakfasts.

paragraphs.context: Sep 6 2008 Excellent stay and very good value for money I'm very picky when it comes to hotels, but this one was really good value and defintiely exceeded my expectations. Rooms were quite large for NYC, and bathtroom was very big. Location is excellent, you can walk to anything really. Breakfast also included and very good value, much better than most continental breakfasts. I booked a very low rate and got a room just next to reception, which I was worried was going to be noicy but was not. However, in the morning it smelled like fresh baked goods due to it is proximity to the breakfast bufet! I would feniteiyl recommend this hotel.

answers.text: The breakfast really impressed us as we are used to continental breakfasts that consist of little more than donuts and coffee.

paragraphs.context: Jun 30 2006 A refuge! We spent a night here after our connecting flight home to Denver was cancelled and it was truly a refuge for weary travelers! A $10 cab ride from the airport. The room was plenty big enough for 2 adults and 2 teenagers, comfortable beds, nice and quiet location. The breakfast really impressed us as we are used to continental breakfasts that consist of little more than donuts and coffee. We feasted on the waffles, bagels, cereal, boiled eggs, pastries, Jimmy Dean breakfast sandwiches, great coffee, and fruit!The free internet station was invaluable to us in our efforts to get home. Just wish we'd had time to visit the Strip. Maybe next time. I would definitely stay here again.

answers.text: It costs $30 per person for a very average breakfast....

paragraphs.context: Aug 6 2009 Good deal Booked this hotel on priceline for $130/night. Great location and nice room (although a little on the small side). The walls were pretty thin in our room, however, as we could hear the people in the room next door. The hotel was the perfect distance away from the rucus of Times Square, while being a walk away all the attractions. WARNING: DO NOT EAT BREAKFAST AT THIS HOTEL. It costs $30 per person for a very average breakfast.... I strongly recommend eating breakfast at a resto nearby instead... what a ripoff. Would stay here again only if I get a great deal again. This hotel is definitely not work $400+ a night!

answers.text: Breakfast was very good and was included in the price.

paragraphs.context: Mar 20 2006 Good base to start exploring New York City I stayed here for 5 nights with my girlfriend. The location is very close to the subway where it can take you uptown or downtown. From here you can get to anywhere in Manhattan quite easily. There are not much nice restaurants around the hotel, but you can quickly go elsewhere via subway. The rooms are small, but more than adequate. Breakfast was very good and was included in the price. The breakfast area was very small and during peak times may be hard to find a table. The serving area was also small, so expect to get friendly with other visitors. :) Breakfast included hot food, fruit, pasteries, muffins, ceral, bread, bagels and numerous spreads. We grabed a few extra fuits and muffins for the day. Internet access was also included in the price. The hotel is faily new and was very pleasant to stay in. Would stay here again.

answers.text: The only small problem was that we had booked all 4 of our rooms on Expedia, and breakfast was to be included, but for some reason the hotel would only provide breakfast vouchers for 3 of the rooms, even though there were 5 people staying in the 4 rooms.

paragraphs.context: Nov 25 2006 Great stay at the Sofitel I had a nice stay in the Sofitel in August. Beautiful rooms,and good service in a fantastic location. Friendly and professional valet service. One of the best breakfasts in Montreal. The only small problem was that we had booked all 4 of our rooms on Expedia, and breakfast was to be included, but for some reason the hotel would only provide breakfast vouchers for 3 of the rooms, even though there were 5 people staying in the 4 rooms. It was not clear why some rooms came with vouchers, and others did not, considering they all were booked at the same time and for the same rate. We reached a compromise, where the hotel agreed to pay for 4 of the 5 breakfasts.

answers.text: We had a free breakfast coupon as part of the tour package.

paragraphs.context: Sep 30 2007 Good location We stayed at this hotel as part of a tour group. The rooms were okay-- the carpet in the rooms seemed a bit worn but not bad in cleanliness. Everything else was in clean and in order. It is not a 5 star hotel. 3 or 4 stars are more appropriate. Staff was excellent-- very good service and well trained. Internet worked fine. Location in the French Concession area was a plus for me. It had a feel like we were in a neighborhood where people actually lived. The taxi to places of interest is very cheap ( 11 Renmenbi to the Bund). Be aware that taxis can be hard to get in some places, like the Old City area, during rush hour. We had a free breakfast coupon as part of the tour package. The breakfast buffet at the top (a revolving restaurant) was excellent with chinese and western food choices. We had one night not part of the tour and the charge for breakfast was about 170 Renmenbi.

answers.text: We decided to have breakfast at the hotel restaurant to save us from walking elsewhere.

paragraphs.context: Aug 5 2009 Great luxury hotel with superb staff and eatery We got this hotel by chance since we decided the spur of the moment to spend a nite in Chicago on 7/24/09. We went thru Priceline and was lucky to get a room at this hotel for only $69 (normal rate was around $200). The room was superb on the 29th floor with a nice king bed. Hotel is only about 1.5 blocks to Michigan Ave so the location is very convenient. Parking is very expensive at $50 a nite but we parked right next door at a selfpark for just $30. We decided to have breakfast at the hotel restaurant to save us from walking elsewhere. We ordered the buckwheat pan cakes and egg benedict. They were absolutely delicious which stunned us since we did not expect this type of experience from a hotel restaurant especially for breakfast. Glad we did not pick their breakfast buffet since the special menu is much better. I highly recommend this beautiful and cozy hotel for your Chicago visit.

answers.text: We booked directly with the hotel and got a very good deal which included breakfast.

paragraphs.context: Mar 24 2009 Perfect location good hotel I stayed in the Roosevelt with 3 friends, all their to celebrate our birthdays. Having read some of the previous reviews I was a little nervous about staying here but our experience was very good. We booked directly with the hotel and got a very good deal which included breakfast. The breakfast buffet was excellent with a huge choice. The rooms were quite small but clean and comfortable. The bed one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The bathroom was a little tired but clean and perfectly adequate. The staff I dealt with, with the very notable exception of the woman making waffles at breakfast who was extraordinarily rude, were helpful and polite. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and I would happily return.

answers.text: Friendly staff, rooms were clean and you get complimentary wifi and continental breakfast.

paragraphs.context: Oct 16 2009 Good place to stay I thought the Hampton Inn was a great value place, you get more than your money's worth. Friendly staff, rooms were clean and you get complimentary wifi and continental breakfast. Quiet sleep and did not have to wait long for the elevators - longest I waited was possibly 2 minutes one time. The contentental breakfast had a good assortment - fruit, juice, bagels, donuts, yoghurt, cereal and 1 hot egg breakfast - not bad! Right around the corner from Macy's and Herald Square and next to that is Empire State Building - very nice to see at night! I would come here again. For a restaurant, try Nicks & Stef's Steak house $$$ but worth it - near Madison Square Garden. Also, go see Memphis Broadway show - very good show!

answers.text: - Plastic cups, knives, forks, plates, ...- Like a Fast Food restaurant, once you had finished your breakfast, you had to clean your table yourself, and throw all the rubish and plastic place settings away in the two big dustbins that were placed nearby the basket of bread.-

paragraphs.context: Jul 29 2004 Paper cup plastic forks knives and plates in breakfast The hotel has no cooker, no dishwasher, no drinks in stock... Consequence :- Simple continental breakfast (no eggs, no cold meat, ...) - Plastic cups, knives, forks, plates, ...- Like a Fast Food restaurant, once you had finished your breakfast, you had to clean your table yourself, and throw all the rubish and plastic place settings away in the two big dustbins that were placed nearby the basket of bread.- If you have drunk the bottle of water in your minibar, and want another bottle, you have to wait for the next day, because they have no provisions at the hotel.

answers.text: Every morning the hotel staff would send asian origin customers to an alternate breakfast area at the back of the hotel where it was cold, little choice of food and lack of staff and no cuttery avaliable.

paragraphs.context: Apr 3 2009 Terrible hotel terrible staff Stayed at Grand View Garden Hotel end of March with family. At first the hotel appeared to be clean but on inspection bathrooms were not cleansed properly, hair was evident from the previous customer. Breakfast was a lovely if you were allowed in breakfast area. With the excuse of a full breakfast area ( even though room would not be half filled). Every morning the hotel staff would send asian origin customers to an alternate breakfast area at the back of the hotel where it was cold, little choice of food and lack of staff and no cuttery avaliable. Western customers were allowed to enter the main breakfast area even though I was told prior to them that the room was full. When asked for an explanation, the hotel staff (Jenny) ignored me and pretended that she did not understand, waving her hand to gesture me to leave. Overall very dissappointed with this hotel and never stay there again.

answers.text: We also had a complimentary buffet breakfast each day of our stay, which was tasty.

paragraphs.context: Mar 23 2005 Wonderful experience I stayed at the Nikko for 4 nights and had a wonderful experience. The room and bathroom were impeccable. Each night when we returned from our convention and from sightseeing, the beds were turned down and 2 chocolates left on the bed. Also, they had soft music playing after housekeeping had been in the room. We also had a complimentary buffet breakfast each day of our stay, which was tasty. They offered an American breakfast as well as a Japanese breakfast at the buffet. The concierge was extremely helpful and was knowledgeable.

answers.text: The breakfast was modest, but adequate and there are a couple of breakfast spots within half a block.

paragraphs.context: Jun 1 2008 A good place to stay at a good price. I would do it again! We spent five days at the downtown Rodeway Inn and we enjoyed our stay. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. Maid service kept everything refreshed and clean. The bathroom looked like it was recently remodeled. The wifi worked very well, one of the best for a motel that I've used. The breakfast was modest, but adequate and there are a couple of breakfast spots within half a block. Our room offered a fridge and microwave plus the standard coffee maker. A mini mart is across the street. We particulary enjoyed the getting our breakfast at a Korean restaurant run by a very nice couple that was half a block on 9th street towards Market Street. The Rodeway Inn was convenient to Market Street, BART, MUNI (the bus line) and the Civic Center. We found the location to be a good base for a vacation in San Francisco.

answers.text: We paid only 275$ per night (incl. taxes,breakfast,evening reception);booked at the Hilton website.

paragraphs.context: Oct 22 2008 NY? Embassy Suites!!! We spend two post-cruise days at the Embassy Suites Hotel and there is absolutely nothing to complain! We paid only 275$ per night (incl. taxes,breakfast,evening reception);booked at the Hilton website. The breakfast was very croweded on a saturday morning but the staff did everything to speed up the service. The quality and quantity of the breakfast items is perfect. Wo most liked the location: Everything you can imagine is there:A WholeFoods store one block away;cinema , a(very good) italianrestaurant and an Applebee in the same building. Subway is two blocks away; watertaxi in front of the hotel. Everything else is already said in other reviews.

answers.text: Alright for the money but do not buy the breakfast!

paragraphs.context: Oct 10 2007 Alright for the money but do not buy the breakfast! We stayed in the Skyline for 4 nights in July 07. The hotel was ok and the room was ok and a good size (apart from the smell of stale smoke - must have been an old smoking room). What let the place down though was the staff when something went wrong. We have 2 teenage boys and had no TV the whole time we were there and no-one cared. Don't whatever you do buy the buffet breakfast - rip off! When things run out that's just your tough luck cause they do not refil it. Go to the 10th Avenue diner (out the hotel turn left) as their breakfast is fab! The room and bathroom were clean and the parking was excellent as well. The hotel is well situated for Times Square and some excellent restaurants in Hells Kitchen. Most miserable member of staff award goes to the woman on the ticket desk at the Natural History Museum!

answers.text: We didnt have the breakfast as i thought it was overpriced!

paragraphs.context: Mar 6 2009 The location of this hotel could not have been better I must admit I was a little nervous before getting to the hotel from reading the reviews online. When we got there we were too early for check in so they held our bags for us (the doorman/bag man was sooooo grumpy). We came back at 2pm to check in and was told it would be another 20 minutes so we waited in the breakfast room, well 1hr 45 mins later we finally checked in! The reception staff were really nice and friendly! The room was great (room 414) much bigger than i had expected, we had lots of space! We could not have wished for a better location, just around the corner from Times Square. I think would take us about 3 minutes to get to the centre. The room was cleaned every day and the lifts worked fine! We didnt have the breakfast as i thought it was overpriced! There was lots of places just down from the hotel to have breakfast. All in all the Hotel was fab!

answers.text: The breakfast is included and it is nice to have someone bring you a fresh pot of coffee and fresh toast and jam.

paragraphs.context: Aug 4 2009 Clean friendly and a safe neighbourhood Stayed here for 5 days. The double room is very small, but it was nice and clean. The bathroom although small was clean and the shower had great pressure (no tub). The breakfast is included and it is nice to have someone bring you a fresh pot of coffee and fresh toast and jam. Breakfast includes, cereal, toast, breakfast pastries, yogurt, juice, tea, cheese, meat and fresh fruit and hard boiled eggs. There are many great restaurants in the area. Front desk staff was very helpful and loaned us an umbrella one night. (We did not even ask). We received a discount for paying .

answers.text: At check-in time I was asked if I wanted to add-on breakfasts for 10 ponds a day in advnace, or if not in advnce (at check-in time) it would cost 19 pounds.

paragraphs.context: Nov 13 2008 Good but also pricey No doubt this is a hotel with nice, rather recently modernised rooms. Modern design and good furniture, however the renovation budget, reportedly 20 million British pounds was not enough to replace the aged windows. Location is close to the Russell Square tube station and close to the British museum. Price is high but most hotels in London are overpriced and the Russell Hotel is probably just in line with what the market gives. However if breakfast were included in the price, one might coem awya feeling to have gotten a relatively fair deal. At check-in time I was asked if I wanted to add-on breakfasts for 10 ponds a day in advnace, or if not in advnce (at check-in time) it would cost 19 pounds. I decided to go for a short morning stroll to near-by cafes and had breakfasts for under 10 quid, as they say. Otherwise, an acceptable place, worth a try.

answers.text: Breakfast is pretty good although way and by far the most 'cheap experience' is a sign stating that a cooked breakfast is CAD$ 4 (EUR 2.50)

paragraphs.context: Jun 2 2009 4 Star...in a French sort of way Really a very nice, competent hotel albeit the 4* classification should be calibrated on a "French scale". Often not mentioned but the location is second to none. The staff were helpful but under no circumstances friendly/engaging...at least for Anglophiles. The room (we had a better-than-average suite) was also very adequate, spacious and well equipped...although devoid of any real opulence. Breakfast is pretty good although way and by far the most 'cheap experience' is a sign stating that a cooked breakfast is CAD$ 4 (EUR 2.50) extra!!..this is exacerbated by a whole dialogue with the hostess about your entitlement to a "cold or hot breakfast". Fine for the YMCA but not a 4* hotel in Old Town Montreal.

answers.text: They had not change their listings with the trourist office in this time and I would not have booked there if there was not some breakfast, a basic expectation for small Montreal hotels and

paragraphs.context: Feb 8 2007 Not what was advertised While this is rated as a 3 star, it is more like a Quebec 2 1/2 star. I booked through the Montreal tourist office (absolutely fabulous service - always has been) and they spotted a good price (comparable to other 3 stars) that included 2 full breakfasts. When getting to the hotel I found out there were no breakfasts and there hadn't been for 2 months (with the supplying kitchen closed) - total 5$ / night was removed from the bill (a token for two people and the inconvenience). They had not change their listings with the trourist office in this time and I would not have booked there if there was not some breakfast, a basic expectation for small Montreal hotels and B&Bs. The restaurent beside the hotel opens late and closes early. Otherwise desk help was friendly. Parking is 12$ per night in a garage near the hotel - OKThere is great value in Montreal in 2 and 3 stars not to have surprises

answers.text: Breakfast was included in the rate.

paragraphs.context: Nov 21 2004 Good Little Hotel Great Location! We stayed at the Montana Hotel on 17 November. We needed a cheap hotel for our last night in London and we liked the Gloucester Road area. They quoted us a price of 75 pounds and my husband bargained the rate down to 65 pounds. Our room was larger than I expected for a budget hotel. It had a double bed and also a twin bed. The down side was the bathroom was the size of a closet but it was clean and there was plenty of hot water. Also, the bed was extremely hard but it was okay for one night. Breakfast was included in the rate. The free breakfast consisted of coffee, tea or juice and toast. Anything else was extra but the free breakfast was adequate. Would probably stay there again if nothing else was available mainly because I liked the area.

answers.text: The breakfast included was standard, the breakfast area was in a windowless room that could have been improved upon.

paragraphs.context: Sep 20 2008 Lovely comfortable boutique hotel- great location This is a very comfortable boutique hotel located on a very pretty street. You are located in walking distance of beautiful old Montreal and a short cab ride to the great shopping on rue St. Catherine. We found the room extremely spacious and comfortable. The bed was fantastic and the bathroom was clean and well-supplied. The World Cup was on while we were visiting and my husband was able to enjoy a lot of it because the TV in the room was big with great reception! (sometimes hotel TVs can be small and sketchy!) We found that the room was particularly quiet, which we appreciated- you really couldn't hear any noise outside. The breakfast included was standard, the breakfast area was in a windowless room that could have been improved upon. But no complaints with the quality of the breakfast. The service was excellent and we were very happy with our stay. We would likely return as the value we received was very good.

extractions: view of the city and the

answers.text: Skip the breakfast-we've had much better free continental breakfasts at the Hampton and Marriott.

paragraphs.context: Jul 31 2007 A Nice Hotel The parking garage was clean, safe, and very easily accesible from the hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was large, clean, and comfortable with a nice view of the city and the Mont Royal. The hotel is very close to two metro stations so getting around is easy. It's also close to the highway so we did not have to drive in downtown Montreal for very long. Skip the breakfast-we've had much better free continental breakfasts at the Hampton and Marriott. This breakfast is not worth the money.

answers.text: I am a Gold Hilton Honors member and usually receive two complimentary breakfasts at the Urban Tavern; complimentary breakfast was a grande beverage and a pastry at Starbucks.

paragraphs.context: Disappointing Stay While I agree with other reviewers that the location is ideal, I was disappointed at my recent stay.
