Front desk staff was very unfriendly and not helfpful at all. I am a Gold Hilton Honors member and usually receive two complimentary breakfasts at the Urban Tavern; complimentary breakfast was a grande beverage and a pastry at Starbucks. In the past I have been treated to a nice continental sit-down breakfast in the Urban Tavern with hot oatmeal and fresh fruit and pastries. My room was in tower 3 with no view of the city at all; we could barely see the sky from our window. I was given a key to the mini bar, but there was no mini bar in the room. When I called customer service, the gentleman who answered the phone acted as though I were bothering him. The price would really have to be right in order for me to stay in this hotel again.

answers.text: Breakfast was included within my package deal with Virgin Holidays although the hotel were unaware of this.

paragraphs.context: Aug 4 2009 A grand hotel with excellent service The hotel is located in Nob Hill and although high up, the cable cars run regularly outside. Travelling back in summer might involve a long wait. The room was palatial, clean and very comfortable. I could hear my neighbours quite clearly however. Breakfast was included within my package deal with Virgin Holidays although the hotel were unaware of this. They were very helpful and gave me complimentary breakfast each day and did not even charge me for phone call made. This was great as the breakfasts were AMAZING - certainly 5 star and not cheap either! I was suprised that rooms didnt have tea/coffee facilities - every hotel I've been in have this. They told me that 24 hour room service was available, but that's not the same as making yourself a quick cuppa in the morning. However, a great stay.

answers.text: Other people have mentioned it but a free cooked breakfast is fantastic.

paragraphs.context: Aug 12 2008 Great breakfast great room what more can you want! Stayed at the Embassy Suites for one night. Check in was a breeze. The suite itself comprised of a living room and bed room. There was a flat screen tv in the living room and a conventional one in the bedroom for those that care :) As it was a reward night, room service delivered free bottles of water to the room. A nice touch. The bed was luxurious and very hard to get out of in the morning!Ah breakfast! Other people have mentioned it but a free cooked breakfast is fantastic. I ate two omelets they were that good. Location wise, it was a 10 - 15 minute walk to Navy Pier and shopping and a subway stop were very close by. Overall, a great stay.

answers.text: I was surprised when the staff told me that breakfast was included in the price!

paragraphs.context: Aug 19 2008 Welcoming! Excellent for Quality/price. On our arrival, the staff was very welcoming! I booked a standard room which had a private bathroom and a kitchen too! Everything was very clean! I was surprised when the staff told me that breakfast was included in the price! Breakfast was good too (continental breakfast). I will definitely recommend this place to my friends!

answers.text: Oh, and breakfast is good, but NY-pricy - you absolutely want to go and try the charming "Le pain quotidien&quot

paragraphs.context: Mar 16 2005 Location - Location - Location Just spent five days in New York - business and pleasure - and loved staying at the Soho Grand. The location is perfect - all downtown is within walking distance. The Service was excellent - especially the Concierge, who managed everything (dinner-rescheduling, car-renting...) within minutes. The setting is beautiful and modern (but too posh-stylish - I do not want to get into a Helmut Lang-Suit just to have breakfast) Oh, and breakfast is good, but NY-pricy - you absolutely want to go and try the charming "Le pain quotidien&quot ; for breakfast, just a two minutes-walk away on Grand Street (at Mercer)...as always: it is all about location and here, you're in the middle of it all!

answers.text: Complimentary breakfast is good but would say that it would be great if they could provide a cooked breakfast or buffet, but this will in now way stop us from staying there again and I will definitely recommend it to all my friends.

paragraphs.context: Jun 27 2007 Wonderful boutique hotel Just returned from a four night stay with my 16 year old daughter. Booked after reading previous write-ups and was not disappointed. Lovely hotel with absolutely wonderful staff from which nothing is too much trouble from the front desk staff to the lady that cleaned our room everyone was polite and made us feel welcome. The rooms are lovely, we shared a deluxe twin with balcony. Large room with loads of mirrors (just what a sixteen year old needs). Bathroom was well stocked with plenty of excellent products. Complimentary breakfast is good but would say that it would be great if they could provide a cooked breakfast or buffet, but this will in now way stop us from staying there again and I will definitely recommend it to all my friends. Hotel is in a good area within walking distance of shops and a metro on the doorstep. Definitely a good place to stay and would be more than a 3.5* if they provided a buffet breakfast.

extractions: walking distance to all main areas

answers.text: breakfast is on the 2nd floor restaurant, not too many selection, but food is fancy and taste good.

paragraphs.context: Oct 16 2009 Wonderful Experience stay there for the long weekend from 09/05-09/07. unbeatable location. walking distance to all main areas and subway station. quiet area. nice front desk staffs, very professional. nice contemporary design. use real green apple as decoration at the elevator area (i saw someone actually ate the apple while waiting for the elevator). breakfast & valet parking is included in my package. end up we did not need to drive at all, everything is walking distance. breakfast is on the 2nd floor restaurant, not too many selection, but food is fancy and taste good. we got to try out a rare kind of French cheese (unbelievably good!!) * ** there is a line up for the breakfast buffet though :( short on staff to clean up the table * * * otherwise, everything exceeds my expectation. I normally stays at the W or the QE Fairmont; just want to try something new this time and I made a wise choice. will visit again!!!

answers.text: The hotel is conveniently situated for all kinds of sight seeing, our room was clean and breakfast was inlcuded in our rate.

paragraphs.context: Oct 26 2009 It's ok if... ... you manage to get a room to the back. We were luckly to get a room on short notice in the high season. Our room was clean and spacious but it went out to the front and Rue Sherbrooke is a very busy street so it was far too noisy for us. It was quite hot, when we stayed there and there was not AC in our room so we would have liked to sleep with the window open but no way. Even with the windows closed it was noisy. The hotel is conveniently situated for all kinds of sight seeing, our room was clean and breakfast was inlcuded in our rate. The breakfast room, though, is stiflingly small and the breakfast is nothing to get excited about.

answers.text: No breakfast, no (free) gym (costs 20 USD for already paying customers).

paragraphs.context: Nov 16 2008 Nice hotel dissapointing service We stayed at the HRH 9-10 Nov. Unlike the other reviews we had no nuisance with the current construction work. The rooms were big, very clean and had a massive flatscreen TV in it. Very nice bathroom and cosy bed. But that was it. No breakfast, no (free) gym (costs 20 USD for already paying customers). Overall it looked nice. Front desk lady was a bit cool, explaining thoroughly about the minibar and it not being free, well duh..!!)You do need a car! Walk TO the strip is it least 20 min. Go for breakfast to Hotel Paris: Excellent breakfast buffet!

answers.text: I usually am not fond of breakfast in hotels because i never think it is worth it, but the breakfast here is unreal and well worth the money.

paragraphs.context: Sep 4 2009 This is the best hotel i have ever stayed in in my life Everything about this hotel was fantastic. The staff , the hotel facilities, the food, the rooms, i could go on and on and on and they all get 5 stars from me. The breakfast was out of this world. I usually am not fond of breakfast in hotels because i never think it is worth it, but the breakfast here is unreal and well worth the money. I can't imagine ever been in hotel again that will top this place.

answers.text: Breakfast was included and I loved making my own belgian waffles in the morning, but on weekdays breakfast ends at 9:30am which I feel is too early when you have been out late during days at the Jazz festival.

paragraphs.context: Jul 5 2006 Residence Is Right Downtown I stayed four nights at the Residence Inn which had great rooms with a little kitchenette, but there were obvious problems with the hotel. First off, there were only three small elevators in the hotel so it would take forever for you to get up to your room. The elevators were always crammed and tight. Breakfast was included and I loved making my own belgian waffles in the morning, but on weekdays breakfast ends at 9:30am which I feel is too early when you have been out late during days at the Jazz festival. Also, there aren't many tables for breakfast so you might have to wait a while to grab a seat, if it is busy. One other problem was that the pool is small and there are no changerooms so you have to change in the bathroom. Other than those problems, my stay at the Residence Inn was okay and the hotel is right downtown.

answers.text: If the breakfast had been better I would have given it 4.

paragraphs.context: Jul 28 2008 OK Hotel for a stay in New York We stayed at the Comfort Inn for 5 days in May 2008. We choose this hotel based on the location, the user reviews, the included breakfast and the price. The hotel is located very close to Times Square on 8 th avenue. Thus the location is good even though 8th avenue is a little gloomy at night. The Hotel is quite new, and the staff is friendly. All in all we we can recommend this hotel for a quick trip to NY. It is good value for money, but do not expect too much though. One thing you shouldn't choose this hotel for is the breakfast. That was simply a joke! If the breakfast had been better I would have given it 4.

answers.text: Bad breakfast Nice hotel and location, but the breakfast...

paragraphs.context: Feb 11 2009 Bad breakfast Nice hotel and location, but the breakfast... If they call a very small glass of orange juice, a slice of bread and a glass of coffee breakfast...

answers.text: Breakfast is not included and there is no breakfast on site.

paragraphs.context: May 20 2007 Medium opinion Good location. Average (but clean) room. The staff is not very friendly. It is strange to find the reception behind a glass wall (as in an adminstration). Breakfast is not included and there is no breakfast on site. (The only service provided is a free coffee/tea/chocolate machine). We decided to buy our breakfast in a very good bagel's shop on 5th avenue, to bring it back to the hotel and eat it in the lounge using the free coeffee machine.

answers.text: We had previously stayed at the Boulevard Hotel, Paddington, and found it to be clean, modern, and well worth the money, which included continental breakfast.

paragraphs.context: Aug 26 2008 not what we expected We had previously stayed at the Boulevard Hotel, Paddington, and found it to be clean, modern, and well worth the money, which included continental breakfast. A year later we returned to find the hotel in the middle of a takeover by easyjet(everything bright orange) but had not been told this on booking. The room was small, the wardrobe had gone(we were left with 2 coathangers), and everything was bright orange(not for the fainthearted).Also around us were building materials and paint. When we went down to breakfast on the first morning we were told it was not at the hotel but we could have a voucher for McDonalds down the road(not appealing at the best of times).I just feel we should have been told about the refit and lack of breakfast and then we could have made the choice of whether to stay or book somewhere else. The only saving grace were the polite staff.

answers.text: You are better off trying to get a discount by getting a room without breakfast.

paragraphs.context: May 6 2009 Mixed bag Generally great... clean, smart, good location but.. generally little niggles. Firstly the food (especially breakfast) is utterly dire. breakfast is a buffet set up and was cold and generally quite disgusting. You are better off trying to get a discount by getting a room without breakfast. Evening meals meanwhle are overpriced and nothing special, you are better off going out to eat. Our delux room was extremely comfortable and easily the cleanest place we stayed in India, but had no window and had an annoying dripping tap.i found the service to be good. One thing, and I am being pedantic but... laundry is overpriced and then it all comes back with a number written in marker pen on each individual piece that even now, 6 weeks later refuses to come off. It was also late coming back, turned up with extra items that I sent back.. and was promptly charged for anway.

answers.text: The free breakfast was wonderful however.

paragraphs.context: Feb 11 2005 great breakfast! If you are looking for a value and a great breakfast this is your place. However the rooms and the lobby required a bit of getting used to... clean but spare. Booked through Quikbook and upon confirming reservation I asked for a room with a view. Got just the opposite however.. a room on the second floor in the back overlooking the interior of the hotel. The neighborhood also seemed a little seedy at times despite the fact that the hotel is positioned right at the top of the Park avenue south area. The free breakfast was wonderful however. It reminded me a little of an English breakfast in a European hostel and it really made this hotel selection worthwhile. All types of pastries, fruit, cereal, boiled eggs, yogurt, bagels, granola bars..perfect.

answers.text: They offered wonderful features like an evening wine & cheese hour and a great continental breakfast.

paragraphs.context: Jul 7 2008 Great boutique hotel...but... We stayed for 3 nights over the July 4th weekend. The hotel has a fabulous location, great staff and service. They offered wonderful features like an evening wine & cheese hour and a great continental breakfast. We booked our room using Expedia, which makes me wonder if this had any affect on the location of our room assignment. We were located right beside the breakfast reception area. The noise from staff setting up the breakfast each morning distrubed our sleep. We were woke up at 6:45 a.m. to the sounds of clanging dishes and other usual kitchen noises. We also heard other guests enjoying their breakfast all morning long, as we tried to catch a few more moments of sleep. We did request a room change, but the hotel was fully occupied. But all this said - we would stay at this hotel again. I would just request a room towards the back of the hotel, to ensure a quieter morning.

answers.text: I'm accustomed to staying at hotels where breakfast is included and it was here, but the breakfasts paled in comparison to the hearty sit down dinners.

paragraphs.context: Feb 24 2009 Good Deal. Our Meal Plan Was Unusual. My wife and I stayed at The Cornell using one of their promotions and were happy with the lodging. What was unusual was that dinner was included in our price. I'm accustomed to staying at hotels where breakfast is included and it was here, but the breakfasts paled in comparison to the hearty sit down dinners. We like to try different restaurants at night so the deal we had was wasted two of our five nights. I would have preferred a "choice" breakfast option (eggs meurette perhaps?) but the dinners, when we ate them, were quite lovely.

answers.text: It was a pretty good deal considering that it included daily buffet breakfast.

paragraphs.context: Apr 14 2008 good hotel okay location... We booked our stay through the montreal tourism website, we paid $189 for the 1st night, 50% off the second night. It was a pretty good deal considering that it included daily buffet breakfast. The breakfast was wonderful, every possible choice, including fresh omelettes made to order. Hotel was clean, staff friendly. My only concern was that we were told that we were connected to underground shopping, I assumed that it would be connected to the eaton center somehow, but it was not. You have a mall (complexes dejardins) downstairs, but you'll have to walk a couple of blocks before you get to the main shopping area. This hotel is quite far from the main area (too east), next time I'm going to stay at a hotel more on the west end, but I'll definitely miss the buffet breakfast!!

answers.text: However, we booked a room for 4 with a bed and breakfast deal.

paragraphs.context: Aug 19 2009 Decent hotel but small rooms We stayed 4 nights in the Hilton and it was OK overall - clean, quiet, good location. However, we booked a room for 4 with a bed and breakfast deal. The room was small for the 4 of us - basically the two double beds took up most of the space. The hotel certainly was not full, and I was surprised they crammed us into the room, although technically speaking, that is what we reseved. Also, the special included only breakfast for 2 people - and it was well over 20$ per person for the breakfast - it was good, very good, but that's a bit pricey!In all fairness, we did get what we paid for, and I can't really compare to other hotels in the area, but I feel it was a bit overpriced for what it is.

answers.text: We were also invited to eat breakfast, which was still being served.

paragraphs.context: Jul 23 2009 A Great Surprise! We changed our plans to Vegas at the last minute and booked one night at the Hampton Inn Tropicana. We were pleasantly surprised when we called the hotel from the airport and found out that they have a free airport shuttle. We landed in Vegas around 8am and the shuttle picked us up. We were allowed to check in early, which was fantastic. We were also invited to eat breakfast, which was still being served. The breakfast was your typical hotel breakfast. The hotel lobby and common areas were very nice. We loved the room. Both the room and bathroom were nicely appointed and both very clean. The bed was comfortable. The hotel staff was very friendly as well. The shuttle dropped us off a few times at Mandalay Bay, which was an added bonus, as we were attending events there. If you need a place to stay near the strip that is a great price, this is a great choice.

answers.text: The breakfast is a great thing for familes, eating out for breakfast, even a diner, cost us more than 50.00, with the continental breakfast the kids are satisfied and it is free.

paragraphs.context: Apr 13 2007 Great value great hotel! This is a great place for families. We stayed here for 3 nights with our 3 kids. The view when the fog rolled out was one of the best I have ever seen. The room is very large and clean. Staff was always helpful and friendly. The neighborhood felt very safe. The breakfast is a great thing for familes, eating out for breakfast, even a diner, cost us more than 50.00, with the continental breakfast the kids are satisfied and it is free. There is a computer in the lobby that our teenage daughter used often. The top of the Marc is across the street, my husband and I went there a couple of times for drinks great view. So glad we chose this hotel.

answers.text: The bonus is the breakfast that is provided free.

paragraphs.context: Mar 12 2008 Great hotel My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in march 2008.I picked it after reading good reviews and would highly reccommend it. Its ideally situated as its a five minute walk from times square and close to the subways. I felt very safe in the vacinity of the hotel. Our room was on the inside of the hotel and our view was of offices and not very exciting. But I certainly didnt spend much time in the room looking out of my window!I found the hotel very clean, the staff were helpful and the room although not huge, was perfect for our needs. The bonus is the breakfast that is provided free. I found that lots of hotels dont do breakfasts as new yorkers eat out. We saved a lot of money that we would have spent on breakfasts. If I ever return to New York I will definitely stay here again.

answers.text: Breakfast was expensive and no items were replenished after 9.30 - breakfast finished at 10.00 a.m.

paragraphs.context: Sep 27 2009 This hotel has seen better days. Our room - Forbidden City view at a premium price (1700.00 yuan per night) was shabby with heavily stained carpets. Breakfast was expensive and no items were replenished after 9.30 - breakfast finished at 10.00 a.m. On one occasion it was suggested to us at about 9.55 that we might consider leaving the restaurant as they wanted to prepare for lunch. The 2 speciality Chinese restaurants were reasonably priced and served good food. The management should walk 200 yards up the road to The Grand Hyatt where, for the same price, you get a clean, modern hotel, a room on the Executive Lounge floor with free evening cocktails and snacks, and Continental Breakfast included,

answers.text: We've got a good deal with Hotels.com and paid EUR 125 (including breakfast) so that was a very good deal.

paragraphs.context: Apr 9 2009 Landmark hotel on East Nanjing Road with best breakfast buffet The architecture of this hotel is very striking. When you come towards East Nanjing road, you really can't miss it. The service is good and the staff speaks decent English. The rooms are nice but the best thing about this hotel is the breakfast buffet. We've got a good deal with Hotels.com and paid EUR 125 (including breakfast) so that was a very good deal. The only bad thing of the hotel is the high charge for using the internet (EUR 1 per 2 minutes). But since internet is only available in the top hotels, you do not have much choice. If you like shopping, then East Nanjing Road is the place to be. I personally like the French Concession more because I like the nice little boutiques and the best restaurants are situated there.

answers.text: The breakfast buffet, by the way, is amazing.

paragraphs.context: Jan 4 2009 Bed so comfy! I am writing this review from the hotel bed. It is so comfortable , I can't bring myself to get out of it! The hotel room is large also. We were very happy here. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because 2 days in a row the front desk gave us wrong information about concierge level lounge. So two mornings in a row, we missed breakfast. However, we told them to compensate us for a breakfast downstairs and they did. The breakfast buffet, by the way, is amazing. We were also given usage of the complementry house car. That was a great touch. My husband had his suit dry cleaned while we were here, and it was picked up and dropped off same day in our room. Great hotel in a great location in Union Square.

answers.text: One of the best breakfasts in Montreal.

paragraphs.context: Nov 25 2006 Great stay at the Sofitel I had a nice stay in the Sofitel in August. Beautiful rooms,and good service in a fantastic location. Friendly and professional valet service. One of the best breakfasts in Montreal. The only small problem was that we had booked all 4 of our rooms on Expedia, and breakfast was to be included, but for some reason the hotel would only provide breakfast vouchers for 3 of the rooms, even though there were 5 people staying in the 4 rooms. It was not clear why some rooms came with vouchers, and others did not, considering they all were booked at the same time and for the same rate. We reached a compromise, where the hotel agreed to pay for 4 of the 5 breakfasts.

answers.text: With the excuse of a full breakfast area ( even though room would not be half filled).

paragraphs.context: Apr 3 2009 Terrible hotel terrible staff Stayed at Grand View Garden Hotel end of March with family. At first the hotel appeared to be clean but on inspection bathrooms were not cleansed properly, hair was evident from the previous customer. Breakfast was a lovely if you were allowed in breakfast area. With the excuse of a full breakfast area ( even though room would not be half filled). Every morning the hotel staff would send asian origin customers to an alternate breakfast area at the back of the hotel where it was cold, little choice of food and lack of staff and no cuttery avaliable. Western customers were allowed to enter the main breakfast area even though I was told prior to them that the room was full. When asked for an explanation, the hotel staff (Jenny) ignored me and pretended that she did not understand, waving her hand to gesture me to leave. Overall very dissappointed with this hotel and never stay there again.

answers.text: However, we advise that you do NOT ask for English Breakfast Tea at breakfast because, although it is supplied on the complimentary beverage tray in the bedrooms, you will be told that you CAN NOT have it at breakfast - only fruit teas.

paragraphs.context: Jul 1 2005 Good location Meridien is in a good location and the majority of the staff are very friendly and helpful. Rooms were comfortable, clean and spacious. However, we advise that you do NOT ask for English Breakfast Tea at breakfast because, although it is supplied on the complimentary beverage tray in the bedrooms, you will be told that you CAN NOT have it at breakfast - only fruit teas. Rather frustrating when you know it is in the building! Make a fuss and they'll find it. Pity this is our lasting impression of a good hotel.

answers.text: Breakfast is 30 yuan (approx $5.10US), and changes many items daily.

paragraphs.context: Apr 5 2008 Good budget hotel We stayed in the Nanjing Hotel last month. It is a good, basic budget hotel, just a few steps from Nanjing Lu. I picked this hotel because it was within walking distance to things we wanted to see, but then we never did any walking. Took taxis everywhere. Due to congestion in front of the hotel, taxi drivers may drop you off the block before. Some taxi drivers had difficulty finding the place, so be sure to take a map of its location with you. Hotel was very clean, and the front desk staff spoke very good English. Breakfast is 30 yuan (approx $5.10US), and changes many items daily. Compared to what we pay in the US for breakfast, it was very good value, but you need to like to eat vegetables for breakfast. Several times we ate food from nearby street vendors, and had breakfasts for 3rmb. We hated Shanghai (much prefer Beijing), but if we ever go back, we would stay there again.

answers.text: When we arrived there was a confusion about our trip having breakfast or not: they solved it without hesitation by saying we had, but also gave us 1 breakfast buffet (which was really, REALLY good) for the 5 of us, plus the afternoon snacks (which I'm sure we did not have access to).

paragraphs.context: Oct 19 2009 Excelent for the price and the location is fabulous Since we got an incredible cheap price for the trip, I was not sure if it was goingto be good. It was. The rooms are average, bed unbelievable comfortable and awesome view to the Navy Pier. When we arrived there was a confusion about our trip having breakfast or not: they solved it without hesitation by saying we had, but also gave us 1 breakfast buffet (which was really, REALLY good) for the 5 of us, plus the afternoon snacks (which I'm sure we did not have access to). So, just to point out: excellent service basically everywhere: at the check in, solving our little breakfast problem, at the restaurant. The location is perfect, it is walking distance to Michigan Ave., the Millennium Park, it was really convenient for us. I think I would stay here again!

answers.text: When checking in we were told the continental breakfast was free, but the hot breakfast was not.

paragraphs.context: Oct 18 2004 Don't waste your money! We requested early check-in (regular check-in is at 3:00pm), got there at 2:30pm and had to wait an hour and a half to get a room. They wouldn't even notify us when our room was ready, I had to stand in line every half hour and inquire about my room. Room was pretty clean but the decor is cheap and tacky. When checking in we were told the continental breakfast was free, but the hot breakfast was not. I had eggs and coffee, my wife had a bagel and coffee. We were charged $14 for hot breakfast and $10 for continental. I complained to manager at checkout and he said "I find it hard to believe that you were told the continental breakfast was free." I asked if he found it easier to believe that I was lying... he then said "you consumed the breakfast, you have to pay for the breakfast." To avoid a fight I just paid, but will never stay there again. The Sheraton and the Marriott cost about the same, but are much classier hotels.

answers.text: we did not purchase a room package that included breakfast - maybe that would have been cheaper.

paragraphs.context: Apr 25 2009 Good value; great location Husband and I stayed here for a one-day stop in Beijing en route to a conference. Location was convenient to the night market, Forbidden City, Tianamen Square - all an easy walk. (Ignore the constant pestering for people to give you a lift there ... it is a quick and easy walk.) Price (about $140 on Travelocity) seemed fair given the location - could have found cheaper but would have been less convenient to the sights. Breakfast was pricey ... we did not purchase a room package that included breakfast - maybe that would have been cheaper. Just walking in and paying was $50 for two of us - OUCH. It was a standard buffet with lots of options, but no buffet breakfast is worth $25 a pop! Room itself was fine ... not huge, but I think that's the norm. Room was clean and had everything we needed.

answers.text: Heard that breakfast is only provided during summer and even dinner buffet from mon to thurs even though we did not try it.

paragraphs.context: Jul 30 2008 comfortable and great location Stayed there for 4 nights. I think the room rate of US$200 which includes breakfast, is reasonable during 4th July weekend since it went up to US$280 the week after. Not every hotel provides breakfast. Heard that breakfast is only provided during summer and even dinner buffet from mon to thurs even though we did not try it. Comfortable bed and clean room with a sofa bed that could accommodate up to a family of 4. Housekeeping is done everyday. There is a fridge and microwave oven but we never used it since we are out everyday. Great location as well, near the subway, times sq, empire state, rockefella centre, restaurants and shopping area 5th ave.

answers.text: So two mornings in a row, we missed breakfast.

paragraphs.context: Jan 4 2009 Bed so comfy! I am writing this review from the hotel bed. It is so comfortable , I can't bring myself to get out of it! The hotel room is large also. We were very happy here. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because 2 days in a row the front desk gave us wrong information about concierge level lounge. So two mornings in a row, we missed breakfast. However, we told them to compensate us for a breakfast downstairs and they did. The breakfast buffet, by the way, is amazing. We were also given usage of the complementry house car. That was a great touch. My husband had his suit dry cleaned while we were here, and it was picked up and dropped off same day in our room. Great hotel in a great location in Union Square.

qas.question: Does your breakfast include vegan options?

answers.text: The breakfast room had cereal, juice ,toast, waffles,and muffins.

paragraphs.context: Sep 21 2008 Great value for the price We chose this hotel because we were just off a cruise in Brooklyn and wanted something close to the port and not too far from Little Italy. We wanted to visit the San Gennaro feast. I must say we were pleasantly surprised. The room was clean and well-decorated. We had a mini-fridge, a safe and continental breakfast. The breakfast room had cereal, juice ,toast, waffles,and muffins. The only setback is that it is small(4 tables).Then there were some selfish people there who sat and chatted at a table for about 20 minutesafter they had finished while some people had to eat breakfast on a chair. The staff was very helpful when we asked for directions. If you're expecting the Waldorf Astoria, do not book there. But if you want a clean and comfortable hotel at a reasonable price, the Seaport fits the bill.

answers.text: Great value because of the evening "Happy hour" and the breakfast buffet.

paragraphs.context: Mar 17 2009 Nice place KILLER Breakfast ! My wife and I stayed here for six days in early March of 2009. Very nice hotel and the staff was exceptional. No complaints. Our room was on the 6th floor (HHonours guests are allocated top floor rooms). Three elevators let you get there easily. The rooms aren't huge but good enough for the low price. Great value because of the evening "Happy hour" and the breakfast buffet. Their "Made to order" breakfasts are to die for ! Try the meat lovers omelet with some extra bacon and sausage, hash browns, french toast, milk, juice, toast and fruit. A real heart attack special. You can gain weight at this hotel just like on a cruise ship. Just kidding .... but their Omelets are really tasty. The rooms are quiet but sometimes the incoming planes look like the could land on the roof. Thanks for your time.

answers.text: I checked all the websites for the best price then called the hotel directly and they were cheaper and included free american breakfast!The hotel is great, large room, beautiful lobby, convenient location.

paragraphs.context: Apr 29 2008 Great Hotel poor Breakfast and Drinks service I checked all the websites for the best price then called the hotel directly and they were cheaper and included free american breakfast!The hotel is great, large room, beautiful lobby, convenient location. Negatives were, small bathroom, poor breakfast with small portions and lack lustre service. We were also disappointed when we ordered two Manhattan cocktails from the bar and they were so strong we could not drink them, so ordered a different cocktail and was still charged for the cocktails that we did not drink. Poor show.

answers.text: Neutrals: the breakfast was adequate (

paragraphs.context: Oct 1 2009 Yes but... I'd recommend this hotel. Pluses: the location was excellent, the staff friendly, the rooms large, the cost reasonable for a big-city hotel. Neutrals: the breakfast was adequate ( but certainly a value compared to buying at a restaurant).Negatives : the rooms were dark. (I do not so much object to the color of the decor, which was maroon-ish, as to the use of fluorescent bulbs in every fixture. Hey, I'm as green as the next guy, but face it, fluorescents cast a cold, dim, gloomy light.) And the common areas were small and dreary. (The entry off the street almost looks like the freight entrance. And the combined front desk/breakfast room/business center was painfully small. For the first couple of days we were there, the presence of two tour groups plus the rest of the guests made breakfast seem like New Year's Eve on Times Square.)All of that said, I do recommend the hotel. But third-best in Chicago? I really do not think so.

answers.text: The included breakfast is a knockout.

paragraphs.context: Jun 9 2008 What's not to like? I visited Chicago for the first time as a hotel traveler and found the Embassy Suites to be a great deal. The entire staff was very courteous (except for the happy hour bartender) and the value was outstanding. The included breakfast is a knockout. I have never seen made to order omelettes and good quality ingredients like this at a complimentary breakfast. I disagree with the reviewer that said the place was noisy - I hear nary a peep from the approxmately 100 children staying at the hotel (they did run amok at breakfast) and the facilities were very clean, recently remodeled with plasma screens adn the like. One peeve was the chlorine odor in the atrium - the pool should have had it is own ventilation. Awesome location (blue line to clark/lake) and a $5 cab ride - 60 minutes and $7 total! The best airport transfer deal in a big city. Parking is a rip if you drove, but the lot across the street is $19 a night if you do not mind parking outside.

answers.text: A disappointing continential breakfast was served on the first floor in a small area with only 7 or 8 tables, and a funny kind of sofa arrangement.

paragraphs.context: Oct 3 2007 Very basic and not what I expected This hotel is well situted for downtown Chicago, but is really very basic, and not what I expected. The rooms (allocated to me and my group) were very small, dark, with little daylight, backing on to a multistory car park. There were no hotel facilities at all! Only vending machines. No bar, cafeteria, restaurante, business center, nothing. A disappointing continential breakfast was served on the first floor in a small area with only 7 or 8 tables, and a funny kind of sofa arrangement. There was not enough space for all the guests wanting to take breakfast to sit down, and many had to stand up. The plates, glasses and cutlery were all plastic. The second day we all went out for breakfast. I guess this place would be okay for low budget travellers with low expectations, but it is by no means a mid-class establishment.

answers.text: The only niggle was the breakfast - best for breakfast rate was not explained properly and our waiter really hassled us for a tip after we had only been sat down for about 10 minutes .

paragraphs.context: Jun 23 2006 Tip Top Accomodation Stayed here mid June and couldn't have been happier- room great - service great - location great The only niggle was the breakfast - best for breakfast rate was not explained properly and our waiter really hassled us for a tip after we had only been sat down for about 10 minutes . Kids also do not really eat for free apparently - they are only allowed 1 item for breakfast - anything else will be charged for!!!! This was resolved but is worth mentioning

answers.text: The buffet breakfast was included in my rate, and was a nice way to start the day, a nice mix of western and Indian breakfast foods and french pressed coffee.

paragraphs.context: Jan 24 2006 Loved the Hyatt I stayed here while on business for two weeks and I loved it. The gym and spa were great, and the staff was extremely helpful. The buffet breakfast was included in my rate, and was a nice way to start the day, a nice mix of western and Indian breakfast foods and french pressed coffee. By day three, the waiters new I liked ketchup and tabasco and would have both waiting for me upon my arrival for breakfast. The rooms were a bit small, but were clean and nicely appointed. I had no trouble at with any of the temperature controls, the AC made the room cold, the heat made the room warm.

answers.text: But after we had the breakfast, they said it is not.

paragraphs.context: Mar 16 2006 Bad bad bad!!! I stayed in this hotel with family for one night. It was terrible. The rooms were very dirty with torn carpet. The carpet looked like it has never been cleaned from several years. It is definately NOT a star hotel. It was much worse than some hostels where I have stayed. In spite of all this, the charges for food were like 4-5* hotels. They charged 45Rs for a cup of tea and more than 200Rs/person for useless breakfast. The staff was rude. At first they told that the breakfast was complimentary. But after we had the breakfast, they said it is not. After lot of arguing, I had to pay for that. All of the staff was desperate to get tips -- no matter how poorly they have maintained the hotel and how poor their service is. AVOID AVOID AVOID this hotel.

answers.text: For the price, breakfast probably should be provided but difficult to find a hotel in NYC that does.

paragraphs.context: Dec 8 2007 Goood hotel great location Stayed here for 5 nights in Dec. Was in Room 10A, no view but did not mind since you do not spend time in the room and it was quiet for sleeping. Great location in between Crysler and Empire State and close to Grand Central. Bathroom and kitchenette could do with upgrading but room was big, with high ceilings and a huge bed and temperature was warm. For the price, breakfast probably should be provided but difficult to find a hotel in NYC that does. Highly recommend Scottys diner across the street - cheap and cheerful. Got breakfast there for 4 times less than what we paid for the same breakfast near madison square gardens. Would recommend the hotel. For visiting NYC on a budget, recommend the NY public library & the free staten island ferry. Beware that most restaurants put the tip now on the bill so no need to pay extra.

answers.text: I like that they served cooked oatmeal rather than packets of instant-oats which so many other hotels have with their free breakfast.

paragraphs.context: Apr 12 2009 Great Staff Great Breakfast Great Value! The woman taking our made-to-order breakfast orders had an amazing memory.... and my eggs were perfect every time. I like that they served cooked oatmeal rather than packets of instant-oats which so many other hotels have with their free breakfast. The fruit was fresh and sweet. We were there on business and never tried the pool or fitness center. It seems like a place where you could stay easily with kids. Our beds were comfy. I like the furniture. They provided shampoo, conditioner, and soap in our room. We asked the friendly competent front desk staff and were immediately given shower cap, body lotion, etc. I guess they arent putting one of everything in the rooms now to prevent waste? My partner comment on how well trained staff was...several times.

answers.text: Breakfast was supposed to be free but once we got there, they charged us $36 for each breakfast since we did not book it directly from the hotel's website!.

paragraphs.context: Oct 13 2009 Great location nice hotel but poor value I booked it through expedia and got the 3rd night free. Breakfast was supposed to be free but once we got there, they charged us $36 for each breakfast since we did not book it directly from the hotel's website!. They did not tell us that upon checking in. If you did not bring your own toothbrush & toothpaste, you'd have to buy them from the minibar; same goes for shaving kit. The location is great as Rue Crescent is around the corner (many bars,restaurants,cafes), the metro and the underground mall are also a couple of blocks away. In the end, we ended up paying the equivalent for the 3rd night through breakfast and parking ($16/night).

answers.text: Overall very comfortable and well maintained hotel - just do not make the mistake of getting the buffet breakfast at the hotel restaurant - crazy price for an average-to-below average spread.

paragraphs.context: Nov 21 2009 Good hotel and location This is becoming a fast favorite for my trips to London - rooms are nice and spacious (esp. if you can get on the 8th floor) - and breakfast/tea/snacks in the Executive Lounge is nice bonus (have Marriott status). Overall very comfortable and well maintained hotel - just do not make the mistake of getting the buffet breakfast at the hotel restaurant - crazy price for an average-to-below average spread. I've had better breakfast buffets for free at other Marriott properties in London.

answers.text: .breakfast is ok.in the afternoon small free breakfast in the second floor.

paragraphs.context: Jan 2 2009 almost 10 Very good hotel in good position. we stay in deluxe roomRoom are spacius and clean. Good also the bathroom. Staff is very friendly .breakfast is ok.in the afternoon small free breakfast in the second floor. Points no good : lift always busy!and some people from the breakfast are not so friendly as the other staff from the hotel

answers.text: - breakfast is poor, and the breakfast room is too little; I suggest you not to pay for the breakfast, and go to one of the many breakfast places outside-

paragraphs.context: Jul 6 2008 Nice hotel minor defects That's, all in all, a nice hotel, located in good a midtown location (a few blocks from Times Square).Rooms are spacious, clean and well furnished (the ipod dock station is really nice!)Some minor annoyances: - breakfast is poor, and the breakfast room is too little; I suggest you not to pay for the breakfast, and go to one of the many breakfast places outside- the elevators are slow (which is a problem, especially around breakfast time, if your room is at the 18th floor)- acoustic isolation is inadequate All in all, I'd suggest this hotel.

answers.text: They do a very simple buffet breakfast - nothing special but was included in the price.

paragraphs.context: Jan 29 2009 A real gem Wonderful hotel in a great part of Chicago - very quiet street and a short walk from some great bars and restaurants and it is only a 5/10 minute drive to downdown Chicago. The restuarants are also much better value in this neighbourhood than downtown. The staff were wonderul and always willing to help. The rooms of very high standard and extremely comfortable. They do a very simple buffet breakfast - nothing special but was included in the price. You can take your breakfast up to your room - which is quite helpful as the space and seating in reception is not really geared up for eating breakfast. They also have tea and coffee on tap 24/7. This is a great hotel and really is home from home. I will certainly stay here again.

answers.text: The breakfast buffet was beyond our belief.

paragraphs.context: Dec 26 2004 Great for those with children and savings on breakfast What an excellent choice we made. We stayed at both of these great hotels. The one closer to the airport was a lot nicer and newer. Our room was very good and the breakfast saved us from having to take our three grandchildren out every morning. The breakfast buffet was beyond our belief. What a great assortment and if they did not have it made, they graciously cooked whatever we wanted to our specifications. Didn't have to take the little ones through all the crowded mobs in the bigger gambling casinos. The one closer to the airport is within a block of the Hard Rock and another casino so we could just walk there. Would take us to the strip and pick us up. Didn't even need a car. Beds very comfortable and room for more people on the queen couch-comfortable also. Great vacation. Thanks to the Embassy Suites staff.

extractions: view of the Golden Gate Bridge

answers.text: The breakfast buffet was pleasant enough, but it was a bit of a scramble amongst all the other guests (who'd arrived at the same time!!)Comfort Inn

paragraphs.context: Aug 23 2008 Average Comfort I stayed here with my husband and teenage daughter at the end of July for 3 nights as the first stop on our around the world tour. The hotel is convenient for viewing Fishermans' Wharf, the crooked road and to get to trams. The room we were given had a wonderful view of the Golden Gate Bridge and we had no complaints regarding the size or cleanliness. The biggest problem was breakfast time! This only ran until 9.30 and so everyone headed down at 9am arrving at the same time. The breakfast room was just not large enough to hold everyone so there was an "overflow" into the reception area. One morning we ended up eating out there on sofas, hoping that a table would turn up eventually. The breakfast buffet was pleasant enough, but it was a bit of a scramble amongst all the other guests (who'd arrived at the same time!!)Comfort Inn - you need to sort this out with an extension!Anyway, a nice hotel for the price, but head down early for breakfast!!

qas.question: Does your breakfast include vegan options?

answers.text: The continental breakfast which was included in the room rate was poor.

paragraphs.context: May 16 2006 A nice respite from the hustle and bustle of Vegas. Stayed here for 2 nights (Fri & Sat) in May 2006. Main reason was to escape the high room rates of the strip hotels. It was a pleasant stay, the bedroom was clean and tidy as was the bathroom. The public areas needed attention, for instance the carpet in the lift hadn't seen a vacuum cleaner for days and the carpet around the lobby area needed a vacuum. The continental breakfast which was included in the room rate was poor. The milk tasted sour and you could have broken a tooth on the raisin bran cereal it was so hard, obviously not Kelloggs!! The fresh fruit was not very nice either. Coffee tasted like dishwater and the toaster took 15 minutes to toast a slice of bread!! Putting the breakfast experience aside, we enjoyed our stay and would probably stay again some time in the future, but would skip the breakfast in favour of the IHOP down the road!!

answers.text: As HHonors members we received a free daily breakfast.

paragraphs.context: Jul 26 2008 Good location; Good Service; Good Value Hotel My wife and I spent the 4th of July weekend at the Hilton Garden Inn Times Square. As others have written, the hotel is conveniently located. Its within walking distance to the subway and theaters. Our cab ride from La Guardia to the hotel was about $35. The staff served us excellently . The hotel was rennovating the hall way on the floor we stayed on -- wall coverings were taken off, etc. So, you may want to ask if they are rennovating the floor when it comes time to get your room. As HHonors members we received a free daily breakfast. The breakfast was in the hotel's Pigalle restaurant and the breakfast menu was limited. Amongst the choices were eggs, omlets, a waffle dish and granola dish. Free wireless worked well. We also used the free printers downstairs to print out tickets. We had a pleasant stay at this hotel.

extractions: view of the city and the

answers.text: This breakfast is not worth the money.

paragraphs.context: Jul 31 2007 A Nice Hotel The parking garage was clean, safe, and very easily accesible from the hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was large, clean, and comfortable with a nice view of the city and the Mont Royal. The hotel is very close to two metro stations so getting around is easy. It's also close to the highway so we did not have to drive in downtown Montreal for very long. Skip the breakfast-we've had much better free continental breakfasts at the Hampton and Marriott. This breakfast is not worth the money.

answers.text: Breakfast was pricey ...

paragraphs.context: Apr 25 2009 Good value; great location Husband and I stayed here for a one-day stop in Beijing en route to a conference. Location was convenient to the night market, Forbidden City, Tianamen Square - all an easy walk. (Ignore the constant pestering for people to give you a lift there ... it is a quick and easy walk.) Price (about $140 on Travelocity) seemed fair given the location - could have found cheaper but would have been less convenient to the sights. Breakfast was pricey ... we did not purchase a room package that included breakfast - maybe that would have been cheaper. Just walking in and paying was $50 for two of us - OUCH. It was a standard buffet with lots of options, but no buffet breakfast is worth $25 a pop! Room itself was fine ... not huge, but I think that's the norm. Room was clean and had everything we needed.

answers.text: They have a wonderful restaurant call Abbacato (Italian) which becomes the breakfast place in the morning.

paragraphs.context: Mar 30 2008 Great Find in New York What a nice little gem on 55th street in the heart of New York. The staff bends over backwards to see that every wish is taken care of. The rooms are on the small side unless you stay in the jr./mini suite which has a living room. Bathroom is quite small but serviceable however. They have a wonderful restaurant call Abbacato (Italian) which becomes the breakfast place in the morning. Continental breakfast is included and for a small additional cost you can have eggs, breakfast meats, etc. They have an excellent car service to and from the airport at not much more than the price of a cab but certainly more reliable and cleaner. Hotel is within 2 or 3 blocks of the subway. Also, there are plenty of good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. Enjoy!!

answers.text: The breakfast was not up to much, but continental breakfast's never really are (in my opinion) but it was well advertised beforehand that this was the only breakfast choice available

paragraphs.context: May 14 2008 Good location The room was small but very clean, as was the en-suite. The shower was fantastic. There was a nice little balcony that we could sit out and look onto the street in the evenings (there was a heatwave when we were there). However, our little table on the balcony disappeared on our first night here so we did not get to sit outside. This was not really a problem though as there was so much else to do, and the location of the hotel was great- right beside the underground and easy to get around anywhere we wanted. The breakfast was not up to much, but continental breakfast's never really are (in my opinion) but it was well advertised beforehand that this was the only breakfast choice available and so we did not mind. All in all, it was a decent enough hotel in a good location and for a reasonable price.

answers.text: I think the room rate of US$200 which includes breakfast, is reasonable during 4th July weekend since it went up to US$280 the week after.

paragraphs.context: Jul 30 2008 comfortable and great location Stayed there for 4 nights. I think the room rate of US$200 which includes breakfast, is reasonable during 4th July weekend since it went up to US$280 the week after. Not every hotel provides breakfast. Heard that breakfast is only provided during summer and even dinner buffet from mon to thurs even though we did not try it. Comfortable bed and clean room with a sofa bed that could accommodate up to a family of 4. Housekeeping is done everyday. There is a fridge and microwave oven but we never used it since we are out everyday. Great location as well, near the subway, times sq, empire state, rockefella centre, restaurants and shopping area 5th ave.

answers.text: Our room was to include breakfast for 2, but they never charged my daughter for breakfast and said her's was included too.

paragraphs.context: Aug 21 2009 Great Help from Front Desk and Concierge I agree that the outside is not anything to write home about, but the room was fine. The breakfast was great (the scrambled eggs were the best I've ever had). Our room was to include breakfast for 2, but they never charged my daughter for breakfast and said her's was included too. I want to commend the staff at this hotel. Our luggage was lost and the concierge went out of his way to call the airlines to help us locate the luggage. Also, my wallet was stolen out of my purse. Don't know how this happened because I'm always so careful - so please be very diligent in paying attention to your purse. The front desk called the police department for me and also followed up with a phone call to see how everything went. Also, when I checked out, the girl asked me if I had gotten my wallet back. Of course I hadn't. If I ever went back to London, I would definately stay here again.

answers.text: Breakfast is quite literally a bun fight.

paragraphs.context: Oct 4 2009 Get to Breakfast Early New York hotels within the range of the 'average' traveller are expensive with small rooms. Bottom line. The Holiday Inn Express was reasonably priced with decent sized rooms and incl. breakfast. Breakfast is quite literally a bun fight. GET THERE EARLY or you will be waiting aimlessly for a table and the food will be well and truely picked over. That being said, it is great value for NYC and a nice quality hotel.

answers.text: - I was pleased to get breakfast at all for the price - in France, Italy etc

paragraphs.context: Jan 21 2009 Great value for money Was pleasantly surprised after reading some reviews. Couldn't have been more convenient for everything including all public transport. Fantastic value for money given its location. Probably more like a good hostel than a hotel - no problems with staff, lift, cleanliness, noise etc. Room was basic with no frills (but it did have tv and phone)Breakfast was toast, jam, bagels, cream cheese, enormous muffins, OJ, coffee and tea and you could have as much as you like - I thought it was fair enough that you couldn't load up with food to take to your room - its only meant to be your breakfast not food for all day - I was pleased to get breakfast at all for the price - in France, Italy etc you're lucky to just get one croissant and a cup of coffee.

answers.text: The rooms are very small for the money and even though breakfast is included in the stay, the breakfast area gets very crowded during morning.

paragraphs.context: Jul 28 2009 very small room and very crowded breakfast bar in the morning. The rooms are very small for the money and even though breakfast is included in the stay, the breakfast area gets very crowded during morning. This is in the main lobby so you also keep bumping into travellers checking out. Overall not very impressed.

answers.text: The big surprise was the free breakfast in the morning.

paragraphs.context: May 29 2006 We Love Homewood Suites We stayed at the Homewood Suites on May 26 and May 27,2006 and absolutely loved it. The location was close to everything we wanted to do,the bed was fantastic,the staff extremely accomadating and the price comparable to other hotels nearby. We paid $199/Night. It was very convenient having the kitchenette at our disposal. We went to a nearby store(White Hen) and bought snacks, Milk, Pop,etc and had our refridgerator and microwave at our fingertips. The big surprise was the free breakfast in the morning. They told us there was a buffet breakfast,but we thought cereal and donuts. We were pleasantly surprised to find a full breakfast with eggs,potatoes, ham ,biscuits and gravy, juice,cereal ,everything we could possibly want.... Our suite was pleasant and impeccably clean. We will definately stay there again .

answers.text: juice and muffin

paragraphs.context: Aug 27 2006 dont book third party I booked this hotel through Hotels[-]. The promo rate was 133 a night and that was to include breakfast. The next morning I went down for breakfast but was told my rate was a bargin rate and did not include breakfast. I had to deal with Hotels[-] for a while before getting it resolved and we never did get the breakfast (hotels[-] issued me a credit for the breakfast amt, which by the way was 22 dollars a person for a continental breakfast!!!! ie. juice and muffin .... so I guess I am glad they lost the info) However I had to ask several times to get a cup of coffee. Evidently the hotel only puts out complimentary coffee until 7:30 am! Who gets up that early on vacation? After 7:30 one has to go to the restaraunt and pay through the nose for a cup, I thought this was a four star hotel? One the other side of things the location is great, the service is excellent. The hotel as well is very clean.

answers.text: The included breakfast and the free wi fi makes the room rate quite reasonable when comparing to other hotels which charge for those items.

paragraphs.context: Jul 26 2007 Excellent NYC hotel! We stayed 22-24 July and had a king room at the back of the hotel which was extremely quiet. The included breakfast and the free wi fi makes the room rate quite reasonable when comparing to other hotels which charge for those items. A much appreciated exceptional treatment was the opening of the Club room at 4:30 am for this insomniac still on European time to work on the computer without distrubing his wife! The breakfast is the best continental breakfast I have seen and the beds were extremely comfortable. A great location tops it off and we will be return visitors for sure. Gary

answers.text: I should mention that breakfast was included in the room rate, so I didnt expect anything fancy.

paragraphs.context: Nov 14 2009 Excellent room terrible breakfast service My husband and I stayed in a very nice suite. Overall impression of the hotel and the room is very good, but I was so disappointed with the breakfast service! I should mention that breakfast was included in the room rate, so I didnt expect anything fancy. Still, we had only coffee/tea and some pastry. All cups, plates, cutlery were plastic! Terrible, terrible move from the management! I wish the breakfast would have not been included in the rate, so I would have left the hotel with an excellent impression.

answers.text: The rate included breakfast, which was very nice for an inclusive breakfast, several hot items, many pastries, cereals and fruits.

paragraphs.context: Jul 13 2008 Great hotel plenty of space nice breakfast We stayed over the July 4th weekend. The room was spacious for a downtown property, including a kitchen with stove, full size fridge, sink and dishwasher! The rate included breakfast, which was very nice for an inclusive breakfast, several hot items, many pastries, cereals and fruits. The pool was located on the top floor, and although a bit small, kept the children happy. However, there was very limited seats - about 8 total! We were a healthy 15 minute walk to shopping, but the doormen were very attentive and we were able to get a taxi quickly. We did not use the valet parking, which at $38/night is a bit steep. We had a relative who let us use her parking pass down the street.

answers.text: And they provide breakfast the next morning.

paragraphs.context: Feb 12 2009 Great Hotel!! We stayed at this hotel because we had an early morning flight and were coming from Ottawa. The most important thing was that we needed a 24 hour shuttle because we had to be at the airport at 3:45 and this hotel has that. Great shuttle service!The hotel itself is really nice. Very new. The rooms are great - very comfy beds, nice big bathrooms with great amenities, nice tvs. We had dinner and drinks in the bar/lounge in the lobby and the food was delicious! And they provide breakfast the next morning. We were not going to be there when they served breakfast so they provided a boxed breakfast for us to pick up on our way out of the hotel!They also provide a "park and stay". So we left our vehicle there for the duration of our trip. I would definitely stay here again if I needed an overnight stay at the Montreal Airport!

answers.text: The free breakfast in the morning is awesome: Hot things like eggs, sausages, waffles, French toast, cereal, fruit, bagels, juice, coffee, you name it.

paragraphs.context: Aug 16 2008 great spot This is a great place to base your NY visit. The rooms are very clean and spacious. We had a king and a pull-out couch for the three of us. Got in in the morning, stored our bags and off we went. It's only a block away from Bryant park, a few blocks to Times Square, the theatre district, Empire State building, Grand Central, you name it. I found it very quiet, 18th floor. We did not really notice the traffic noise and did not hear much "hotel" noise. We did, however, have the air conditioning fan on all the time for buffer. The free breakfast in the morning is awesome: Hot things like eggs, sausages, waffles, French toast, cereal, fruit, bagels, juice, coffee, you name it. Lots of space to sit and eat your breakfast. On the weekend they provided plastic cutlery and plates, so that you could take your breakfast up to your room. I would highly recommend this to everyone. My daughter is 16, but we saw a lot of people there with little kids.

answers.text: The next morning we went looking for the "breakfast included" and found a sorry-looking plate on the front desk with a couple of Nutrigrain bars and plastic-wrapped Danish, an instant coffee flask and some hot water.

paragraphs.context: Mar 25 2004 Breakfast was a joke The room we were given was at the front of the hotel and we did not sleep all night long because of the traffic noise. The next morning we went looking for the "breakfast included" and found a sorry-looking plate on the front desk with a couple of Nutrigrain bars and plastic-wrapped Danish, an instant coffee flask and some hot water. Not my idea of breakfastespecially as we had stayed the night before at a Residence Inn in S. San Francisco where there was a full range of food choices. I was not impressed, would not stay there again and feel there are better choices than this hotel for a similar price.

answers.text: Breakfast is $6, for New York that's not too bad.

paragraphs.context: Oct 7 2009 Nice Hotel Near Central Park We have stayed at this hotel twice and find its location great - close to Central Park ,Carnegie Hall and a subway station. This trip, our first room had double beds so I asked to be moved to a king and was accommodated the next day. They have a good Continental breakfast but cafes and restaurants are close by. Breakfast is $6, for New York that's not too bad. We ate across the street at Norma's in the Le Parker Meridien for 4 times that one morning. Some of the Salisbury staff are helpful and some are not. Bellman are efficient, housekeeping is a bit slow. The breakfast room attendants are courteous and efficient. You will hear at least three languages spoken by hotel guest at breakfast for this hotel is frequented by English, German, and French tourists. There is construction going on in the same block so there are some noise issues. However, this is a good, clean, safe spot to stay in New York.

answers.text: We booked a Bed and Breakfast rate, but were asked to sign for the breakfast every morning.

paragraphs.context: Jun 17 2009 Sheraton - watch what you sign for! I stayed at the Sheraton back in February with my wife for a long weekend. Great location, just a walk away from the tourist things you have to do when you are there. We booked a Bed and Breakfast rate, but were asked to sign for the breakfast every morning. Later on in March, when my Visa bill arrived, they had charged me $205 for Breakfast !! and it was not on the bill i signed on departure. I fired off an few e-mails, and eventually got a refund, but just beware !! - Otherwise we thought the hotel looked a bit tired, and the rooms were a little small. But if it is just a base you are after, then it is ideal.

answers.text: We had a parking package, which included a 1 bedroom suite, parking, breakfast, and

paragraphs.context: May 16 2006 European Flair My husband and I stayed at the Majestic May 8-10. We had a parking package, which included a 1 bedroom suite, parking, breakfast, and I thought evening drinks(which the website stated). We loved the suite-it was huge, but did have that old musty smell that other postings spoke about. The breakfast was o.k., and so was the service. I also wish they would have told me that the parking package didnt include all that it said on the website, e.g.-that evening drinks and snacks are not included, since the bar and restaurant are being renovated. Although they did manage to provide breakfast. But, all in all we loved the charm and ambience of this old world hotel.

answers.text: There is no free breakfast here, but a breakfast area on the 12th floor is available for $$$.

paragraphs.context: Jun 10 2009 Nice place - good location - expensive breakfast First of all, the rooms are very nice. We had rooms with 2 queen beds plus a sofa sleeper, so you could easily put 6 in these rooms. There is free wi-fi though our iPods and iPhones failed to connect except in the lobby. For my laptop it worked fine. There is no free breakfast here, but a breakfast area on the 12th floor is available for $$$. The subway stop for E, V, and 6 is just outside the door, and if you walk a few blocks there are even more lines available at 59th street. The staff was very helpful and there was plenty to see within walking distance (Rockefeller Center, St. Pats Cathedral, shopping, Times Square is a longer walk but doable).

answers.text: The room was great, and our full buffet breakfast was included in our rate and the breakfast was WONDERFUL!!!!!!Freddy the waiter was great as was the entire staff for our Breakfast.

paragraphs.context: Apr 19 2008 Loved The Barclay After checking Trip Advisor before leaving for the NYC... I was a little concerned about the Barclay.....but when we arrived we had a wonderful experience with Andrea at the Front Desk!!!!! The room was great, and our full buffet breakfast was included in our rate and the breakfast was WONDERFUL!!!!!!Freddy the waiter was great as was the entire staff for our Breakfast. I have stayed in NYC many, many times and also in Brooklyn and I loved the Barclay and I would return. Thanks Barclay for making our visit a pleasant one!!!!

answers.text: As cost included breakfast, I was stuck with paying for my breakfast elsewhere and not claiming it back.

paragraphs.context: Sep 20 2006 Shocking This hotel was awful during my business stay. Salient points: No iron in room or upon request. I had to stand in the basement floor hallway and use the public iron on a disintegrating ironing board. Unacceptable, and hard to find as well. Breakfast was toast, bread or cornflakes. As cost included breakfast, I was stuck with paying for my breakfast elsewhere and not claiming it back. No A/C and the room was HOT. Additionally, there were women screaming across the courtyard and wolf whistling at guests who had opened the windows and curtains in an attempt to cool their rooms. This went on until midnight. The shower was like a hot coffin and the air extractor sounded like a helicopter. There were not many directions plates, and the hallways were like a maze. There was one lift for the whole hotel, so I tried the stairs, and got lost more than once. A credit card scan was taken, but I was asked to pay on the evening before I checked out. Why?Decor was very dated.

answers.text: I travel to New York frequently and found an amazing price for this hotel on-line with free internet access and continental breakfast!

paragraphs.context: Jun 7 2009 Good Location Great Value I travel to New York frequently and found an amazing price for this hotel on-line with free internet access and continental breakfast! The location is excellent - in the middle of Chinatown, blocks away from Little Italy, and very close proximity to the subway. The staff was helpful and efficient. Beds were very comfortable and rooms were well done with flat screen tv's, in room safe, and other amenities. My only recommendation is NOT to stay on the second floor, just steps away from the registration desk , offices, and the breakfast area. It can be very loud, especially in the mornings as people begin having breakfast and checking out.

answers.text: My only issue was with breakfast because there was not a continental breakfast menu available anywhere.

paragraphs.context: Sep 28 2009 Perfect location We chose to stay at King George mainly because of its location. My husband was attending a conference at the Moscone Center which was at a walking distance. One thing you have to bear in mind though is that when you're staying in central location it is bound to be noisy! The hotel staff were friendly, courteous and very helpful. There very good diners around the hotel so you won't go to bed hungry. My only issue was with breakfast because there was not a continental breakfast menu available anywhere. It's all about 3-4 or more egg omlette, pancakes, steak etc. Howevery San Francisco is wonderfully diverse city. There is always something new around the corner so even if you do not get breakfast a satisfiying lucn & dinner is guaranteed. Muir Woods & Sausalito are both unmissable.

answers.text: They charged 45Rs for a cup of tea and more than 200Rs/person for useless breakfast.

paragraphs.context: Mar 16 2006 Bad bad bad!!! I stayed in this hotel with family for one night. It was terrible. The rooms were very dirty with torn carpet. The carpet looked like it has never been cleaned from several years. It is definately NOT a star hotel. It was much worse than some hostels where I have stayed. In spite of all this, the charges for food were like 4-5* hotels. They charged 45Rs for a cup of tea and more than 200Rs/person for useless breakfast. The staff was rude. At first they told that the breakfast was complimentary. But after we had the breakfast, they said it is not. After lot of arguing, I had to pay for that. All of the staff was desperate to get tips -- no matter how poorly they have maintained the hotel and how poor their service is. AVOID AVOID AVOID this hotel.

answers.text: Upon Checking in I was told that they no longer served a breakfast.

paragraphs.context: May 23 2008 No more breakfast Just returned home from San Francisco and stayed at the Cartwright hotel for 7 nights. As was mentioned in other reviews the rooms were small but clean the staff was very helpful and it is in a great location. Close to cable cars, Chinatown and Union Square. I chose this hotel because of the reviews that menioned how good the breakfast buffet was. Upon Checking in I was told that they no longer served a breakfast. Had I known this I would have chosen a different hotel. Their renovation was not complete and we had to walk around the workmen and their ladders, the smell of paint was strong in the lobby and dust was heavy at times.

extractions: walking distance to all main areas

answers.text: breakfast & valet parking is included in my package.

paragraphs.context: Oct 16 2009 Wonderful Experience stay there for the long weekend from 09/05-09/07. unbeatable location. walking distance to all main areas and subway station. quiet area. nice front desk staffs, very professional. nice contemporary design. use real green apple as decoration at the elevator area (i saw someone actually ate the apple while waiting for the elevator). breakfast & valet parking is included in my package. end up we did not need to drive at all, everything is walking distance. breakfast is on the 2nd floor restaurant, not too many selection, but food is fancy and taste good. we got to try out a rare kind of French cheese (unbelievably good!!) * ** there is a line up for the breakfast buffet though :( short on staff to clean up the table * * * otherwise, everything exceeds my expectation. I normally stays at the W or the QE Fairmont; just want to try something new this time and I made a wise choice. will visit again!!!

answers.text: even breakfast is included - a small but good and healthy breakfast buffet.

paragraphs.context: Beautiful boutique hotel at great location with friendly staff - and a fabulous roof-top lounge Very nice design-hotel. rooms are quite small but location is great for restaurants, bars, museums, galleries, shopping.. even breakfast is included - a small but good and healthy breakfast buffet. very friendly and helpful staff. the only thing I did not like: the dirty breakfast tables. I recommend this hotel!

answers.text: so after approximately 5 minutes we were provided with the breakfast coupons.

paragraphs.context: Mar 18 2009 Good Location - Would stay again. Arrived quite early in the morning, about 9:00 and the staff were very accomodating in checking us in, we had been expecting to have to wait until check-in time. We had booked via travelzoo and the rate included breakfast but this component of the reservation did not seem to get into the hotel system. I had the original documentatioon from travelzoo so after approximately 5 minutes we were provided with the breakfast coupons. The location is very good, we are frequent travelers to Montreal and the hotel is close to everything downtown and the metro. Rooms were fine, a bit dated but clean and the housekeeping staff assigned to our room usually had our room cleaned by early afternoon. The buffet breakfast was good with a selection of hot and cold items but was a bit expensive $20 if it was not included with your room rate.

answers.text: I really do not think so.

paragraphs.context: Oct 1 2009 Yes but... I'd recommend this hotel. Pluses: the location was excellent, the staff friendly, the rooms large, the cost reasonable for a big-city hotel. Neutrals: the breakfast was adequate ( but certainly a value compared to buying at a restaurant).Negatives : the rooms were dark. (I do not so much object to the color of the decor, which was maroon-ish, as to the use of fluorescent bulbs in every fixture. Hey, I'm as green as the next guy, but face it, fluorescents cast a cold, dim, gloomy light.) And the common areas were small and dreary. (The entry off the street almost looks like the freight entrance. And the combined front desk/breakfast room/business center was painfully small. For the first couple of days we were there, the presence of two tour groups plus the rest of the guests made breakfast seem like New Year's Eve on Times Square.)All of that said, I do recommend the hotel. But third-best in Chicago? I really do not think so.

answers.text: Jan 9 2007 A very good deal but expect to 'pay' for it At about $120/night for 5 people (breakfast included), this was undeniably an excellent deal.

paragraphs.context: Jan 9 2007 A very good deal but expect to 'pay' for it At about $120/night for 5 people (breakfast included), this was undeniably an excellent deal. The location is prime, and the room was well-designed and comfortably held our entire family. The free cocktail each evening was nice & the nibbles were decent (an unfortunate sea of styrofoam cups, however). However, the much vaunted "cooked to order breakfast" was a chaotic, unpleasant ordeal each morning. We felt like cattle waiting to be served at the trough. There was insufficient seating, and the entire environment reeked of make-shift disposable (ugly folding tables/chairs, ugly plastic trays, and again a miserable waste of styrofoam cups).Dread of the breakfast pandemonium would cause hesitation in whether to stay at this hotel again. It is a shame, as so much of the hotel has good things to offer.

answers.text: You can take your breakfast up to your room - which is quite helpful as the space and seating in reception is not really geared up for eating breakfast.

paragraphs.context: Jan 29 2009 A real gem Wonderful hotel in a great part of Chicago - very quiet street and a short walk from some great bars and restaurants and it is only a 5/10 minute drive to downdown Chicago. The restuarants are also much better value in this neighbourhood than downtown. The staff were wonderul and always willing to help. The rooms of very high standard and extremely comfortable. They do a very simple buffet breakfast - nothing special but was included in the price. You can take your breakfast up to your room - which is quite helpful as the space and seating in reception is not really geared up for eating breakfast. They also have tea and coffee on tap 24/7. This is a great hotel and really is home from home. I will certainly stay here again.

qas.question: Does your breakfast include vegan options?

answers.text: My wife only wanted fruit

paragraphs.context: Oct 22 2008 Past it is Sell by Date This property has Grand Pretentiousness but it is past it is sell by date. The entrance is grand but drab,The check in old fashioned and un friendly. The Elevators try to trap you between the doors and do not give enough tme to safely get out.
