How the team here made a small room into a masterpiece of open space architecture is incredible. The illusion of a large room is great. If you are a Hotel Architect, go here and check out the magic. Very impressed with the small things too like International Power Plugs as standard!The renovations down stairs were still on and that also affected the Gym setting. The pool meshed over is an interesting concept but it does not keep out the smog!.The breakfast setting was stunning and the ground floor restaurant is brilliant. There is tons of choice for food at breakfast here. Loved it...except for the room rate!ProsBest room setting for standard hotelBreakfast!Service was exceptional in all aspectsConsRoom price

answers.text: The buffet offers fresh fruit, a mixture of Western and local breakfast dishes, and a helpful wait staff.

paragraphs.context: May 5 2009 Fantastic value great breakfast and helpful staff The front desk is so helpful. They arranged a car to the Great Wall, provided recommendations for restaurants, and did the little things to make our stay extra special. I like a good breakfast before a long day of walking and exploring. The buffet offers fresh fruit, a mixture of Western and local breakfast dishes, and a helpful wait staff. The omelet station is excellent. The location of the hotel is great. It is close to a subway stop, Tian'an Men Square, Forbidden City, and lots of shopping and restaurants.

answers.text: Breakfast was included but this was just a couple of buns/cakes that you had to eat on your way out as there is nowhere to sit and eat the food!

paragraphs.context: Apr 17 2005 Good but disappointing Having read the reviews I was expecting something amazing. The owners were very friendly and the place was very clean but the room was TINY and cramped with hardly any storage space. I think you can get a bigger room if you make enough fuss but when we were there the motel was full up so there was no chance to change room. The location of the motel is excellent however. I would recommend the motel but only if you do not want to spend very long in your room. Breakfast was included but this was just a couple of buns/cakes that you had to eat on your way out as there is nowhere to sit and eat the food! We were not even informed what time the breakfast ran from/until and so often we missed out on breakfast. Good but do not expect too much.

answers.text: Breakfast was included, which is increasingly rare.

paragraphs.context: Jan 4 2009 Highly recommended I took a long time selecting a hotel in NYC, but this was a really great find. It is slap bang in the middle of Manhattan, very close to the Empire State Bld (I could see it from my hotel room window). My room was not very big, but clean and I loved the free wireless internet. The room heating could have been better: either it blows hot air or it is off. But this seems to be a general problem for the US, I noticed. Although the hotel is in the middle of the city that never sleeps, my room was incredibly quiet, so I could sleep very well. The room had a safe that was big enough to hold my 12 inch powerbook, camera etc. Breakfast was included, which is increasingly rare. The breakfast room could have been bigger, but breakfast itself was quite adequate, with coffee, tea, juices, bagels, toast, cheese etc. Next time I go to NYC I will certainly stay here again.

answers.text: We also enjoyed the free breakfast with a good variety of different foods - actually we do not really understand why each room has a kitchen as long as the breakfast is so good.

paragraphs.context: May 6 2008 Great hotel excellent location big rooms and good breakfast We stayed at this hotel for three nights and had a great experience. The room - or rather the suite - was pretty big compared to other hotels in NYC, with its own full size kitchen. We only used the coffee machine, though, and that worked perfectly. Very comfortable bed, nice flat screen tv and free Internet. We also enjoyed the free breakfast with a good variety of different foods - actually we do not really understand why each room has a kitchen as long as the breakfast is so good.

answers.text: The hotel also provided free continental breakfast which was great to take advantage of.

paragraphs.context: Jul 30 2006 First time to NYC loved Hotel QT We stayed in Hotel QT at the beginning of July on our first trip to NYC. As others have stated, Hotel QT is in a great location. 1 minute from Times Square, a few blocks from Rockefeller Center, and subway entrances. The hotel itself was very modern and well appointed. Our bed was very comfortable and while the room was small, we did not feel that we lacked any space. Storage was available under the raised bed which also helped. The hotel also provided free continental breakfast which was great to take advantage of. If you're looking for a more hearty breakfast, Cafe Europa is around the corner from the hotel and they have good breakfast items at cheap prices. The only complaint of the whole trip was that the pool was closed for maintenance. This did not stop us from enjoying the rest of the hotel and our stay. We would definately stay here again.

answers.text: $275 for one night/twin room with breakfast - by careful weekly checking managed to get this down to $190 including breakfast, two free drinks at the bar and a $5 voucher to spend in the "pantry". Exceptional value.

paragraphs.context: Jul 21 2009 Very good value ... Booked this hotel based on reviews - was not disappointed. Original booking price (on Hilton website) $275 for one night/twin room with breakfast - by careful weekly checking managed to get this down to $190 including breakfast, two free drinks at the bar and a $5 voucher to spend in the "pantry". Exceptional value. Rooms modern and fairly spacious with quality linens and towels. Free wi-fi in room. W 28th St is mainly filled with flower shops and the like but an ok area. Despite my Mother being in her late 70's it was not too far to walk to Times Square (in the rain!!!!). Staff at the hotel couldn't have been more helpful and the breakfast was excellent - freshly cooked to order and with good selection. Highly recommended.

answers.text: Great breakfasts!We had a very large room - maybe a junior suite.

paragraphs.context: Oct 19 2005 Perfect! The Imperial is a wonderfuly restored old Colonial hotel. Great location. Terrific rooms. Helpful, attentive staff. Great breakfasts!We had a very large room - maybe a junior suite. Very tall ceilings - peaceful, elegant. Great amenities. You can walk to some great markets and the Government Handicraft store is nearby. The grounds are beautiful. They serve both Indian and European food at breakfast, and we always had the Indian breakfast including the fresh lassi and fresh squeezed juices. Very clean. We would never stay in Delhi without staying in the Imperial.

qas.question: Does your breakfast include vegan options?

answers.text: Breakfast the following morning consisted of coffee, some pieces of fruit, a few croissants and some cold cereal in the concierge lounge.

paragraphs.context: Jan 26 2005 Wouldn't really recommend unless you get a GREAT deal We arrived to find that our room was on the street level and EXTREMELY loud with tour busses right outside our window. In addition the room was quite small. Went back to the front desk and inquired about a quieter room and was told nothing was available since the hotel was under construction. Ultimately we were offered an upgrade to a quiet, larger room for $50 plus tax. He could tell we were unsure so he offered to throw in breakfast. The new room was quiet although hardly larger. Breakfast the following morning consisted of coffee, some pieces of fruit, a few croissants and some cold cereal in the concierge lounge. The gentleman in charge there was extremely rude. At exactly 10:00 he proceeded to kick everybody out, even those who were still eating their breakfast. We ended up grabbing a banana and a cup of coffee on our way out. Overall it was ok, but hardly worth the $200/night we ended up paying.

answers.text: We arrived 3 times in morning at breakfast and were upgraded to "french breakfast restaurant" for reason of occupation in the normal restaurant (wich was already very compleet).

paragraphs.context: Aug 10 2009 A nice place in Beijing near Silkmarket. Swimmingpool etc. included We booked this hotel for 5 nights per advise of our local Guide contact, for reason of good location (next to silkmarket) and the many Hotel facilities like indoor Swimmingpool, Sauna and good breakfast/diner facilities. All in all good vallue for money. We arrived 3 times in morning at breakfast and were upgraded to "french breakfast restaurant" for reason of occupation in the normal restaurant (wich was already very compleet). Further more we enjoyed very much the indoor swimming pool facility, after having walked a lot on day-time doing the cultural sceneries. Would stay for sure next time here for leasure trip.

answers.text: After reading recent reviews before our trip, I did not think we would have the breakfast, but were given vouchers for each day.

paragraphs.context: May 6 2006 Great stay at the Avalon Wonderful stay at the Avalon in late April 2006. Booked a jr suite and all were filled when we arrived and were upgraded to a king suite. After reading recent reviews before our trip, I did not think we would have the breakfast, but were given vouchers for each day. Breakfast was very good, not the normal continental breakfast. Hot eggs, pancakes, bacon, sausage, fresh fruit, bagels, muffins etc. All the employees treated us very well. Our room was large and very quiet, never heard a siren or the early morning trash trucks. Close to subways and an easy walk to many sites. Saw 'the rat' the morning we left. From the reviews, I was not sure what it was all about. Something to do with a labor union. This was my second trip to NYC and would definitely stay at the Avalon again.

answers.text: Although they did manage to provide breakfast.

paragraphs.context: May 16 2006 European Flair My husband and I stayed at the Majestic May 8-10. We had a parking package, which included a 1 bedroom suite, parking, breakfast, and I thought evening drinks(which the website stated). We loved the suite-it was huge, but did have that old musty smell that other postings spoke about. The breakfast was o.k., and so was the service. I also wish they would have told me that the parking package didnt include all that it said on the website, e.g.-that evening drinks and snacks are not included, since the bar and restaurant are being renovated. Although they did manage to provide breakfast. But, all in all we loved the charm and ambience of this old world hotel.

answers.text: Breakfast is chaotic because so many people (breakfast is till 10:30AM).

paragraphs.context: May 8 2007 Good Value during Labor Day Holiday My third stay in this hotel. The entire hotel is little bit dated butwell maintained. Room is clean and very good service. Breakfast is chaotic because so many people (breakfast is till 10:30AM). Waited 10 minutes for a table on the 3rd day. But waiters/waitress, captains, managers were trying to do their best. Reason there are so many people staying in Hilton is they have a special price of RMB678 (each day) which is abt US$87 for local Chinese including breakfast for two during the Labor Day Golden Week Holiday. My price is US$295 per person including Dragon Air Hong Kong to Shanghai return and 3 nights in Hilton(on twin share basis) with daily breakfast. So it is a good deal

answers.text: How silly if there are 4 members in the room and only 2 get the free breakfasts?!?

paragraphs.context: Jan 14 2009 Good location Stayed on the 41st floor and it was very quiet. Could not hear the street noise at all. Likes: Complimentary internet 'cos of Gold Hilton Honors MembershipLarge room with sofa bedMini fridge and microwaveWarm cookies every eveningNear subway (47 St Subway - N,R,W line)Right in the heart of Times Square!Dislikes: Lousy breakfast policy - all members in the room should get the free breakfast, especially if we are Gold Hilton Honors Members. How silly if there are 4 members in the room and only 2 get the free breakfasts?!? I think Doubletree need to rethink their breakfast policy. Lousy service in the restaurant - understaffed

answers.text: I was disappointed by the lack of a breakfast buffet and the fact that you can't have breakfast before 7.00 am.

paragraphs.context: Aug 9 2009 Nice hotel - excellent location friendly staff small rooms Very friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are very small, but you get all you need. There is no view of anything except the other building across the street. Being a breakfast addict I was disappointed by the lack of a breakfast buffet and the fact that you can't have breakfast before 7.00 am. Eating a la carte for breakfast takes to long and gets you too little food in my opinion.

answers.text: The parking is free and there is a contintental breakfast included.

paragraphs.context: Sep 29 2007 Located in rough area We stayed in the Best Western Civic Center Motor Inn from August 7th for three nights. We booked it based on the good reviews we read on trip advisor. The room was basic and and noise from traffic was loud when the windows were open, which was needed as there is no air-con. The parking is free and there is a contintental breakfast included. However the breakfast was served in the reception area which is small and so breakfast resembled a rugby scrum with everyone trying to get to their bagels & muffins. The motel is located in a rough area and we did not feel very safe walking in the area at night. If I had paid a cheaper rate I might have been more satisfied but $160 a night was poor value

answers.text: Only downside was the breakfast area was very full and ended up perched on one of the stools along the wall.

paragraphs.context: Jan 2 2009 Only $99! Had to find a hotel at the last minute due to a change of plan and found this for only $99 (plus tax) on the hotels website. Great location, loads of space in the suite and good free breakfast. Only downside was the breakfast area was very full and ended up perched on one of the stools along the wall. Could have taken the breakfast back to my room though. For the price it was a steal. Clean, friendly staff and great location.

answers.text: The pool was great, and warm.

paragraphs.context: Nov 3 2008 Perfect accomodation A week at the Grandview was given to us as a gift to celebrate our 50th wedding anniversary. We have been to Las Vegas many times and always stayed on or near the strip. No more!! We were welcomed graciously, and made to feel at home. Our suite was very beautiful and convenient. A great surprise was the closeness to the South Point Casino. Just a close walk across the side street, and we did that often. The pool was great, and warm. We mixed our own cocktails and small lunch and sat by the pool to enjoy. Parking was never a problem. We had a unit overlooking the pool on the back side of Sage. We always found a spot in the back making it very convenient to enter to our room. The grounds were very clean, as was the building. After the congestion and noise of "the Strip" it was so welcoming to return to the peace and quiet of the Grandview.

answers.text: and it was verrry hot!

paragraphs.context: May 11 2009 Would definetley stay again This was a great place and location also. The room was very nice. We were upgraded to a Resort room and it was a lot roomier and also had double sinks which was nice. Only thing I can say is that I kept hearing a very faint thud thud thud all day and night - I think it was from the elevator. But we werent right near it. We tried Planet Dailies, Yolos and also the spice market buffet during our stay and it was great food at all 3 places. We loved Yolos the most. We also used the pool and hot tub. They were both nice and they also had drink service at the pool only complaint was that it was slow... I think since only 1 gal was working the pool area it seemed and it was verrry hot! We really liked the location and it was nice to just roam the shops at Miracle Miles rather than go out in the heat during the day. Nice choice of shops too. We would surley stay at PH again if we're in Vegas.

qas.question: Are children allowed to use the pool?

answers.text: It was impossible to go into the pool, because of the families with kids (tons of them), they also had a dining area right next to the pool which made the pool area extremely crowded and noisy.

paragraphs.context: Jul 26 2004 Hate the service! We went there 4th of July weekend. I chose Hilton because of its reputation and most importantly it had an outdoor pool. It was definitely an unpleasant experience for us. The receptionist was very unpolite and unhelpful, the room was extremely noisy and after the first night I asked them to change it, at least they were fine with it. The hotel was extremely crowded, probably because of the festival. It was impossible to go into the pool, because of the families with kids (tons of them), they also had a dining area right next to the pool which made the pool area extremely crowded and noisy. Needless to say I had no fun at all. Plus the check out person was really unprofessional and I had to report her. The manager was responsive though. I had one of my worst vacations in a 5 star hotel. The service we received was definitely not even 1 star. I would never go there again.

answers.text: Showers by poolside have hot and cold water.

paragraphs.context: Apr 29 2007 Great hotel Excellent Service Stayed at Westin April 22-27. Excellent service. it is a smaller hotel just minutes from strip. Attention to detail is consistent. Starbucks coffee in room, robes in room. Free bottled water in room. Evening turndown service. Umbrellas at poolside. Showers by poolside have hot and cold water. Pool is actually open till 2Am. Unheard of in the other hotels. From entrance of hotel to strip is about the same time you would spend getting from the entrance of the bigger hotels to your room. NO Kidding. Nearby convenience store has deli and food inexpensive. It is convient to everything. Approximately $12 to airport from hotel. Near Bally's and Bellagio. I've stayed at Venetian and Hilton. The service at the Westin was way superior. I think because its smaller you can get personal attention. I highly recommend this hotel.

answers.text: Matress was very odd - it seemed fine once used to it, but to start with it felt like we were sinking into it!Pool area was nice, with two permanent attendants - warmest pool we used during two weeks and six hotels visited.

paragraphs.context: Nov 23 2005 Dated rooms nice pool The rooms here are dated and in need of refurbishment. Very small bathroom (do not try swinging a cat!). Matress was very odd - it seemed fine once used to it, but to start with it felt like we were sinking into it!Pool area was nice, with two permanent attendants - warmest pool we used during two weeks and six hotels visited. The free shuttle bus to and from the Strip is very useful - and regular. The last one back to the hotel is at 12:30am, so make sure you're outside the Barbary Coast before then!

qas.question: Are children allowed to use the pool?

answers.text: The only thing is I wish they would have a small non-smoking area near these pools for families with children or for adults with medical conditions that would prefer a non-smoking area.

paragraphs.context: Oct 12 2009 Great for families except for the smoking in the pool area They have the lazy river and the wave pool that is an attraction in itself for our 6 year old and our 16 year old. The only thing is I wish they would have a small non-smoking area near these pools for families with children or for adults with medical conditions that would prefer a non-smoking area. The hotel is across the street from the M&M store, the arcade, and the roller coaster in the New York New York, which was perfect for our kids. If you try this hotel and agree with the non-smoking area please let them know so that maybe this will change soon. After a relaxing day at the pool it was great to enjoy the Buffet with a Pasta Station and Asian Food Station, especially at 2 for 1.

answers.text: The first night the patio plastic furniture was in the freezing cold and dirty pool, allow with many porn newspaper flyers.

paragraphs.context: Apr 12 2006 Stay somewhere else! This place is in need of serious repair. Located next to the Harley Davidson Cafe, it shares the alley in which several people use as a toilet. The sounds of the Harley engines and people drinking/ partying all night will not allow for rest. The first night the patio plastic furniture was in the freezing cold and dirty pool, allow with many porn newspaper flyers. The maintenance did clean out the furniture and paper the next day, but left the dead bird in the pool. My husband got the net and retrieved the bird to throw it away. The room needed new carpeting, as many stains were all over and was worn through in spots. This is a not so cheap motel, as we spent $69 Thurs. $ 125 Fri. and $125 Sat. All other motels were full and with the cancellation policy, we were pretty much stuck. The location is great, but boy do not plan on spending anytime here. We actually slept by the pool one afternoon because the room was not appealing.

qas.question: Are children allowed to use the pool?

answers.text: My daughter had dove into the pool to grab a toy from the bottom and had a paint chip wedged under her finger nail.

paragraphs.context: Aug 10 2004 So So Essex Stayed at the Essex the last week of July 2004. Hotel was ok , rooms are small but that is to be expected in some of the older hotels. Beds are small, I think they are full-size. Carpets were in need of a shampooing. Very dirty and stained. Pool area is nice but, beware of peeling paint on the bottom of the pool. My daughter had dove into the pool to grab a toy from the bottom and had a paint chip wedged under her finger nail. We had to mention this to the desk people twice and no one seemed to want to report it to management. Another thing about the pool area, make sure you have your room key or you will be acosted by the desk clerk/lifeguard. If you have children under the age of 18, they are not permitted to use the new workout room. If we had been aware of that fact we would have picked another hotel, that information is not listed on the website (that I could find). Our children are in their teens and were not allowed to use the facilites.

qas.question: Are children allowed to use the pool?

answers.text: I did not bring my kid, but the kids pool was fantastic, and included play structures.

paragraphs.context: Aug 28 2009 Excellent experience attentive staff. I spent three days here on a business trip and enjoyed my experience. The lobby was expansive and accomodating, the service was excellent, the pool was great, and the breakfast was perfect. I did have one complaint... my room was "non-smoking," however, it was clear that this room was probably "smoking" at one point in time, and the "stink" was still there. It needed either a cleansing or a replacement of carpet/paint to eliminate the odor. The breakfast buffet was one of the most expansive and will presented I've ever experienced! I'm not crazy about pools that are over 6' deep in the main section (you can't walk!) but overall it was not that bad. I did not bring my kid, but the kids pool was fantastic, and included play structures. Mine would have loved it. The "action" is in Jemeriah, and this hotel is not in that area. However, the cab ride is only about $10 from here, making it a non-issue.

qas.question: Are children allowed to use the pool?

paragraphs.context: May 31 2009 Wonderful Hotel - travel agent review... Hotel is really nice, no complaints at all. paragraphs.context: May 25 2009 It's all true. It's great!!! When I read reviews before staying at the hotel I could not believe it would be true. But the hotel was great, nice room, nice staff, great service, good location..... I also found really good to have free wifi in the room. Gym was one of the biggest I've seen in a hotel. The only disadvantage is that as mentioned in other reviews, this hotel should have a pool designated for adults only. The hotel has 3 pools and the first two days we were fine, but then the last 3 days all 3 pools were invaded by children. Please do not get me wrong, there are children that behave very well and there are adults that behave worse than children, but if you're travelling without children you would prefer to stay away form them :) So the hotel's 3 pools & gardens are big enough to get a designated area for adults. Anyway I would go back to this hotel, and I strongly recommend it.

We loved our room--the beds were VERY comfortable--the best hotel bed I ever slept on, with cozy bedding. The carpets and wallpaper showed some wear in our room, however. The bathrooms were large; the water pressure under the rain-shower and the whirlpool were wonderful. Very enjoyable to use. Amenities in the bathroom were nice. Overall, it was very quiet and relaxing. The hotel was clean, well vacuumed, and smelled fresh. The pool was also refreshing; the water temperature just right. The poolside restaurant offered great sandwiches and drinks. Walkways outside were enjoyable, with palm trees, flowers, and water areas with small waterfalls. Almost all staff were attentive and hospitable. The restaurants and casino were great!Because the resort is so large, I think it needed more directional signs, even though a resort map is provided.

paragraphs.context: Aug 13 2007 First its a hotel. Spent 5 nights at this starwood hotel. Check-in was a breeze, no one in line. I laughed to myself because the first thing that stood out was a great looking bed, with a teddy bear sitting in the middle of it. There were plenty of bars of soap, body wash, shampoo, conditioners, towels, a coffee maker, and even a rubber ducky!!!Pool was small, but never crowded. Didn't realize that they actually cool the water in the pool. There's also a whilpool, which was a nice touch. Service was great... the waitress never let you get thirsty. A small casino, with the blackjack table going every time I looked. Craps table had wagers from $1 to $100, something I do not see too often. Starbucks coffee was really convenient in the morning. Valets were always available, with no waits for my car. A quick walk to the strip, and really easy to get to Ballys across the street.

We will look at Hampton properties in the years to come!

paragraphs.context: Sep 19 2007 a good place to stay The Desert Paradise resort is situated about 2 miles from the strip, running parallel to it. It is in quite a quiet location,but the road can be busy in the morning. The apartments are well appointed with plenty of closet space. There is a good sized room for washing and drying. The car parking is undercover which keeps the cars cool from the sun. The swimming pool area can only be entered by use of the door keys. There is also a good water play area for the children. There is a family pool and hot tub, as well as an adult only pool and hot tub,(closed for the entire week we were there) Unfortunately there is no control over whether children go in the adult only pool. A minibus goes down to the strip, but only at certain times in the early evening. Parking is free at the casinos. There is coffee available in the reception area. A good place to stay.

paragraphs.context: Aug 31 2009 No notice of closed pool for renovation! We reserved our room at the Courtyard by Marriott months in advance for this family vacation. One VERY important element of any of our hotel reservations is that the hotel must have a pool for our kids. Well, we arrive at the Courtyard by Marriott only to be told the pool is closed for renovation. Are you kidding me?? The staff apologized and said that we could use the pool at the Conference Center Marriott (a 10-12 minute walk) for a fee of $10 per person. Are you kidding me?? After stating my displeasure they said they would pay for the Marriott pool fee for us - thanks but no thanks. Why not notify us about the pool renovation in their confirmation email we received just days before our arrival?? This is the second year in a row we had issues with a Courtyard by Marriott hotel - last year we arrived at another Courtyard by Marriott only to find out they gave our room away and had no room for us...

paragraphs.context: Apr 11 2009 Loved the Arjaan. I booked 7 nights in a standard classic one bedroom apartment, on check in I was upgraded to a 3 bedroom apartment. It was amazing, two king bedrooms, one twin, maids room, and 5 bathrooms. Huge kitchen, dining room, living room and numerous balconies. Hotel was spotless the beds changed nearly everyday. There are only 2 things that I was disappointed with in the Arjaan. The pool area is lovely and has a heated pool, but there are only 20 sunloungers at the pool so if you are not up before 9.30 am all the sunloungers are gone and you have to sit on the grass. Also it was extremely difficult to get a taxi from the front of the hotel at peak times as the entrance is not on the main road and taxis do not pass the hotel entrance. Overall, I had a wonderful time in the Arjaan and would recommend it to friends/family.

All hotel staff was polite from the staff at the check in desk, breakfast staff, cocktail servers at the complimentary reception each evening to the doormen who flagged down a cab for us each day. The location worked great for us. We took cabs to some museums, but this hotel was walking distance to the John Hancock tower, Michigan Avenue, The Art Institute and Navy Pier. You may pay a little extra for Embassy Suites, but with the hot breakfast and the complimentary cocktail reception, you get your money's worth. Amazing view via the U shaped window. Very clean rooms. Good bathroom products. Dressing room is neat... THE BAD>The hot tub was broken, windows were broken above the pool area. Pool is very hard to find. Bathrooms are SMALL. If you are going with a loved one, this is NOT a good hotel to have bathroom time together in. There is no balconey so you have no idea how to dress until you get down the 36 floors. No continental breakfast, unless you pay 17$ a head. The pillows were too thin alone, and too high stacked. I had read the reviews on ta and was worried that we were going to have a bad stay. We had such a wonderful experience from start to finish. We took our 8-year-old son with us and he loved it. It was not that crowded and there was no problem finding a chair no matter if we were at the wave pool, lazy river or the reg pool. paragraphs.context: Jun 9 2005 great Bargin for Budget Travelers Stayed there Memorial Day Weekend for a nite, and a week later for another nite. Easy check in and employees were very friendly and polite. Got a one bedroom suite for family of 5 and worked out well with youngest on floor. Parents got seperate room and A/C worked great. Quiet and they have lots of great perks like free wash/dry and a little store that was a bargin compared to everything else in Vegas. Suites fully equipped and lots of storage for food if your going to be there several days. Free rental of VHS tapes and a nice pool area with spa. Only dislike was we were up towards the main area and the pool was far to the rear. If you plan on using the pool alot with small kids, request a room above 165/265/365. Will stay again, especially if I can grab another internet deal like this time. You won't touch these rates on the strip on a weekend nite.

paragraphs.context: Aug 24 2009 Nice building good location not quite finished. Stayed there for three nights in early August. Everyone there was very helpful and the hotel is located in a very convenient location in Montreal. It is a brand new hotel and is somewhat trendy and well designed. Several problems came up over our stay. First there were not refrigerators in every room. We order one from the front desk but they were all taken. They put us on a waiting list but we never received a fridge. Also the wireless internet was broken on our floor. We couldn't find any do not disturb signs and were constantly being bothered by the cleaning staff. While there is a pool in the building it is rather small. The heater for the pool was broken during our stay and the general pool area is not all that nice. I wouldn't stay at this hotel again unless I was 100% certain all of these problems were fixed.

paragraphs.context: Mar 22 2008 Never Stay Here!!! I will never stay at this hotel ever again. The staff at the front desk was VERY rude. We were told we could check in at a certain time by one employee but were yelled at by another employee when we came back at the time we were told. The pool with a swimup bar and blackjack was heavily advertised online and when we booked the rooms they never told us it was going to be closed the days we were there. We were told we were supposed to know to ask if the pool was going to be open when we booked the room. They justified not telling us the pool was going to be closed by saying they had another pool and 2 hot tubs open (the open pool was basically a kiddie pool). We ended up having to go to the Excalibur pool to swim. The elevators were out of order. The hallway by our room and the room itself smelled awful. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. Pay a little more and stay somewhere else!

paragraphs.context: Apr 12 2004 Location location location This hotel has an excellent location, tucked between many of the finest hotels of the city, and is close to Union Square. Many of the hotels we tried to book were full, but we were able to get a good rate here, which included breakfast. Were I to stay there again, I would go for the rate which includes parking ($27 a day, going rate in the city). The decor is very handsome and the bed is one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in, period. The pool is not of resort caliber, but it is well tended, heated and my two boys were happy to splash about after a day in the city. HOWEVER, there is a huge difference in the rooms overlooking the alley as opposed to those by the pool. The noise from the alley kept me awake all night. They were able to offer me a different room for the second night of our stay and it made all the difference in the world. The rooms on the "pool side" are larger and very quiet at night.

paragraphs.context: Sep 24 2006 Great for families We were two families and stayed there for two nights. pro: Very clean and well kept. Attentive staff esp if you leave a tip for the housekeepers. The market store in the lobby is good. There was absolutely no pressure to buy time share. Probably best for families with small kids who want to stay away from the casino scene or expose the kids to the crowds there. We ended up getting a studio attached to a one bedroom and it became a two bedroom when the door was openned in between them. Con: noise from construction next door but was not a big deal except when in pool. The swimming pool was not shallow enough for small kids and was split in half . Instead of having a larger pool, there were two smaller ones. Overall, great place to stay with kids and would definitely consider it again.

answers.text: Big, warm, clean pool.

paragraphs.context: Oct 15 2008 A Pleasant Overnight at the Essex My daughter and I stayed overnight at the Essex for a trip to the American Girl Place. Our total bill, including valet parking, was about $160. For downtown Chicago, I would call this a very good value. The desk service was friendly and efficient. The room, recently refurbished, was clean and fresh. The bed was very, very comfy. Overall, the room was a little on the small side - I'd call it compact - the bathroom had a shower only and one of those teeny sinks. There was a flat screen TV but no pay-per-view. The pool was a real standout - a large indoor pool, glassed in, with plantings outside - on the fourth floor. Big, warm, clean pool. Nice-looking workout area adjacent. Sunny, with lots of deck chairs, a magazine rack, chess set, etc. Teeny towels, though!Only negative - the free shuttle never showed up and we had to make a mad dash for our "tea" appointment. Taxi fare to the AG place was less than $10 including tip.

paragraphs.context: Jan 14 2007 Better than Jumeirah Beach etc etc etc I have visited Dubai 5 times, staying at hotels such as Jumeirah Beach. However Ritz Carlton exceeds them all. Stayed in Club room - which was worth the extra - free booze and light snacks, although would be great if this included drinks from pool bar during the day (but that is probably asking too much)! The Sea View room only really looked out onto pool - but everything else was faultless. Good price and definitly worth a trip. Sea was unbearably hot to swim in - so had to stick to the 'cooled' pool. The building work behind was visually obvious but not obtrusive, being barely audible. Did the 50 a head afternoon tea at Burj al Arab - kind of worth it for the experience - but would not do it again. Would prefer a stay at the Ritz Carlton to one there. Looking at the photo - the hotel is the 3-4 storey building at base of sky scrapers!definitely one of the jewels of Dubais crown!

paragraphs.context: Jul 1 2009 Good find Nice hotel, very friendly staff and located short walk from the strip (5-10 minute walk from Wynns & Encore). It's also within walking distance of the light rail system. Hotel, rooms and pool were clean. The pool currently overlooks Wynns & Encore, but it is located just off the street and entrance to the garage. Therefore, you'll hear traffic noise. The pool area is not very big, so if there are noisy guests or kids you'll have nowhere to seek quietness. Free self parking offered. Very comfortable bed - double beds were not offered. Free connection to your airline check-in site is offered, so you can print your boarding pass in the lobby. Wireless connection is offered in your room. I would stay here again.
